Good morning,

Matthew 20:27 And whoever desires to be first among you, let him be your slave 28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many."

In our time to be called a servant appears to be an insult to many. It could imply slavery to some, that does not sound nice or appear pretty. A servant is a person who serves others, an individual who performs duties about the person or home of a master or personal employer. Servants have always been expected to fulfill their duties and many servants either meet the expectations or fall below. Very rare do you hear of servants going beyond the required duty striving for excellence. I think that it's hard to desire to become a servant, to stoop low and serve than to be served. I believe this is the reason we need to be praying to the Lord to MAKE US SERVANTS. On our own we would rather wait to be served. To walk with the Lord is to die to self and be willing to be made a servant. Jesus said as recorded in Matthew 20:27" And whoever desires to be first among you, let him be your slave 28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many." This should be the highest honor to be called a servant (slave) of God, to serve as He served. He led by example and what blesses my heart is what He did shortly before He was betrayed. He knew His disciples would be scattered, one would betray Him, the other would deny Him. He would be left alone to face accusations, yet knowing Himself and His disciples well, He stands and does the unthinkable, John 13:2 says, "And supper being ended, the devil having already put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray Him, 3 Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come from God and was going to God, 4 rose from supper and laid aside His garments, took a towel and girded Himself. 5 After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel with which He was girded". Isn't it easy to serve the people who are nice to you, who esteem you, who value you, who respond to you etc? Here we see the Master who had been given all things into His hands, deserved to be served and honored turn around, lay aside His royal garment of glory, take a towel and wash the dirtiest, smelly, crooked feet. If we must wash, it would be easy to pick the part of the body that would be easy and cleaner to wash, let's say hands or hair. What a level of service the Son of God would give. This was going beyond what we would call duty to excellence. He could have served them by performing miracles like He had done, teach them, lead them. What He did showed the highest service a man can give another man for the glory of God in the sense that as disciples of Christ, we are to follow the Master's example. If you go back to the bible you will find that God's appointed prophets, kings, and judges were not called by their titles, He called them "MY SERVANTS", My servant David, My servant Moses, My servant Elijah.  Why do we find it hard to be indentified as servants today? We would want everyone to call us by our titles yet God does not call us by our titles, He calls us servants. Look at some of these men God called servants; they laid down their lives for their Master. Worked themselves to death, were poured out like a drink offering. Did not just do the required, they did more than required. They strived for excellence. Men like Paul, James, Simon Peter, Jude and others did not just refer to themselves as servants, they called themselves
BONDSERVANTS, dead to self and alive in Christ. A bondservant in the dictionary means a person bound to serve in bondage and without wages. Wow, wouldn't we rather serve when we know there is something in the end for us? Those who want to be great in God's kingdom must learn to be servants of all. Do you consider yourself a servant of the Lord or better, a bondservant of the Lord? When was the last time you went out of your way and washed someone's feet? And by that I mean meeting someone's need, going out of your way, doing something you would not normally do?. To the world they would wonder what's wrong with you but to you it will be the highest service you can give to your brother to the glory of God. Psalm 116:16, "O LORD, truly I am Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your maidservant; You have loosed my bonds.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 11:29, “For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable”

Car manufacturers fascinate me. Each of them have built different types of cars, some customized to suit the buyers. For instant, Mercedes Benz can have one of their built cars, look alike but different classes like C class and the S class series. You may find two cars look the same but their cost is different. One could have more upgrades than the other (sunroof, navigation system, more power etc) that make one more expensive than the other. Everyone has a reason for going for different type of cars depending on what they are looking for in a car and what they can afford. Cars can be upgraded and customized. Here is the reason for bringing this up, just because a car has been made does not mean there is no more room to either upgrade or customize it. For us humans we have God our maker who made us and still is willing to upgrade us with gifts and talents.

Let’s explore what talents are. According to the dictionary, talents are marked innate ability, as for artistic accomplishments. It’s natural endowment. We are different in order to maintain our individuality. With the uniqueness of each of us, we have talents and abilities. I was watching something on TV not too long ago, and they brought these young kids of about 10 years and under. They all had different talents and abilities. One at the age of 4 could sing and dance Elvis songs; there was also a 4 year old girl who had such knowledge of the government and politics. Talents is what you have that very few people have. Talent in singing, writing poetry, dancing, public speaking. At my house I have brothers talented in drawing portraits, another in poetry and another in playing drums, different talents but fitting in one household. I believe God allows us to have talents to enjoy and trade with them to reach His people.

Mathew 25:14, “For the kingdom of heaven is like a man traveling to a far country, who called his own servants and delivered his goods to them. vs. 15, “And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to each according to his own ability; and immediately he went on a journey”. We don’t know what they might have been given to do but it’s clear that what they were asked to do was according to their own abilities. The Master knew what they were capable of; he bestowed goods and talents to them. He expected them to do something with the talents to the maximum. Are you using your God given talents to the maximum? Each of them doubled their goods through their talents except the last man who buried his because he only had one. The rest were rewarded according to the way they used their talent, the last one was denied and even that which he had was taken away.

When we come back to talking about gifts, we understand that gifts are not things worked for but bestowed without any plan for compensation. Anytime you pay for a gift, it wouldn’t be considered as a gift anymore. The good God of mercy has taken the liberty to bestow gifts in us for a reason. The gifts are to be used to edify the body of Christ. All the gifts of the saints fall back to the Holy Spirit that empowers men to do what they would not do on their own. Once again, each of us have different gifts, Romans 12:6, “Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, let us use them”. The gifts we have also differs because of the measure of grace and faith and has to be put to work. Regardless of what we have, God requires us to use them. What are some of the spiritual gifts, prophesy, ministry, teaching, leadership, mercy, exhortation. All these gifts and many more originate from the same Spirit and are to be used to benefit the body. I have my own and I can also tap from someone who has the gift I don’t have. This is the part where we need each other for the gifts we have to benefit each other. 1Corinthians 12:7, “But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one for the profit of all”, Romans 12 and 1Corithians 12 talks about spiritual gifts and what they are for. Before men, gifts are for self while with God, gifts are to benefit the entire body of Christ. If God has given you a gift and talents you are not using in your local church, you are missing the opportunity to maximize that gift. The body has different parts, the hands, legs, eyes, ears to mention a few. All have different functions but depend on each other. It’s like saying the hands have the gift to handle, touch, build; meanwhile the legs have the gift to carry, move, and help escape danger. Different functions but depend on each other. The hands needs the legs, ears, eyes etc for it to be complete and so is the giftings we have that other people don’t and what they have that we don’t have. We need our gifts and their gifts and vice versa. Romans 11:29, “For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable”, interesting to know that His gifts are irreversible, in other words, they are final. I believe God will not take away what he has bestowed upon us, but if we are not using them, it will not be rewarding to us or people around us. We all have gifts and talents on board, let’s maximize them to build and further His kingdom. The more you use them, the more you allow room for gifts upgrade. The more you empty yourself with what you have, the more gifts will be bestowed upon you. Blessings Ev evipooh@gmail.com

content.rendered:
Praise be to the Lord!

Its wonderful serving God and its more wonderful and a blessing to me when I see people on fire for God. My husband has been a source of spiritual challenge for me ever since I knew him and I thank God for bringing him into my life at the perfect time. I have really grown spiritually in the past year, reading devotions and being ministered to by my husband. My prayer life has certainly taken a different turn and although am not where I used to be a couple of years ago, am happy that by the grace of God am heading there and much more.

I cannot really pinpoint any devotion that has ministered to me more than the other, I think every time I read what God has for me from Evans and Pastor Phil its always a delight and there is always a lesson to be learned and something to think about and challenge my walk with the Lord. For example, am I in the right track? Am I doing all that I can to serve the Lord? Am I living for God and not one foot with him and the other in the world? Am I an example to the world that God wants me to be? Being challenged in areas of forgiveness, love, patience, kindness, etc and mostly for me forgiveness. Am I praising God even at times when I feel I cannot do it anymore because things are a mess a round me? Do I still trust in him even when I feel like am loosing battles? And so on and so forth.

In addition, being challenged in areas of separating myself from the world. Nowadays I think Christianity has been underrated! According to freedictionary.com underrate means not being able to take account of the full abilities or potential of something (paraphrased). Christianity has been reduced to the same; I remember there was a time that Christianity meant more than just words. Nowadays everyone is a Christian and yet they live like the devil. So its been encouraging to read from Evans and Pastor Phil and different readers who have shared once in a while and I pray that this coming year will be a year of continued many blessings for this ministry in a big way, in your personal lives, and in the lives of devotion team members!

God Bless you all,

Judy Olang.

1 Corinthians 2: 1 And I, brethren, when I came to you, did not come with excellence of speech or of wisdom declaring to you the testimony of God. 2 For I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified. 3 I was with you in weakness, in fear, and in much trembling. 4 And my speech and my preaching were not with persuasive words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power, 5 that your faith should not be in the wisdom of men but in the power of God.

As we celebrate our 7th year anniversary, glory be to God for great things He has done and this far He has brought us. When I think about His faithfulness, all I do is humble myself because He has shown Himself so strong on behalf of those who put their confidence in Him. He uses the weak, the despised, and the rejected to get His work done so that He gets all the glory for working in such a life. “THE ONLY POSSIBLE WAY THAT JESUS CHRIST WILL GET GLORY OUT OF A LIFE THAT HE’S REDEEMED WITH HIS PRECIOUS BLOOD IS WHEN HE CAN FILL THAT LIFE WITH HIS PRESENCE AND LIVE THROUGH IT HIS OWN LIFE.”, Paris Readhead.

I sense there are people who would desire to be used of God but are feeling like they do not have what it takes to be what God can do through them, over the years I have learnt that God is not looking for those with abilities to use, He is looking for those who are avalailable and let my testimony be an encouragement to you.

I was born and raised in Kenya, Africa. In my early years, I lived with my parents in a small town until at around the age of 10 that I moved to the village to live with my grand mother as my dad was going away to the States for further studies. I lived with my dear grandma, a praying woman for 6years. I had a normal childhood, very skinny though. I was called all sorts of names (none of them made me feel bad); I was never good at school, had to repeat two classes, graduated with no great grades to go to high school and graduated from high school also with no great grades. I was what you would call an average student. I was the shyest boy you could think of, I have battled fear all my life still does. Having come from a Christian family, I was the last one to become born again (thanks to a praying mom and dad) in my late teenage years.

Having been born again, I don’t recall being discipled but God’s hand was on my life, I began from humble beginnings, stumbled on the way, witnessed to my friends though I did not know much, so I witnessed in the way I knew how. 5 years later, God would plan to move me from the land I knew all my life to The States where he would have a call for me. Imagine moving from a soil you are used to, with people around you to help you grow strong in the Lord to a land that was totally new to me with no one but my parents. Already there were people who had come to The States born again, backslide and gave a bad testimony. This made others believe that I would fall in the same trap, that is backslide. I remember praying to God and saying “Lord, you can prove everyone wrong, if you’ve saved me, you are able to keep me even in a land where things are new, new temptations, new devils. In 1997 God moved me to The States despite the fact that I fought it. Just before I came, He gave me a picture that made no sense but we know God knows what He is doing. He showed me that transplanting me from what I was used to, to a new ground will be hard for me. It’s like you take a plant growing in a seed bed with others, looking good healthy and sheltered, then moving it to a new ground exposed to everything else. Chances are, the first few weeks and months it will look like its dying, the green leaves might turn brown and fall off but the roots will continue to dig deep with new changes. That is what happened to me, my first year was hell, temptations left and right, no friends, the girl I was dating hoping to marry broke up with me, thought I would be raised to be a singer or worship leader, that went down the drain, struggled to pray even for 10 minutes all my life, had no peace but God knew. I had my parents around who had been such a great encouragement but it felt like God was taking me through a wilderness experience, to refine me. The desire to be used of Him was there, the process is what I did not know..

In the midst of drying season, the Lord began to minister to my heart; the first thing He gave me was PEACE THAT SURPASSES ALL UNDERSTANDING. He began to teach me how to ENCOURAGE MYSELF IN HIM and ENCOURAGE OTHERS, and He began to teach me to PRAY effectively. This is 5 years after being saved far away from home. I moved from just sitting down doing nothing but knowing I am going to heaven to being pregnant and refusing to die with what God was depositing in me as I opened my heart to His leading. I was a nobody as you have read already. I saw a young man preach to the youths one day and I said to myself and to the Lord, “Lord if you can use him to preach, you can use me to preach”, it wasn’t out of jealousy, it was out of a heart that felt there was more God could do through a life yielded to Him for His own glory. See God loves to take the nobodies who are open to Him and use them as He displays His glory that people may see His power and trust in Him. God began to teach me to preach to the youths, in churches but my main calling was to be a prayer warrior. Right when I thought what He called me to do was established to now be maintained, He opened a door for me to come and work for GE with no college education (I hope to complete soon praise God), landed in a good job but It was clear from day one that my coming to GE would not be to make money but do ministry. The first three years were a little quiet, nothing major. Got to do ministry one on one here and there. It would be clear of what the Lord had called me to do when a friend of mine who would always stop by my desk having seen me with a bible ask me a few questions in relation to the bible. Not long after she got saved and I was the first people she shared with her conversion. When France Neptune shared her testimony of her salvation with me, God stirred my heart to email her words of encouragements which was now turning into a discipleship opportunity for her and a few people I knew were Christians. . I did not have any big vision for anything, what started as little encouragement here and there turned into a ministry.

I did not know how best to disciple, that is when the idea to send devotions was birthed. With my poor writing skills, wasn’t sure how that would work and how I would do it, I began slowly by slowly trusting the Lord who stirred my heart to help me through. What was to be like once a week snowballed to 5 days a week. With struggle to read the bible and no bible college experience, only God could raise me up to do the impossible. All the college trainings are great and hope to complete them and I praise God for the workings through them, it appears God chose to work with me differently first and that has humbled me the most. The devotion ministry broke out reaching 7 people to reaching hundreds into the thousands all over the world with India being our biggest team, thanks to Jemima Elizabeth whom God used to open the door to India. Pastor Phil and my dad Boaz came on board and ministered with me as the Lord enabled them. We’ve reached people in the US, India, Africa, South America, Canada, Australia, UK etc. If it wasn’t for the devotion ministry, I would not be strong in the word today. Again, it’s not about ability, it’s about availability, God enabling those who trust Him. I chose to avail myself to God for His use that He would get more glory out of a life with nothing.

I thought to myself, God, you have now done enough and you are done with me. Thinking He could now maintain all that He had done in my life, that is when I began to be challenged by Pastor Phil’s life and passion to reach the lost. I used to believe that because God had called me to be a prayer warrior, all he required of me was to pray for everyone including those who would go out without Him expecting me to be out there. Well it became clear that I pray for them and for myself then I put legs to my prayers and go out and reach the lost. Having battled fear all my life and now stepping out to reach the lost was tough but I trusted the Lord. I learnt how to witness effectively and praying to God to use me in this capacity. I started by putting a team together to go out on the streets weekly to pass out gospel tracts and witness. After about a year or so, everyone in the team had moved on and I did not have anyone to go out with so I shelved the street evangelism for a while, while reaching out to some people at work. Last year I prayed a simple prayer, I said, “Lord give me courage to fight this fear in me and give me boldness to step out on the streets and witness even if I have no one to go with”. God honored that prayer, He gave me boldness while still battling fear and I began going out by myself and then my friend AJ who has been my prayer partner for years would join me once in a while. Pastor Phil has been great in encouragement in this area.

For about 8 years I patiently waited for the Lord to bless me with my companion, the flesh of my flesh and the bone of my bones. It was definitely tough to wait while seeing my close friends getting married and moving forward. Even with that I waited patiently trusting the Lord and continuing to do His work faithfully while waiting on Him. God is faithful, in due time He blessed me with my beautiful godly woman. She was worth the wait. We are truly blessed of Him not because we have everything we desire but because we know in whom we have believed. As Pastor John Piper always says, “God is most glorified in us when we are most satisfied in Him”, hope I got the quote right . One of the things that has been a blessing to me is watch my wife grow more in the Lord over the last two years or so through tough time for us especially for her.

When we met, we were completely at different levels in our spiritual lives. With her in school and facing different challenges, her spiritual life was deteriorating to the point that reading the bible and praying was a struggle for her. It was tough and discouraging at times and we would even bump heads because I felt like I had to push her to do something about her spiritual life. Anyway, I began to realize that the Lord had not just brought us together to build a relationship but to also help jump start her spiritual life. It took a lot of patience mostly just living by example and encouraging her little by little. Her growth in the Lord has been tremendous and I praise God for that. I know the Lord will continue to raise her to be the woman He wants her to be. (PATIENCE IS KEY IN A MARRIAGE), God uses it to refine us.

In 2008 the majority in our church elected this ordinary guy to serve on the board for three years, at work I have seen people come to the saving knowledge of Jesus Christ in the last few months or so. I have seen lives changed to God be the glory. Those who know me know that I am a very regular guy, not super spiritual, I love fun, down to earth and things like that but in all that, my strength lies in prayers. I am a firm believer that if the Lord could raise me, He can raise anyone. I could say believe in yourself and all could be great but that will be a lie, there is nothing good in our us except God. All a person can do is believe in God and trust Him to work through him or her for His glory. The scripture at the beginning of this devotion testifies of this about Paul who though many believed was a mighty man of God, confesses his weaknesses that drove him to depend on God. This is part of my testimony and I pray and hope that it will cause you to think differently. It’s not about ability, it’s about availability.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Revelation 12:11, “And they overcame him … by the word of their testimony”

A product has just come on the market. First it was invented, thereafter produced. The finished product was put into test before it could be rolled out into the market to be used. The commercial and infomercials often bring people who are said to have used a product to give a testimony of their findings when they used it. Isn’t it always easy to trust someone’s judgment and approvals based on their experience on something? When someone comes and tells you that they know the product well and you can trust it, chances are you will go for it based on their testimony. It’s hard to want to be the first one to try something out if not sure of whether it will work or not. This is what testimonies are to us, a point of reference coming handy. I believe people relate more to testimonies than teaching and preaching. In John 10:38, “…even though you do not believe Me or have faith in Me, [at least] believe the works and have faith in what I do, … (amplified). The miracles Jesus did had such powerful testimonies people would not deny and those who desired miracles at least heard testimonies from all over and that built their faith to desire a miracle.

The way I look at it and I may be wrong, the testimony times are becoming less and less in peoples lives even in the church. People are afraid to testify because they think someone else will think they are well off. Afraid people might think you are boasting. You don’t see your testimony making an impact in someone’s life so why testify. I know for sure that testimonies not only builds someone’s faith to believe God for what they are going through, but it builds your faith too trust God more as you face a new challenge. Remember the story of David and Goliath in 1Samuel 17, David comes to the field and finds that Goliath had put a threat in the lives of the Israelites. No one had the ability and capacity to face this giant. Not only are we told in the same chapter that he was a giant, the bible takes the time to describe who he was, a well trained soldier, dressed for battle and had strong battling tools, the bible shows us that the giant was no ordinary wimp. David shows up untrained, has no weapons and very young. After telling King Saul that he was ready to challenge the giant, they tried to discourage him because of his size, no war experience and did not come prepared after all he was in the field because he was asked to bring food to his brothers. What made them let him face the giant? It’s when he gave his testimony 1Samuel 17:34, “But David said to Saul, “Your servant has been keeping his father’s sheep. When a lion or a bear came and carried off a sheep from the flock, 35 I went after it struck it and rescued the sheep from its mouth. When it turned on me, I seized it by its hair, struck it and killed it. 36 Your servant has killed both the lion and the bear; this uncircumcised Philistine will be like one of them, because he has defied the armies of the living God. 37 The LORD who delivered me from the paw of the lion and the paw of the bear will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.”

Revelation 12:11, “And they overcame him … by the word of their testimony”. I don’t know whether you realize that testimonies are vital weapon to overcome. Here is something to think about, do you think it’s the stone from David’s sling that brought Goliath down? I doubt it; I believe the stone merely finished what David had started in his testimony. Imagine while David was testifying, Goliath was hearing David saying how he went after a lion and a bear and killed them. I believe David’s testimony weakened Goliaths knees because though Goliath was seeing a young man, his size had nothing to do with what he could do through God. David over came his Goliath by the word of his testimony. Do you realize that your testimony could accomplish what no teachings or preaching could accomplish? When was the last time you testified to someone of what God had done in your life? Did you ever testify to yourself when a challenge came your way to weaken the knees of your challenge? Did you ever know that a testimony was a weapon that should constantly be used? You have a weapon at your disposal, use it.

Blessings

Evans

Hi,

You probably don’t know me, but I receive your messages sharing God’s word….

I come from a Hindu background, and I had been grappling with various issues and wondering what the Truth really is..and there were points of great confusion and despair when I would think, ‘it is time to reject Christianity and any Christian influence in my life because I am getting unduly confused and not really ‘leading’ anywhere.’

In one such fit of despair, I remember deleting most of the messages I had from you because they were too ‘Christian’.

But praise God, because He has been ever patient and loving and not forsaken me in my journey – I came to Christ on 6th of December this year, and I have been exceedingly BLESSED by your messages (since the day that I actually deleted them!! and started reading them only to say, they are ‘too Christian and confusing’). There have been many times that I have felt really encouraged by reading what you have sent, or really learnt something new, or else said, ‘Yes Yes that is how it is!’…and I praise God and I really Thank you for the way you are ministering so faithfully to us.

May God really bless you this Christmas and may He continue to build you up stronger so that you can reach more and more people in their walk with the Lord!

A very very Merry and Blessed Christmas to you and your family!

Thank you again, and God bless

Devika

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Those who walk with the Lord and trust Him at times are faced by opposing enemies who try to frustrate and bring them down. The enemy may even discourage the people around such a person that in turn these people discourages the person whose trust is in the Lord. A man who trusts in the Lord goes into prayer and fasting because he is pregnant and knows his life depends on it. Hezekiah was a king with a prayerful life and he totally depended on God.

Hezekiah was twenty-five years old when he began to reign as king. It’s interesting that his story is both reported in the book of 2kings 18, 19 and Isaiah 36, 37. We are given his resume in, 2kings 18:4, “He removed the high places and broke the sacred pillars, cut down the wooden image and broke in pieces the bronze serpent that Moses had made; for until those days the children of Israel burned incense to it, and called it Nehushtan.5 He trusted in the LORD God of Israel, so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah, nor who were before him. 6 For he held fast to the LORD; he did not depart from following Him, but kept His commandments, which the LORD had commanded Moses

It appeared that his destroying of the bronze serpent meant he had destroyed his trust in the Lord noted by the king of Assyria but he actually destroyed the idols which were standing in the way. The Rabshakeh, a man sent by the king of Assyria to mock and attack Hezekiah and his kingdom mistakenly thought Hezekiah’s reforms in removing idols from all over the land and reestablishing central worship in Jerusalem (18:4; 2 Chr. 31:1) had removed opportunities to worship the Lord, and thus cut back on honoring Judah’s God, thereby displeasing Him and forfeiting His help in war. Well Hezekiah trusted in the Lord God of Israel. The noblest quality of Hezekiah (in a dramatic contrast to his father, Ahaz) was that he relied on the Lord as his exclusive hope in every situation. What distinguished him from all other kings of Judah (after the division of the kingdom) was his firm trust in the Lord during a severe national crisis (18:17-19:34). Despite troublesome events, Hezekiah clung tightly to the Lord, faithfully following Him and obeying His commands (v. 6). As a result, the Lord was with him and gave him success (v. 7). What a leader whose strength to give birth came from praying.

Even when the enemy tried to discourage him and his people, Hezekiah knew what to do. He knew he had to draw strength from the One he had walked with. 2Kings 19: 1 And so it was, when King Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD. 2 Then he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz. 3 And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day is a day of trouble, and rebuke, and blasphemy; for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth. 4 It may be that the LORD your God will hear all the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to reproach the living God, and will rebuke the words which the LORD your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.’

I believe we too are in the day of trouble, “children have come to birth” and I could use the same line to say, there are people who are on the verge of getting saved, delivered, healed, restored but there is no strength (power of prayer) to bring or push them forth. A pregnant woman delivering a baby does not sit and wait for the baby to come out, she is encouraged to push and push until the baby comes forth. Hezekiah and his people also had to request for strength to push. For the last few months I have seen many things on the verge of being birthed but the strength to push (prayer) is lacking. I began to pray like never before and I am seeing things coming forth pushed through prayers. I will share another testimony soon. I refuse to die still pregnant with visions and dreams simply because I have no strength of prayer to push them out. A praying man or woman will not die pregnant.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 32:24-26, “25 Now when He saw that He did not prevail against him, He touched the socket of his hip; and the socket of Jacob’s hip was out of joint as He wrestled with him. 26 And He said, “Let Me go, for the day breaks.” But he said, “I will not let You go unless You bless me!”

There is a constant wrestle that takes place in our lives. I realize that the wrestling does not happen much with everyone around but when you are left alone in your quiet time. Many have sleepless nights due to wrestling with ideas, thoughts, opinions, decisions to make, or moves to make; weighing different options and trying to evaluate whether it is the right thing to do or not. The thing about wrestling, only one can win. Wrestling is basically a struggle where strength, moves and strategies are applied with an aim to win. Wrestling to know if something is of God or just your flesh. Are you wrestling with something even right now? In all I am facing, I would rather wrestle in prayers.

One man had an encounter with God when he was left alone. Alone in his own world, in thoughts. God spoke to him to move back to his home having been mistreated by Laban. If you remember the story correctly, the reason he was at Laban’s was to flee from his brother Esau whom he had cheated off of his inheritance. He had been at peace with Laban so far, married his two daughters, had children, and possessions. Going back was tough because he had to deal with his past; Esau. Someone he ran from a long time ago and situations he ran away from he was going to face, he would not like to confront but he had to. God was going to raise him to new heights and so He brings him to confront what he ran away from, to deal with it, push through and concur. At times, you will need to be left alone to wrestle through. You might have had people surround you, wrestle for you and fight your battles and that is okay but if God is going to make you something bigger, He will bring you to a place alone with a lot of confrontations. Times of fear should be times of prayer: whatever causes fear should drive us to our knees, to our God.

“And a Man wrestled with him until the breaking of day”. God wrestled with Jacob that day, how often do you wrestle with God? He says something according to His word and you ask how it can be. He tries to show you, but you bring in what has happened and what could have happened and the wrestling continues. All night you are wrestling yet you are not prevailing. Here is what got me, vs. 25, “Now when He (God) saw that He did not prevail against him, He touched the socket of his hips”. Does this mean God failed to pin Jacob? I believe the divine adversary was also the electing saving Lord who strengthened Jacob with grace to wrestle on against Himself lest he be overcome and condemned. However tried or discouraged, we shall prevail; and prevailing with Him in prayer, we shall prevail against all enemies that strive with us (Matthew Henry). It’s like we both wrestled each other and none of us prevailed because My strength is in you. vs. 26, “And He said, “Let Me go, for the day breaks” But he said, “I will not let You go unless You bless me!”. Someone who has wrestled all night wakes up tired and exhausted and we see with Jacob who wrestles and now does not want to let go because his life depends on who he’s been wrestling with. He wants to be on the same page with Him and he says, “I will not let you go unless you bless me”.

I have wrestled in my thoughts, decisions, ideas, I should have wrestled in prayers instead and I will not let Him go unless He has blessed me, showed me the way, strengthened me, provided for me, taught me how to go about it. 1Peter 5:7, “Casting all your cares upon Him; for He cares for you”. Jacob knew God cared for him otherwise he would have died that day. Anyone who encountered with God like he did in the OT could not live, he was spared and because of that, he did cast his care for a blessing from God who cared for him. Where are you today? Are you wrestling in prayers? There are blessings stored for wrestlers.

Blessings
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Samuel 28, vs. “6 And when Saul inquired of the Lord, the Lord did not answer him, either by dreams or by Urim or by the prophets”

Saul started his journey well, having been chosen by God to be king in Israel and if you read his story, he had a tragic end. Anyone can start a marathon; those who finish it are the one’s who matter. Anyone can begin the journey of faith; only those who make it to the end receive a crown of life. So it’s not how you start that defines you, its how you finish and who does help you to the finish line that counts.

Saul having started well with God on his side, he would have had a glorious journey. Inquiring and trusting in the Lord day by day, obeying His word that is contrary to his later life. Having deprived himself of every legitimate means of spiritual input as a result of his own disobedience and rebellion. 1 Samuel 15: 10 Now the word of the LORD came to Samuel, saying, 11 “I greatly regret that I have set up Saul as king, for he has turned back from following Me, and has not performed My commandments.” And it grieved Samuel, and he cried out to the LORD all night.”, Samuel met him and told him, “23 For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, And stubbornness is as iniquity and idolatry. Because you have rejected the word of the LORD, He also has rejected you from being king.”

Samuel was dead, Saul would not heed to Samuel’s counsel. He has a battle before him; he is seeking to know the will of God concerning what they are about to face. This was to determine whether they would be subdued or subdue, 1Samuel 28, vs. “6 And when Saul inquired of the Lord, the Lord did not answer him, either by dreams or by Urim or by the prophets”. He went before to inquire of the Lord, the Lord did not respond to him. The reason for not responding was due to his disobedience and lack of repentance. Instead of continuing to linger before the Lord in repentance out of a broken heart, he does not seek the Lord and goes back to dead things; witchcraft. Walking in foolishness again by seeking out the very resource (a medium) he had previously removed from the land.

This is what happens when you disconnect yourself from the Lord by sin, lack of desire to seek Him and walk in his commandments. Instead of crying out to the Lord in repentance so as to be restored, you find that it’s easy to seek other things to bring about temporary relief so as not to deal with the root matter of the problem. You know the Lord will point out the truth so to cover up, you say, “I sought the Lord, He did not answer me”. Saul was going back to what he had removed out of his life and kingdom and isn’t that what most of us do when faced with trials and tribulations? We go back to revisiting the world we were rescued from. Instead of trusting the Lord to bless you financially, you are back to playing lotto hoping for a lucky win. Instead of praying to God for a breakthrough, you would rather depend on other means, lying, manipulations and things like that to get your way out.

My prayer daily, Lord forgive me of my sins I am aware of, the ones I don’t know, I pray like David in Psalm 139: 23 Search me, O God, and know my heart; Try me, and know my anxieties;
24 And see if there is any wicked way in me, And lead me in the way everlasting”. I don’t want unconfessed sins to hinder my prayers from reaching God. I can either be like Saul who knowing his sin chose not to repent and trust God or be like David who when confronted with his sin repented of it and God forgave him and gave him life. I can confess and be made whole so as to continue my fellowship with the Lord or be like Saul fall back on dead things. What sin are you not willing to repent of and you would rather go back to what you should have been delivered from? Get rid of dead things, fall in the arms of God. Psalm 18:2, “The LORD is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer; My God, my strength, in whom I will trust; My shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold”. The Lord is alive, why go back to dead things?

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jeremiah 33:3, “Call to Me, and I will answer you, and show you great and mighty things, which you do not know”

Not too long ago I was watching a DVD entitled “extreme engineering”. It was a DVD about how some mega structures have been built. One of the mega structures that caught my attention was one about building a railroad and of course they had surveyed the area by which the rail would pass. There were different obstacles with one major one a mountain in front of them. Instead of going around it which was impossible, they chose to make a way through the mountain however hard it was going to be. Attempting the impossible with what they had. Being that it was a mountain before them, they had to bring in the right tools to make that happen. They used explosives because explosives used correctly, breakthrough hard rocks to create a path.

We too are building roads to our futures and we know there are obstacles everyday, be it small or big. We have mountains standing in the way, the question is, what do we do about them? Without prayers as your explosive devise, there is no way you will breakthrough. There is something about prayers that should not be taken lightly. Prayers pave a way for God to move. Prayer works because God works through prayers. There are things God wills and then waits for His children to call on Him. Prayer is the vehicle He will use to bring things about. It shows we trust Him with what we are facing; it’s bringing the right tools into your situation. When we pray, we are bringing God into our situations for we know we can do nothing without Him. He is like the explosive that breaks through obstacles and making way for us. Psalm 18:32, “It is God who arms me with strength, And makes my way perfect”, 2 Samuel 22:33 God is my strength and power, And He makes my way perfect”.

Prayer affects three different Spheres of existence as E.M. Bounds puts it, “The Divine, the angelic and the human. It puts God to work, it puts the angels to work and it puts people to work.” Prayer put’s everyone to work. Prayer is simply faith resting in, acting with, leaning on and obeying God”. Those who know their God will value prayers as their life fully depends on it.

In our tough economic times and other things happening, who would you rather put your trust in, God or the government, stocks and bond or faith in God. The bible says, Psalm 20:7, “Some trust in chariots, and some in horses; But we will remember the name of the LORD our God”, Psalm 118:8, “It is better to trust in the LORD Than to put confidence in man”. How will you and I show the Lord we trust Him if we don’t call upon Him in our prayers to answer us?

This quote continues to bless my heart because it’s the heart of prayers by great missionary Hudson Taylor, he said, “The prayer power has never been tried to its full capacity. If we want to see Divine power wrought in the place of weakness, failure, and disappointment, let us answer God’s standing challenge, Call to Me, and I will answer you, and show you great and mighty things, which you do not know”. The Lord says, we bring Him into the picture by praying and He will do great and mighty things. Arise O God, demonstrate your power. With what is happening, we need God now more than ever; we need to pray like we have never done before. The more we pray, the more we show the Lord we are not depending on ourselves, we are depending on Him. He is our explosive through the obstacles, He is the way maker.

Thanks
Ev

title.rendered: Discernment Is Not Optional, Inspired by John MacArthur

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Thessalonians 5:21-22, “But examine everything carefully; hold fast to that which is good; abstain from every form of evil”

A scripture often quoted in Matthew 7:1, says, “Judge not, that you be not judged” and this could be thought to mean being silent and receiving all things in the name of Christ asking no questions as you may be labeled judgmental. The same chapter vs. 15, says, “Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves. 16 You will know them by their fruits”. How can you then know false prophets without judging first? The One who said do not judge at the beginning is giving indication that it’s ok to judge. I think the “judge not” is in reference to someone’s salvation. There could be 101 clear signs suggesting someone is not saved, the ultimate judge of their souls is God. We can share the gospel and let them examine themselves to see if they are in the faith. The judging I am still addressing today is discernment, what is going into my system must be evaluated. I hate to be deceived, deception is lethal the reason we have to judge everything preached and said by the word of God. There is a lot of preaching and teachings out here especially coming from the West that must be received with a lot of discernment. As Pastor Gregg Johnson (my pastor) preached along those lines where in Africa the west is influencing their Christianity, there are four areas he preached on that I present to you too because they are very important. As believers, we must be very careful on what we feed to our spirit and mind because many of today’s preaching may appear sound but when you apply wisdom that brings about discernment through the word of God, you find that there are a lot of errors buried in SOME truths that must be exposed if you are to overcome deception in your life. You also find a lot of misinterpretation and manipulation that comes with it. Four areas where great discernment is needed are. 1. Discern CHARACTER over CHARISMA, 2. Discern DOCTRINE over DECEPTION, 3. Discern PROPHESY over PRESUMPTION, 4. Discern MIRACLES over MANIPULATION. What is discernment and why is this important? John MacArthur shares with us on this, “In its simplest definition, discernment is nothing more than the ability to decide between truth and error, right and wrong. Discernment is the process of making careful distinctions in our thinking about truth. In other words, the ability to think with discernment is synonymous with an ability to think biblically. First Thessalonians 5:21-22 teaches that it is the responsibility of every Christian to be discerning: “But examine everything carefully; hold fast to that which is good; abstain from every form of evil.” The apostle John issues a similar warning when he says, “Do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see whether they are from God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world” (1 John 4:1). According to the New Testament, discernment is not optional for the believer-it is required. The key to living an uncompromising life lies in one’s ability to exercise discernment in every area of his or her life. For example, failure to distinguish between truth and error leaves the Christian subject to all manner of false teaching. False teaching then leads to an unbiblical mindset, which results in unfruitful and disobedient living-a certain recipe for compromise. Unfortunately, discernment is an area where most Christians stumble. They exhibit little ability to measure the things they are taught against the infallible standard of God’s Word, and they unwittingly engage in all kinds of unbiblical decision-making and behavior. In short, they are not armed to take a decidedly biblical stand against the onslaught of unbiblical thinking and attitudes that face them throughout their day. Discernment intersects the Christian life at every point. And God’s Word provides us with the needed discernment about every issue of life. According to Peter, God “has granted to us everything pertaining to life and godliness, through the true knowledge of Him who called us by His own glory and excellence” (2 Peter 1:3). You see, it is through the “true knowledge of Him,” that we have been given everything we need to live a Christian life in this fallen world. And how else do we have true knowledge of God but through the pages of His Word, the Bible? In fact, Peter goes on to say that such knowledge comes through God’s granting “to us His precious and magnificent promises” (2 Peter 1:4). Discernment-the ability to think biblically about all areas of life-is indispensable to an uncompromising life. It is incumbent upon the Christian to seize upon the discernment that God has provided for in His precious truth! Without it, Christians are at risk of being “tossed here and there by waves, and carried about by every wind of doctrine” (Ephesians 4:14).”

If you value sound doctrine, then be like Bereans, Acts 17:10, ” Then the brethren immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea. When they arrived, they went into the synagogue of the Jews. 11 These were more fair-minded than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness, and searched the Scriptures daily to find out whether these things were so.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Timothy 4:3, “For the time will come when men will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear” (NIV) The builders have stumbled upon on a biblical principle called foundation, they know that foundation is everything. Every building must or should have a foundation. Foundation is the basis on which a thing stands, is founded, or is supported. In a building, foundation is a structure that transfers loads to the earth. Foundation is not on top, it’s at the bottom holding the weight of what is to be built on it. Strong and deeper foundation goes down past the weaker upper layer of soil to reach the concrete. How deep and strong a foundation is determines what it can withstand and what is to be built on it. The foundation is THE basis or groundwork of anything. A Christian life also begins with a foundation, the question is, which one. Have you ever wondered why you serve Christ? Why you came to Him? Why you go to church? Why you listen to such and such teachings and or preaching? As I talk with people, I usually go back to address their foundation because it gives me an idea of what kind of foundation they have and what they may be building on it. It’s amazing to me of what I hear and see as the means of many church successes around. The measure of success appears to be the size of the congregation. To see the size of the congregation continue to increase is looked at as a sign of growth. Search for series used to grow churches today and find it different from what we see in the book of Acts, the same as what has been taught and preached in the past few centuries. As the world uses sex to sell, some churches are using topics such as sex series to build the church, draw the world in, borrowing materials from the world to reach the world. Is Jesus not enough? Is He not the firm foundation? shouldn’t the success of anything is to be measured by His will?. Many churches are becoming more secular and Christians are falling into the trap without discernment. The church has become a self help place, books are about how you can be happy, how you can achieve your goals and potentials (nothing wrong with that if it’s put in its proper place), question again is, why serve Christ?. I have listened to some people being interviewed going to bible school to become ministers who did not even understand the plan of salvation (the message of the bible), that shows no foundation. And some confessed that it was a good field to make money, wrong foundation. There are churches beginning to have set ups for discussions like talk shows, redefining foundation. Is the church not supposed to set a standard for the world?

Paul addresses the state of the church to come and here we are today plagued by it and some have fallen right into it without discerning. He says “For the time will come when men will not put up with sound doctrine” and the reason is simple, no strong foundation of faith to define a believer. Easy and expedient Christianity appealing to men rather than God. I believe the church should be it for believers and the lost can come in and see believers in their God given habitat, lives changed for His glory and desire their lives changed. I believe the church ought to be a powerhouse not an entertainment field. A CHURCH PLEASING TO GOD BEGINS WITH THE BELIEVERS, WE ARE WHAT MAKES A CHURCH. Our foundation in Christ determines what kind of church we will have. Today because of how foundation is laid, to quote John MacArthur, “Professing Christians, nominal believers in the church follow their own desires and flock to preachers who offer them God’s blessings apart from His forgiveness, and His salvation apart from their repentance. They have an itch to be entertained by teachings that will produce pleasant sensations and leave them with good feelings about themselves. Their goal is that men preach “according to their own desires. Under those conditions, people will dictate what men preach, rather than God dictating it by His Word.” Read what General William Booth the founder of Salvation Army said as he foresaw danger that was coming. He said, “The Chief danger of Christianity in 20th century will be…Religion without the Holy Ghost; Christianity without Christ; Forgiveness without repentance; Salvation without regeneration; Politics without God; And heaven without hell”. If any of these are missing on a Christian’s foundation, only time will tell. Wrong foundation cannot last for long, trying to patch it up and support it with other things will not make it stand. Everything has to be taken out of the way and proper foundation is laid, a foundation of truth on God’s word.

2 timothy 2:15 “Be diligent to present yourself approved to God, a worker who does not need to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth. 19 Nevertheless the solid foundation of God stands, having this seal: “The Lord knows those who are His,” and, “Let everyone who names the name of Christ depart from iniquity.”. The faithful preacher must proclaim the Word when it is popular and convenient or not and when it seems suitable to do so or not. The dictates of popular culture, tradition, reputation, acceptance, or esteem in the community (or in the church) must never alter the true preacher’s commitment to proclaim God’s Word and the student of the word must be open to receive the whole counsel of proclaimed word of God but again it begins with foundation. Those who have a wrong foundation will fall on the danger of 2Tim 4:3. The chief danger of a Christian life is to have wrong foundation, on what foundation is your Christian life built upon? What kind of teachings are you craving for? Where are you plugged in?

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 138:2, “I will worship toward Your holy temple, And praise Your name For Your lovingkindness and Your truth; For You have magnified Your word above all Your name.”

I am drawn to the hymns not so much for the sound but for the packed theology in them. Read the lyrics of many of our songs today and compare to the lyrics of some of the old hymns, way, way different. The hymns are so rich in God’s word transcending feelings so as to be grounded in truth. For the last few years or so, I have had the privilege of tapping into teachings by some long gone people mightily used of God and I find again that their preaching and teachings are far different from many of the preaching and teaching we hear today. Their messages just like in the hymns are packed with theology. Oh I praise God for the age of technology (internet) giving us the ability to find materials lost over the years. . I have learnt so much in a short time because they point me back to the scripture right at my fingertips. I have no excuse anymore for not learning and growing more and more in the word of God.

One thing that these men of God did was point us back to the word of God and teaching it as it is whether it made them popular or not. Their mission was to please God. Men like Charles Spurgeon, Martin Luther, John Bunyan, John Newton (wrote Amazing Grace), John Wycliffe, William and Catherine Booth, Charles Finney, DL Moody, Leonard Ravenhill, Paris Reidhead and many men that God has used through the ages. What I love about listening and reading their materials is their quest to keep the doctrine pure and defending it by all means. For instance, Martin Luther wrote: The great difference between doctrine and life is obvious, even as is the difference between heaven and earth. Life may be unclean, sinful, and inconsistent; but doctrine must be pure, holy, sound, and unchanging. Life may show omissions and come short of what doctrine calls for. But from doctrine (says Christ, Matt. 5:18 <http://bible.logos.com/passage/nkjv/Matt.%205.18> ) not a tittle or letter may be omitted, however much life may fail to meet the requirements of doctrine. This is so because doctrine is God’s Word and God’s truth alone, whereas life is partly our own doing. On this account doctrine must remain entirely pure. God will have patience with man’s moral failings and imperfections and forgive them. But He cannot, will not, and shall not tolerate a man’s altering or abolishing doctrine itself. For doctrine involves His exalted, divine Majesty itself. In the sphere of doctrine, therefore, forgiveness and patience are out of order.32. Is this quote pregnant or what?

With false teachers and their doctrines on the rise, this is the time to completely yield to the Holy Scriptures, pray for understanding, the ability to discern and be under pastors and teachers who teach true biblical doctrine. 2 Timothy 3:16, “ALL Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness”. I run into people who say the bible cannot be fully trusted because it was written by men and my response to them is that it’s written by God through men as a pen cannot write by itself. If written by man, it would be filled with errors but it’s written by God therefore, its content is pure. The scripture addresses a lot of things and one of the things that I am addressing this morning is the Doctrine (teachings) of God’s word. Wrong understanding of the scripture opens us to error and false teachings that are easy to swallow and digest. Wrong understanding of the deity of Christ is enough to doom us to hell because without the right understanding of the true Jesus of the bible who is able to save, the wrong Jesus we think of will not save us for he does not exist.

1 Timothy 6:20 “O Timothy! Guard what was committed to your trust, avoiding the profane and idle babblings and contradictions of what is falsely called knowledge- 21 by professing it some have strayed concerning the faith”. This word “your trust” translates to one Greek word, which means, “deposit.” The deposit Timothy was to guard is the truth, the divine revelation that God committed to his care. Every Christian, especially if he is in ministry, has that sacred trust to guard the revelation of God (1 Cor. 4:1; 1 Thess. 2:3, 4). what is falsely called knowledge. False doctrine-anything claiming to be the truth that is in fact a lie. False teachers typically claim to have the superior knowledge (as in Gnosticism). They claim to know the transcendent secrets, but actually are ignorant and infantile in their understanding.

David in Psalm 138 chooses to worship the Lord on two counts, His loving kindness and His truth. Then he says something that has struck me for days For You have magnified Your word above all Your name.” I began to meditate on this line and gleaned some truth as the Lord would speak to my heart through reading and meditation, and here is my understanding of the scripture, the Lord has magnified (made it more important) His holy word to supersede everyone’s thinking of who He is, His attributes and the like. We cannot truly worship a God we do not know otherwise we end up with a god we are comfortable with, the god not revealed in the Scriptures. The Lord God Almighty delights in His word because it gives full counsel of who He is and His nature, this is the reason doctrine is vital. Paul was concerned for his son Timothy so he advised him to guard what was taught to him. Even as I share daily, I want magnify God’s word and keep it pure. I do not want to misrepresent His word and you have a responsibility to check out the scriptures to be sure I am sharing from His word. We have to be student’s of the word hungry for truth even if it’s not popular, truth sets you free.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 39:1-22, “So it was, from the time that he had made him overseer of his house and all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake; and the blessing of the LORD was on all that he had in the house and in the field”

As I shared the other day, we all love compliments, someone speaking good things about us before people. There is always a word that tends to erase every good thing someone has spoken. The word is “BUT”. As long as good things are spoken without the “BUT”, we tend to be ok with it but the moment it comes in the middle, then you become troubled by it. Your concentration on it erases all the good that has been said.

In the workforce, there are people who are hard workers, they do the best they can, and they are good at what they do. They give a 110% but no one ever notices no words of appreciation, no pat on the back in fact most people concentrate on their mistakes and what has not been done more than anything else. With this they feel their presence is not significant. You have to understand that your presence is a present (gift) to your job. It may not be your dream job, you have to remember that God has called you there as a gift to that company, job, position, department to be faithful in it. Who knows, it could be a training ground to mature your character, leadership qualities, integrity, foundation, and be a blessing to others. God sent you there for a reason. . Until you see it in a new way, instead of being in deep rest, you will be depressed. I remember a job I had before, I did not like it, wished I could move away from it. I knew God had placed me there for a reason. I chose to take the opportunity to serve and be the best at it, I did ministry there and it was a blessing. With time, the Lord moved. Your continuous complaints and whining will mess up every victory God had channeled your way. See, the world crowns success, God crowns faithfulness. Look at Joseph, his dream job was to be a ruler, people bowing before him including his family. As a young lad, that is the thought that consumed his mind. In our times maybe his dream would be a CEO. The thought of it and speaking about it almost cost him his life. He finally finds himself in a house of an officer serving as a servant (slave). Not his dream job but he is there, no one to talk well of him but he is there. He should be complaining and murmuring but he becomes faithful in his job. I believe that instead of asking “why”, He was thanking God for the opportunity to serve in any capacity. As I shared recently, you ought to be your best encourager. If they don’t say nice things about you, speak nice things to yourself. Applaud yourself for job well done. Look yourself in the mirror and say, “He loves me in spite of and He will use me to be a blessing in my job”. “It may not be where I want to be but if I can be faithful with the little, He will make me ruler over much”. You don’t have to be liked and applauded to be successful, you got to know who you are, where you are going and who is in control to be one. That is what Joseph knew. A slave with a dream to someday be great yet beginning that greatness by laying a foundation of faithfulness.”. A slave with a dream but yet looking at his current situation as a stepping stone. If God promised him the dream, there maybe temporary setbacks and that does not mean denial. The bible says, “Do not despise the days of humble beginnings” paraphrased. . Faithfulness with time, resources, in responsibilities. Going an extra mile beyond the required duty. Extra mile is what I will call excellence mile, the mile that distinguishes you from others.

Genesis 39:5, “So it was, from the time that he had made him overseer of his house and all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake; and the blessing of the LORD was on all that he had in the house and in the field”. Can you see your job being blessed because your presence is significant? I believe my department, my boss, my colleagues; my surrounding is blessed because of my presence. I know that I am making an impact, it may be small but it’s significant. Joseph’s boss was blessed because of Joseph. If you are faithful over little, God will make you ruler over much. If you don’t like what you do, I’m not saying be happy and relax, I’m saying be faithful in it as you trust God for greater things. I would stop for a moment and say, “what a privilege to be entrusted with a position like this”, Matthew 5:16, “Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven”. Your presence is Significant, therefore trust God and be faithful. Blessings Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 39:1, “I said, “I will guard my ways, Lest I sin with my tongue; I will restrain my mouth with a muzzle, While the wicked are before me.”

Our tongues are great, God made them to be used for His glory. It becomes lethal if untamed. It’s a very small thing but has such great power. This makes me wonder whether the Lord gave us two ears and one mouth so that we will be inclined to hear more and speak less. I know the power of the tongue because I’ve said things I wished I did not, they cut deep like a sharp knife. It’s like a gun, once fired; it’s gone and cannot be retrieved. I hear people say, “Take back what you just said” as a figure of speech. I also hear some say, “speak your mind”, very dangerous request. Proverbs 18:21, tells us “Death and life are in the power of the tongue,…”.

James (Jesus half brother) is the only one I find in the Bible that describes greatly the power of the tongue. James provided several analogies that show how the tongue, even though small, has the power to control one’s whole person and influence everything in his life. He says James 3:6″ And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity. The tongue is so set among our members that it defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire by hell”. The tongue is like a wild fire seeking to be unleashed. It’s never satisfied, it’s always looking for ways to be out of control. You may feel like I do sometimes to have the last word in a conversation showing exactly its drive. It’s by the tongue that we blame and it’s by the tongue that we justify ourselves even when we are wrong. What has been used the most to try and get people out of trouble? Lying lips, the bible says, “Lying lips are abomination to the Lord”. It’s by the tongue we speak error. We backbite and contaminate or ruin other’s lives by it. Sometimes say nice things but how we say them defiles even with good intentions. It’s by the tongue that we boast the more, Luke 18 tells us of a Pharisee boasting in his prayer despising a publican praying too.

Can any one put their tongue under control? James says no man can tame the tongue. He says people have tamed wild animals but have failed to tame their tongue and the reason is simple, no one has the ability on their own to tame the tongue, only God, by His power, can do this. When we guard our ways as the Psalmist says, God’s power is present in us to overcome sinning with our tongue. To be conformed to the image of Christ and Him be formed in us (Galatians 4:18-20). The psalmist says, “I will restrain my mouth with a muzzle”, a muzzle is a device that is placed over the snout of an animal to keep it from biting or otherwise opening its mouth. The muzzle is put in the mouth of an animal the times it needs it the most and our prayer to the Lord is help us muzzle our mouths so as not to sin. God’s word is a muzzle. Psalm 119:11, “Your word I have hidden in my heart, that I might not sin against You”.

How do we do it, James 1:19 So then, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath; 20 for the wrath of man does not produce the righteousness of God” for this to happen, we need wisdom from above James 1:5, “If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach, and it will be given to him”. Proverbs 12:18, “There is one who speaks like the piercings of a sword, But the tongue of the wise promotes health”. If from yesterday’s message we learnt what words can do in our lives, how much more do we need wisdom to know when to be quite and when to speak encouraging words that build? Proverbs 15:2, “The tongue of the wise uses knowledge rightly, But the mouth of fools pours forth foolishness”

Under frustration and anger, people often say things they wish they could take back. Husbands say things that hurt their wives and vise versa. Parents say things to their children, and we say things to our bosses, colleagues at work, and members of the body of Christ that hurt. On our own we are unable the reason to pray always to be wise as serpents and harmless as doves in how we hear, respond, speak. Our tongue untamed by the Holy Spirit is deadly on its own. Paul encourages Timothy his son, 2Timothy 2:23 “But avoid foolish and ignorant disputes, knowing that they generate strife. 24 And a servant of the Lord must not quarrel but be gentle to all, able to teach, patient, 25 in humility correcting those who are in opposition, if God perhaps will grant them repentance, so that they may know the truth”, All these are cultivated by the fear of God we should crave for. Christ more formed in us and our minds become like His.

content.rendered:
Good morning

Acts 28:1-16, vs. 5, “But he shook off the creature into the fire and suffered no harm”

Human beings crave for attention. We have been created with a sense of desire to be accepted and feel the sense of belonging. Who does not want someone to say nice things about them? I love compliments and I believe you do too; someone to say nice things to you and a firm you. There is power in spoken words. It’s interesting to note that you can receive 10 compliments and one bad word or criticism is enough to out weigh the 10 compliments. You shift all the energy on the bad said about you.

Lets find out how Paul dealt with a situation that could have broken some folks. Paul and a few people had just survived a shipwreck by God’s grace. They landed on an Island called Malta and the natives of that Island showed them unusual kindness, in other words, they showed these strangers extraordinary kindness as they saw how cold they were. They decided to make fire for them to keep them warm. Everyone desires to be shown kindness wherever they go, a sign of acceptance. While keeping themselves warm, Paul went about collecting more sticks for the fire.

As Paul was throwing sticks he had gathered into the fire, suddenly a snake jumped out of the fire due to heat and fastened itself around his wrist. He had just survived a shipwreck, and out of the fire a dangerous snake jumps out and coils around his wrist; someone could say Paul was having a bad day. You put more sticks into your fire, you will be surprised to see how many snakes jump out. Only the heat of the fire can reveal them. Be ready for they will jump out of the fire and attack you. As you go deeper and deeper with the Lord, expect snakes jumping out of the fire to coil around your wrist. People’s words will jump out and get hold of you, the question is, will you let their venom run through your system and kill you? The more I serve the Lord, the more I get attacked and the more I run into people who try to do things to make me want to curse, be discouraged, throw things and say that’s it, but I choose not to.

Vs. 4, “So the natives saw the creatures hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped the sea, yet justice does not allow him to live”. Remember these people showed them kindness, this new situation changes their mind about Paul, he is now considered a murderer. People can change their minds in seconds if you stumble no matter what good records you have had. One little mistake will override many if not all the good you have done. You cannot live by people’s acceptance to make it in life, just because some people do not accept you for you are does not change God’s mind about reaching out to you. I don’t hear anywhere where God runs around looking for votes from people about whether He should bless you or not, you are the one who needs to forget those things which are behind and press on for the things which are before if you want God to bless you.

Paul already knew God was keeping him a live to serve Him. He had already survived the worse at that time compared to this challenge. Regardless of what they thought of him, he did not care, he shook off the snake off his wrist and into the fire. “These signs shall follow them that believe, in my name thy shall cast out devils, they shall speak with new tongues, they shall take serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not harm them, Mark 16:17&18? He did not care about what they thought of him, He thought about who cared for him. Everyone was waiting for him to drop dead and so are some who have called Christians fanatics. One thing happened in your life and many people are waiting to see what will happen to you, but you got to shake it off into the fire. Shake off men’s opinions. Shake off confusion, frustration, bitterness, resentments, worry, doubts, and brokenness into the fire. These are things that try to coil themselves around your wrist when you are adding more sticks into your fire. Don’t sit and analyze the snake and see what’s going to happen, shake it off at once.

The funny thing about the story is that, after the natives of the island waited for a while to see if Paul would fall and die, they saw that, Paul was ok and the snake’s bite had not effect on him, so they changed their minds about him. Paul could have sat there and tried to defend himself about not being a murderer but his actions proved he was a man of God. You may never change the minds of people about what they think of you even if you explain, your actions will shut their mouths. What is it that is coiling around your wrist this morning, be of good cheer it’s a sign that your fire is burning. Shake it off!!!!!!

Thanks
Ev
