content.rendered:
Good morning,

Job 31: 1 “I made a covenant with my eyes, not to look lustfully at a girl” NIV

One thing that scares me daily is the thought that I have the ability to sin and sin is constantly knocking on my door. I usually joke about two things I’m allergic to, sin and pain. There are no two things I can think of that have destroyed many men of God, like sexual sin and greed. This continues to plague men daily in a sexually charged world and a world of greed. In the age of Internet, TV, movies, magazines, beaches, dressings etc all around has created a challenge for many men and some women, something we call “every man’s battle”. I think that the level of temptations faced by David, Solomon, Samson others in the past cannot be compared to what we face today and yet the standard of God’s purity for man has not changed and never will. It’s easy to try and poke holes in God’s word to find something to justify the sin, we need to always remember, God’s word is truth and has no revised edition to fit our time. The word was set to address everything in any age. God’s still hold’s us to the highest standard revealed in the Holy Scriptures.

Your true Christianity is not what you display before people; your true Christianity is who you are when no one is around. It’s where your walk is defined and this is a challenge to many men. The lusts of the flesh, and the love of the world, are the two fatal rocks on which multitudes split; against these Job protests he was always careful to stand upon his guard. While Job was facing his trial moments, he reflected on his life and one thing that he mentions is that he made a covenant with his eyes not to look lustfully at a girl (woman). When God allowed Satan to take away everyone and everything from Job, one person God wouldn’t touch was his wife. I believe the reason being, the presence of his wife would remind him of the covenant he made to God and to her and that would help him be pure before God and stand through it all. Job made a covenant to be pure before God and honor his wife by keeping his eyes on her and her alone regardless. Of course opportunities might have presented themselves to sway him but he kept on remembering his covenant.

How often does opportunities present themselves to you? You may not be looking for trouble but trouble finds you, what is your response? Does your conscious remind you of the covenant you made to your wife before God? To honor God by being faithful to her in thoughts, in words and in deeds? As my pastor would say, men of God must “Avoid the second look”, the first look my catch you off guard, the second look is a choice you make, a responsibility you are accountable for. How much commitment you show to your spouse shows how much you value purity. The bible says, “2 Timothy 2:22, “Flee also youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart”, it doesn’t say try and fight it or deal with it, you and I must run for our lives, while running from it, we will run towards righteousness, faith, love, peace.

I constantly pray that God would be more present in me and give me power to over the lust of flesh, the lust of the eyes and the pride of life that my eyes may be fixed on Him and my wife alone. If I pull my eyes from her or if I work an appetite outside my marriage, I will be living in sin and the fear of God will be absent. Read what Job says in looking to God to search his heart in this area, vs. 9 “If my heart has been enticed by a woman, or if I have lurked at my neighbor’s door, 10 then may my wife grind another man’s grain, and may other men sleep with her”, What a scary statement but a statement that would hold him accountable to his actions if he did. The thought of someone else lusting after your wife while you lust after other people’s wives (married or not) should scare you to death. Those who are single who may be dating or looking around, be careful on how you treat those women. That could be someone’s wife if not yours (if you don’t get married to her). Those of you who look at stuff on the Internet, on magazines remember those are someone’s daughter and someone’s wife. There are men who say, “you can look at the menu and not order from it”, the Lord says something different, He said Matthew 5: 27 “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’ 28 But I say to you that whoever looks at a woman to lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart” in the OT, they would have looked at committing adultery as the actual act, we Christians under grace in the NT the standard is made clear, the thought is sinful. Proverbs 6:32, “Whoever commits adultery (lust) with a woman lacks understanding; He who does so destroys his own soul” Matthew Henry, “Those that would keep their hearts pure must guard their eyes, which are both the outlets and inlets of uncleanness”

To make a covenant is to make an agreement. Would you and I make a covenant daily not to look with lust (both married and single men and struggling women”? To flee lust? To love God and our wives with a pure heart is hard, we cannot do it by ourselves that is why we need to pray to God for grace and strength to overcome the lust of the eyes, the lust of the flesh and the pride of life, Philippians 4:13, “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”. If you’ve stumbled, repent of it and stand for the Lord

Thanks

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 10:3, “For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God”.

The foundation of our salvation is crucial in the sense that, it defines it and everything that will be built on that foundation. If your understanding is that Christ died on the cross to make you happy, then all you will seek is ways to be happy and build your life on happiness. Christ did not come to make us happy, He came to make us righteous, right with God, everything else is filtered through it. 2 Corinthians 5:21, “For He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might become the righteousness of God in Him”, not righteousness for season but for a life time. What profits in the day of wrath (judgment)? Proverbs 11:4, “Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness delivers from death”.

Romans 10:3, “for they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness”, What causes a person to be ignorant of God’s righteousness? When he does not truly know God. The world has their own perception thought of God. They’ve gone to the extent of creating their own god to suit themselves. People have created their own plan of salvation, establishing their own righteousness. The question is, is it the true one. I hear people say, “my god would never do that?”, yes their personal god will never, he is not the God of heaven as revealed in the bible. Knowing the God of heaven is knowing His TRUE NATURE which is revealed to us through the ten commandments (law). He reveals Himself in the spirituality of His law. That is where His righteousness and perfect purity of character are revealed for men to learn it there. To be honest, I don’t see the ten commandments as laws imposed on mankind to learn and follow, I believe it’s primary work is to reveal to us who God is and who we truly are. It exposes our so called righteousness and creates a thirst for His righteousness. Those who are not soundly saved are ignorant of God’s righteousness and with that, they have created a god to suit themselves, a god they are comfortable with to which if you probed more, you will discover they are their own gods. They may not admit it but that is true, captain of their own destiny. Proverbs 16:2, “All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes, but the Lord weighs the heart”. I see this a lot when I talk with the unsaved.

Again, men are ignorant of God’s righteousness when they do not understand His method of making sinners righteous. For someone to be made righteous, they must be living in sin. Sin is the opposite of righteousness. What is sin? 1John 3:4, “Sin is transgression of the law”. In other words it’s an offense against religious or moral law. If we have this definition, then we can say that without the law, there can be no sin. What does the law have to do with I’m sharing on sharing on? Cause men are ignorant of the righteousness of God when they do not know and understand the laws of God which reveals what sin is. The bible says, Romans 3:20, “By the law is the knowledge of sin”. Paul says to us in Romans 7:7, “…I would have not known sin except through the law”. Paul tells us that he did not know what sin was until the law of God told him. So the law tells us what sin is cause it reveals who God is. If I was to use SIN as an acronym, I would say Savior Is Needed. How can a person truly repent and be saved when they do not really know what sin is? How can they submit to the righteousness of God if they are ignorant of it. This is the reason that even for those who are saved ought to preach to themselves the gospel daily they may hunger and thirst for righteousness. Crucifying the flesh that craves for happiness that we may live a righteous life, a life pure before God. Romans 14:17, “for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit”

Often times we hear the messages of God’s love and mercy. They are powerful messages we all embrace because without them we have nothing at all. At times we hear God’s justice yet we don’t see God’s justice simply because we have never understood it, who it applies to and when it ought to be applied. Some feel that God is love and therefore cannot serve justice cause that will make Him unjust. The bible says, Psalm 89:14, “Righteousness and Justice are the foundations of His throne”. He is the God of faithfulness, without injustice, good and upright is He. Lawlessness would not require justice and there can be no government without the laws governing their country. The law is the primary reason why we have justice. If there is no law, what shall justice be based on?

We as believers need to crave to be as righteous as He is and bring others in the light of His righteousness. I don’t hear much of justice, righteousness, holiness, purity being preached on TV but they are the foundation of His throne and the foundation of our Christianity. God has set a day in which He will judge the world in righteousness, that makes me hunger and thirst more for righteousness Acts 17:3, “because He has appointed a day on which He will judge the world in righteousness by the Man whom He has ordained. He has given assurance of this to all by raising Him from the dead.” Matthew 6:33 But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness”, Are you hungry and thirsty for His righteousness? Then you and I have to submit to His in prayer, in dying to self, in crucifying the flesh, in submission otherwise we are doomed.

Thanks
Ev

title.rendered: Faith Laughs At Impossibilities, by Late Leonard Ravenhill

content.rendered:
Good morning,

In light of what we’ve been sharing, I came a cross a message that blessed my heart by the late Leonard Ravenhill. I hope this message and the ones I have shared this week on faith will impact your life. Here is the message. Acts 12:5-18, 5 “Peter was therefore kept in prison, but constant prayer was offered to God for him by the church” Peter in prison! What a jolt!

We are too far removed from the actual scene to catch the atmosphere of dismay the Christians of that day felt.

Peter had moved from Pentecost to prison, from jeers to spears. He was guarded by sixteen soldiers. One wonders why such a defenseless man needed such a group to watch him. Could it be that Herod feared the supernatural, seeing he knew that Jesus escaped such a group that guarded Him?

Had Peter been hedged in by sixteen hundred soldiers, the problem would not have been increased nor the escape less sure. Peter was bound not only by two chains, but also by the thick walls of the prison, by the three wards of the prison, and finally by an iron gate.

When Peter is in prison, does the church organize a plan to get him released? No. When Peter is jailed, do the believers offer a plea to Herod or suggest a price to offer the lawmakers for his freedom? No. Peter had released others at the hour of prayer; now others must believe for his release.

Right through the book of Acts, which might be called The Acts of Prayer, we find prayer and more prayer. Dig into the book and discover this power that motivated the early church. In the twelfth chapter of Acts we find a group that prayed. Though a host encamped against Peter, in this were these believers confident: there was a God who could and would deliver. The one never-failing rescue operation was prayer. There was no hedging about in the prayers of those who made intercession for Peter. Prayer was made without ceasing by the church unto God for him. They did not seem to be concerned whether Herod should die or not. They did not pray that they might escape Peter’s fate. They were not asking that they have another exodus to a more hospitable country. They prayed for one person: Peter. They prayed for one thing: his release. The answer proves the point: “Whatsoever ye shall ask,… that will I do”

Some shabby interpreters of this story have said that when the pray-ers heard that Peter was at the door, they were unbelieving. I cannot accept this assumption. I am sure that they prayed with expectation. I like to think that they were for the moment staggered by the immediacy of the answer. They could be excused if they raised their eyebrows when Peter said, “I got out quite easily with an angel escort ” (Next time you pass through the magic self-opening door at your supermarket, remember that the first door to open of its own accord was operated from above!)

Angel deliverances seem to find no place in our modern theology. Perhaps we would like the Lord to answer our prayers with the least embarrassment to us. After all, who expects that the angelic ranks should be disturbed just to bring deliverance to a praying soul? But supernatural results came for many of the praying saints of apostolic days. The Lord geared a property-damaging earthquake to get deliverance for an apostle. Prayer is dynamite.

There is no weapon formed against prayer that can neutralize it. Some things can delay answers to prayer, but nothing can stop the full purpose of God. “Though it tarry, wait for it.”

The first requirement in prayer is to believe. -Believe that God is and that “he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.” -Believe that God is alive and therefore has power-not only for Peter’s deliverance, but for ours. -Believe that God is love and that He cares for His own. -Believe that God is power and therefore no power can stand against Him. -Believe that God is truth and therefore cannot lie. -Believe that God is kind and that He will never abdicate His throne or fail in His promise.

Reflecting on the story of Peter, I am rebuked, humiliated, chagrined, stung. Why? Because there are some great modern saints, Watchman Nee for one, who for years have suffered and been held captive by communists and others. Many of the saints today are shut up in prison. The same fate has befallen some of God’s choice witnesses in Vietnam and in the Congo.

Such perils to other members of the Body demand concern, concentration, and consecration to a committed plan of prayer on their behalf. I fear that prayer has not been made to God without ceasing for these suffering kinsmen.

Mr. Bunyan shows us his Christian held captive by the Giant Despair in Doubting Castle. The key to his deliverance was Promise. We Christians are in captivity on many levels today personal, domestic, church, and missionary enterprise. But fetters break and dungeons fall when prayer is made by the church unto God- -Prayer without ceasing; -Prayer that might shatter our status quo; -Prayer that drains us of every other interest; -Prayer that excites us by its immense possibilities; -Prayer that sees God as the One that rules on high, almighty to save; -Prayer that laughs at impossibilities and cries, “It shall be done”; -Prayer that sees all things beneath His feet; -Prayer that is motivated with desire for God’s glory.

The praying of the believer can become a ritual. The place of prayer is more than a dumping ground for all our anxieties, frets, and fears. The place of prayer is not a place to drop a shopping list before the throne of a God with endless supplies and limitless power.

I believe the place of prayer is not only a place where I lose my burdens, but also a place where I get a burden. He shares my burden and I share His burden. “My yoke is easy and my burden is light.” To know that burden, we must hear the voice of the Spirit. To hear that voice, we must be still and know that He is God.

This calamitous hour in the affairs of men demands a church healthier than the one we have. This blatant manifestation of evil in the youth and in the violation of God’s commandments throughout the world calls for a faith that will not shrink.

Can we let our prayer swords rust in the scabbards of doubt? Shall our prayer harps hang tuneless on the willows of unbelief -If God is a god of matchless power and incredible might, -If the Bible is the unchangeable Word of the living God, -If the virtue of Christ is as fresh today as when He first made the offering of Himself to God after His resurrection, -If He is the one and only mediator today, -If the Holy Spirit can quicken us as He did our spiritual fathers, Then all things are possible today. The seas were boiling, the winds were howling, the sails were tearing, the spars were flying, the stars were hiding, Euroclydon was blasting. The people were cringing and crying, sobbing and sighing. One man alone was praising. All were expecting death save Paul. Amidst a scene of hopelessness, if ever there was one, Paul cries, “Sirs, I believe God” (Acts 27).

As things seem to fall apart these days, I am going to join Paul. I am going to say in faith, “Sirs, I believe God.” Will you join me?

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Daniel 3:17&18, “…our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and He will deliver us from your hand, O king. 18, But if not, let it be known to you, O king, that we do not serve your gods, nor will we worship the gold image which you have set up.”

This week we’ve been talking about faith. Today let me tackle one faith killer called disappointment and how in disappointment you can master faith to over come it without it killing your faith. If you’ve never been disappointed, be sure it will come… Disappointed in your job, relationship, boss, children, church, friends. Either you will disappoint someone or they will be disappointed by you, that is a fact of life. Disappointment simply means a feeling of dissatisfaction that results when your expectations are not realized.

Disappointments go hand in hand with shock because it just darned to you that what you had hopes for, worked for, groomed, expected has turned out to be something else. Shock leads to lock in, being extra careful, cautious and not ready to go through the same path again because of what you experienced last time. Often times disappointments leave people disoriented, confused leading them to want to do something they will regret later. It could lead to trying to frustrate the person who has disappointed you so as to get even with them or lead you to stay away. It’s easy to want to withdraw from trying again because you’ve disappointed. The bible says, “a righteous man falls 7 times but keeps on rising”, men of faith look at disappointments differently, they see them as temporary setbacks; blessings delayed but not denied. How can one deal with disappointments? I really don’t have a concrete answer but let me share with you how God has taught me to deal with them.

First lets look at three men Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-Nego. These men were brought from Israel to serve in the land of Babylon but not as slaves. Men required for the job had to be, Daniel 1:4, “young men in whom there was no blemish, but good-looking, gifted in all wisdom, possessing knowledge and quick to understand, who had ability to serve in the king’s palace, and whom they might teach the language and literature of the Chaldeans”. These men had the qualifications. They saw themselves living in the king’s palace, serving in the high ranks and they did until one day a decree was passed that everyone was expected to bow to an idol. I can imagine them being disappointed because what they hoped for has been changed. They came to serve the king but not his gods, they had their true God whom they were serving and living for. They had been faithful to the Almighty God, why would they be in a place of disappointment at this time? Had they known…. Anyway, after a while, it’s explained to them of their destiny if they don’t bow and worship an idol, the furnace heated seven. Some would have compromised their stand but not these men, they said, Daniel 3:16-18, “…, “O Nebuchadnezzar, we have no need to answer you in this matter. 17, If that is the case, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and He will deliver us from your hand, O king. 18, But if not, let it be known to you, O king, that we do not serve your gods, nor will we worship the gold image which you have set up.” Why would they speak this way in this situation?, They had shock absorbers, faith in God. Unless you have shock absorbers, disappointments will ruin your life. What are shock absorbers? Shock is a violent collision or impact, simply a heavy blow what disappointments are. Absorbers means enduring or accommodating. Cars have absorbers to help steady the impact on the bumps and pot holes it might or will hit. Shock absorbers help level what is already there and that is what the three young men did. I believe they looked at what the Lord had done in their lives. The qualities and the abilities they had that some other young men did not have and that became their shock absorbers. Though disappointed in one area, what had been done could not be compared to what lied a head of them. Because of that, they were able bounce back with a message, “Our God whom we serve is able…”, their shock absorber was on what God had done and what God could do, “…But if not…”, this is not statement of doubt, it’s statement of “whatever brings Him more glory, let Him do it”, you can not make a statement like this without having your shock absorbers. These men’s minds were made up, their disappointments could not keep them down. Would you allow your disappointments to keep you down when you have your shock absorbers?

Bounce back, shake it off, get right back on the track, move on, put everything that has happened in the past only carry what can boost you a head. Don’t quit!! 2 Corinthians 4:8 We are hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair; 9 persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed” , Don’t allow your disappointments to dictate what your faith, you can use them to create new appointments, build more faith in you. For the three men, their disappointments allowed them to see God in a new dimension cause they created appointments out of them. If you’ve been disappointed, find your shock absorbers and bounce back on the track by faith.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning.

Matthew 14:22-33, “28 And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if it is You, command me to come to You on the water.” 29 So He said, “Come.” And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.

I love reading about Peter, he was just a regular guy like any of us. He had weakness and strengths. Peter was an ordinary fisherman who walked with Jesus. His walk with Christ changed his life and I don’t believe any one can walk with Christ and not be changed.

29″ So He said, “Come.” And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus”. Jesus was God to have walked on water; Peter was a man, the first man to ever walk on water. God walking on water was expected, He is God He can do anything. Greater testimony I see is when God takes an ordinary life and does something extraordinary in that life, glorifying Himself through that life. Even if it was for a short time due to little faith, he attempted something no man ever dared try or even have faith in someone else to make him or her do it. Think about it, for that short time he walked on water, he just gave God all the glory because he proved to the rest of the disciples and to us all that Christ is able to make us do the impossible if we believe. Also shows the Lord keeps His promises. Peter said, “command me to come to You on the water”, the Lord said “Come”, a seal of His approval and the ability to make it happen. Peter took the Lord at His word, asking no questions and walked on water towards Jesus. That is daring faith, taking the Lord at His word even if it does not make sense. .

How is God glorified in us in such a daring faith? Here is something to ponder on “If someone says to you, “You’re a man of great faith in God,” they may think that they are paying you a compliment. But they aren’t — the compliment is to God. For example if I said to you, “I’m a man of great faith in my doctor,” it’s actually the doctor I’m complimenting. If I have great faith in him, it means that I see him as being a man of integrity, a man of great ability -that he is trustworthy. I give “glory” to the man through my faith in him. The Bible says that Abraham “He did not waver at the promise of God through unbelief, but was strengthened in faith, giving glory to God, and being fully convinced that what He had promised He was also able to perform.” (Romans 4:20-21). Abraham was a man of great faith in God. Remember, that is not a compliment to Abraham. He merely caught a glimpse of God’s incredible ability, His impeccable integrity, and His wonderful faithfulness to keep every promise He makes. His faith gave “glory” to a faithful God.” By Ray Comfort. And so was Peter’s and so should ours. This is the faith that is not comfortable with the normal territories; it’s faith in action complimenting God. It’s his faith finding an open heart seeking to please God, making Him look good.

To not have faith in God is to show He is not able and cannot be trusted to perform what He has promised, what an insult and that is sin, Romans 14:23, “…for whatever is not from faith is sin”. God has given us an awesome challenge to respond to. Jeremiah 33:2 “Thus says the LORD who made it, the LORD who formed it to establish it (the LORD is His name): 3 ‘Call to Me, and I will answer you, and show you great and mighty things, which you do not know.” Only those who have daring faith dare to respond to God’s challenge. There are three responders to this challenge, The Jawbones – they are talkers but no action, they make promises to one day respond to the challenge and never doest. The Wishbones – are wishing ones, always wishing something would happen but never stepping out by faith. The Backbones – are the ones who respond to the challenge, call on God and step out by faith. I want to be a backbone, I have chickened out of things I should have been trusting God to bring because I wanted to be on the safe grounds. Safe grounds did not demand much (prayer, faith, fasting). And I feel I have robbed God of the glory for Himself He could have gained if I only had the faith to operate in the unfamiliar territories. This is the prime product, the benefits are results from trust, the bible says, “God is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him” Hebrews 11:6.

Two greatest things I have come across that the disciples ever requested of the Lord, 1. Teach us to pray, Luke 11:1 and 2. Lord increase our faith, Luke 17:5. To have asked for these two, they may have been tired of operating on the familiar and desired more, more of what the Lord had for them. They did not ask to be taught to preach, to relate, to even perform miracles. What are you asking of the Lord? You cannot pray without faith and you cannot have faith and not pray. It’s just three weeks ago when God performed a miracle, a plane with 155 passengers on board safely landed on Hudson River with no life lost. The plane did not even sink. I believe the Lord has used this incident to increase my faith. He proved He is able to do even greater things. I am done with breadcrumbs faith; I am going for the whole bread, what He has promised. I have things I am trusting God for this year and I am believing God for daring faith, hope you join me.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning.

Matthew 14:22-33, “28 And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if it is You, command me to come to You on the water.” 29 So He said, “Come.” And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.

The subject of faith has been preached, taught on and abused at the same time. The many faith teachings I’ve listened to are more about what God can do for you financially and health wise. And if you’ve listened to the same, be enlightened that here is more to faith than that. Teachings on faith today mostly dwell on by products of faith and less of it as prime product which is the essence of faith. We find that often times too many of us have enough faith for breadcrumbs and not enough for a whole bread, what He has promised. Faith enough to get us by and not ready to welcome anything else that will challenge us to grow more our faith in God.

Let me share on faith that’s beyond getting us stuff, faith that brings about more glory to God in our lives. It’s not what you will gain from God that is priority, it’s what God will gain for Himself through you, the rest are benefits. That is where the Prime product supersedes the by product. Faith ought to distinguish us from the world for we are not walking by sight but by faith; not by luck but by faith. Faith in what? Faith in God activated on unfamiliar territories. If “faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen”, Hebrews 11:1, then how do we hope for what we see in the familiar territories? I believe that if we are not walking by faith,(trusting God for great and mighty things), we are robbing God of the glory He could gain from working in us and through us.

In our text, Jesus had just fed 5 thousand men besides women and children with five loaves of bread and two little fish. Right after, He made His disciples go on the boat to the other side while He sent the multitude home. He then went to pray and then to meet them later. 24 “But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, tossed by the waves, for the wind was contrary”, come to think of it and I could be wrong, most miracles that involved ONLY the disciples appeared to be happening in water (lake, sea) and that is fascinating to me. First, the sea was an unfamiliar territory, they were far from everyone else and the usual. In the sea, they had no one to trust in but God, they couldn’t even put their faith in each other to bring them through. Everything they tried to do could not succeed. The obstacles they faced happened in the middle of the sea, in the middle of darkness and not at the shore. These were places where they could not operate by sight but by faith. And I believe that we will never trust God for great and mighty things as long as we are trading on safe grounds or familiar territories where if something does not happen as we expect it to, we have a back up plan to fall back on.

Vs 25, “Now in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went to them, walking on the sea”, this must have been going on most of the night for when Jesus met them, between 3-6 AM, He had prayed all night while these men battled the wind all night. Jesus knew what they would be facing and still let them go, it was a faith learning class in the unfamiliar territory. He came walking on water prayed up while His disciples were hanging onto the boat for their dear lives with no avenue of escape. Then the disciples saw Him walk on water and they were afraid thinking He was a ghost.

Now the boat was just a little familiar, they have travelled by it many times and I believe that when all failed, all their little left faith (breadcrumbs) was on that boat to save them, and Here comes the King of kings, walking on water. No one had ever walked on water. And Peter all of a sudden forgets everything about what they had just gone through the night and was still facing and says “Lord, if it is You, command me to come to You on the water.” It was Peter’s idea to step out of the boat by faith, moved from asking for crumbs (wind to cease) to walk on water, while the rest were left in the boat. Desiring to step out onto what almost killed them and face it head on because the Master was present. He’s faith increased for if the Master could do the impossible and he was His disciple and a disciple ought to learn from His teacher, he mastered faith in the Lord and attempt the impossible. It’s assign that he was learning and growing. When was the last time you trusted God for something way bigger than you while in the middle of the sea? Salvation of a loved one, a miracle over what you perceived as way too bigger than even your so called back up plan. We can’t keep operating on the little faith we have when there is more we can trust God for. We got to have something, a middle of sea experience awakens, challenges and increases our faith to even step out and concur by faith what has threatened to take our lives. To walk on what could make us drown, that is faith in God. Psalm 37:4, “Delight yourself also in the LORD, And He shall give you the desires of your heart”, Without faith it’s IMPOSSIBLE to PLEASE God and to delight ourselves in the Lord is to have great pleasure in walking by the measure of His faith and not our faith that He will glorify Himself through us. Those who delight in Him He gives them desires of their heart because they are in line with His desires for us. Peter’s delight in the Lord caused the Lord to honor his desires. To finish

Thanks

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hebrews 11:6, For without faith, it is impossible to please Him for he that comes to God must first believe that He is and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him”

I am amazed how in life we can have faith in someone or something based on someone else’ word or our test as proof that I works. A good example, when we board the plane, our faith is in the pilot to get us to our destination. We don’t dig in to find out how the plane leaves the ground, what routes it’s to takes, how much gas it has simply because we faith it has what it takes to get us where are going. I’ve never heard anyone walk over to the pilot to ask him for his qualifications, certificates to prove he is qualified to fly the plane. If Jesus is the captain of our salvation, how come it’s hard to trust Him sometimes with all?. Come to think about it, the bible says Psalm 118:8, “It’s better to trust in the Lord than to put our confidence in man” look at it closely, it’s the Lord who is in charge and not man. He may use men to accomplish what He has planned for His people. I believe that some people have made it to the other side because someone somewhere believed God for a move by faith.

“For without faith it is impossible to please God”, straight to the point. The word “hard” is not used but “impossible”. This shows that in order to make it with God you MUST have faith. If the word “hard” was used instead, then I could see a room for compromise, the word “impossible” closes every avenue and leaves you with these four words, “have faith in God”. Why is this coming to us this morning? It’s because many have allowed Jesus to be the Savior of their lives but they have never let Him be Lord of their lives which is the basis of faith. Lordship is a powerful word as you are no longer in control of your destiny but He is. Jesus as Lord enables us to operate by faith for our lives being in His hands. If passengers entrust their lives to the Pilot, it’s high time we began to put our entire faith in Christ. He knows where we are and where we are going.

“He that comes to God must first believe that He is a rewarder”. Who can march to someone and ask them for a million dollars if I knew they didn’t have it. When I go to the Lord’s presence, the relationship I have with Him teaches me trust and allows me to learn more that His intentions were not just to save me but do much more in my life as His son for His glory. I am confident in asking Him by faith to lead me, guide me, strengthen me, provide for me for I know that He is able. I don’t need someone to tell or explain it to me as my salvation in Christ is the greatest lesson in faith I have ever learnt. The same God who saved me, is the same God who will keep me, I have faith in His abilities to do much more.

“Diligently seek Him”, many people fail at this point simply because they asked the Lord yesterday and He did not do it in their time, why continue to have faith in Him?. I have been there if He did not do it or if He wasn’t doing it fast enough, I became my own Lord, answered my own prayers and led my own ways. There are things that have to be sought diligently, earnestly and constantly, they are greater faith builders and they teach us patience.

Faith in God is what we need and faith in God is what is going to carry us through. I pray this week as we look at the subject of faith, that we will move from having faith for bread crumbs to having faith for the whole bread for there is something dynamic in going for the bread than crumbs.

Thanks Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Corinthians 5:20, “Now then, we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading through us: we implore you on Christ’s behalf, be reconciled to God”

Ambassadors are ministers of the highest rank, with full authority to represent their country. If you are born again, you need to realize that you are an ambassador for Christ. You are a minister with a highest rank raised to represent his country, the Kingdom of heaven with the gospel. We are not of this world, we are ambassadors in this world. Those who are saved are citizens of heaven temporarily on assignment here on earth (country). No ambassador comes in his own authority and does what he wants, he displays a lifestyle depicting what his country is like.

I find it discouraging sometimes when believers who should act like ambassadors are acting more like secret agents. For whatever reason, they find it hard to be indentified with their own country at work, in the community. It’s like living a double life. On Sunday morning everyone knows him to be an ambassador by the way he conducts himself and then the rest of the week, he is the only one who knows he is a believer. The word of God says in Matthew 5:16, “Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven”?. God has called you to be a diplomat where you are, first to be a light and second with God given opportunities to bring His message to those in need. It’s not the title that defines a person, it’s the duty behind the title that displays truly who you are.

What qualifies a person to be an ambassador, vs. 17, tells us that “Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; old things have passed away; behold, all things have become new”. That is the start but realize it doesn’t stop there, next step, vs. 18″ Now all things are of God, who has reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ, and has given us the ministry of reconciliation, A minister is not given the title to feel good about himself, he is given a title to fulfill the roles of that title. We are made ministers, ambassadors for the ministry of reconciliation. This speaks to the reality that God wills to be reconciled with sinners. God has called believers to shine while proclaiming the gospel of reconciliation to others. Through service such as waiting on tables, God wants Christians to accept the privilege of serving unbelievers while proclaiming a desire to be reconciled. Ambassadors have authority and the back up from the country they represent.

Paul said that if we are really Christians, then we are “ambassadors of Christ”, we are God’s sole representatives in this foreign land called “the world.” With that analogy in mind, consider what a president would think of an ambassador to a foreign country, say Russia, who is told to deliver an extremely urgent message that will involve the peace of the whole world. And that ambassador (even with the best intentions) chooses not to be identified with his country in a foreign land and gives only a small part of the message, in such a way that it makes a very different impression than what the president wanted to make. How should the president think of that ambassador and reward him when he finds out the damage done?

An ambassador is not afraid to show whose he is and what country he represents, if anything, he delights in the fact that God would entrust him with such a high rank position he does not deserve or qualify for. To be everything He wants us to be before He takes us home to be with Him when the time comes. You and I are ambassadors for Christ, let’s act like it everywhere we are.

* Today is my birthday, I turned 35. Do keep me in your prayers as I start a new year in this journey of life as an ambassador for Christ

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Songs of Solomon 2:1, “I am the Rose of Sharon, and the Lily of the valleys”

While Jesus taught His disciples and the people who came to listen to Him, many times He likened the Kingdom of heaven while using parables in order for His listeners to see something visual they relate to to make His message clear. This morning we will liken the life of a believer to flower. The other day I picked some flowers for my wife, I know she loves flowers and flowers melts her heart. I don’t respond to flowers like she does maybe because I am a man and men respond to other things but you get the point.

Lets begin by understanding what a flower is. According to the dictionary definition, A flower is a plant that is cultivated and appreciated for it’s blossoms. The first thing appreciated about it is it’s beauty, when God created the world, He looked at what He had created and concluded that it was good. You may not feel that you are beautiful both inside and outside, and you may feel you are not significant in this life, you need to be reminded the creator fearfully made you and appreciated His handiwork and I could imagine Him saying, “you are unique and special, there is no one else I will create like you. You have no competition in the entire world”. Psalm 139:14, “I will praise You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made”.

Not only are the flowers beautiful, they have fragrance. I know of certain flowers when the light shines on them especially at night, they produce some nice smelling fragrance and creates a warm atmosphere when the breeze blows through them. What an opportunity to allow the light of Christ to shine through the beautiful flower He has created and allow it to blossom and bring fragrance to your family, friends and this around you. With that in mind, we can say that flowers bring life to the surrounding. Go to any home, see how if there are no flowers around, that house and it’s surrounding appear dull. Add a few flowers and you bring to life the surrounding. Through that life, flowers also do attract people, birds, insects, how this shows when you begin to be the flower God wants you to be, everyone even the people who don’t like you will be moved and attracted by what they see in you. Let’s not forget that flowers brightens and melts a heart. Ladies love flowers, I say, “the way to the heart of a woman is a flower to make the way” (hope I’m not wrong), it reminds them they are special. Flowers have away of bringing joy and peace in someone’s life. Why do they usually bring flowers to a person who is sick in the hospital especially ladies? not only can the medicine be a means of healing, kind thoughts and acts of love have a way of also restoring. To add to what I am talking about, flowers are delicate and tender.

For a flower to maintain all these qualities, it must be given a special attention, cared for. During spring and summer, as you drive around, you see people giving special attention to flowers, natured, watered, planted close to the house, around it decorated to make it look even beautiful, dry leaves around it are removed, fertilizer put around it to help it grow and more so, planted on well prepared soil. The Lord does the same with His children, He desires the best for them and He gives His children a special attention, providing everything that they need to bring to life what I have already shared. The Lord keeps on reaching out and inspecting the flower, spending time with it, putting it in the right spot to ensure enough sun light. You may think that the Lord has deserted you but look deep and you will see that He is taking good care of His flowers why? Sa Matthew Henry the commentator puts is, “Christ is pleased to compare himself to; and he condescends very much in the comparison. He that is the Son of the Highest, the bright and morning star, calls and owns himself the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys, to express his presence with his people in this world, the easiness of their access to him, and the beauty and sweetness which they find in him, and to teach them to adorn themselves with him, as shepherds and shepherdesses, when they appeared gay, were decked with roses and lilies, garlands and chaplets of flowers. The rose, for beauty and fragrance, is the chief of flowers, and our Saviour prefers the clothing of the lily before that of Solomon in all his glory…”. I too refer to Him as the Rose of Sharon and the Lily of the valley. He said, “Let us make man in Our image” so here we are just like Him, a flower. He did not make something He couldn’t take care of.

Words from a song I love, “Of all the flowers in the world there is none that can compare, with the rose that God designed it’s beauty is so rare. With His great love, His tender care, He watches till it’s grown. Then He comes to pick the Rose and He takes it for His own” Can you see yourself the way the Lord sees you? Can you say confidently that you are beautiful, have fragrance, you bring life around, you attract, you brighten, you are delicate and you get special attention? Remember, you are a flower in His garden!!!

Thanks

Ev

Good morning,

Judges 6:11-27, “12 And the Angel of the LORD appeared to him, and said to him, “The LORD is with you, you mighty man of valor!” 13 Gideon said to Him, “O my lord, if the LORD is with us, why then has all this happened to us? And where are all His miracles which our fathers told us about, saying, ‘Did not the LORD bring us up from Egypt?’ But now the LORD has forsaken us and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites.”

Meditating on encouragements has opened my heart and mind to many men and women in the bible who encountered discouragements in the lives. These were normal people and their true stories are encouragement to us too that if they overcame their discouraging times, we too can.

Today I look at a man by the name of Gideon as told in judges 6. Gideon’s discouragement is a little different because he felt the Lord was against him and his people being that God allowed the Midianites to attack them year in year out. He couldn’t turn to God whom he felt was against him. If you read Numbers 31, you will find that the Israelites had very much defeated the Midianites under the leadership of Moses. The Midianites were no march to them.

How did it come that the Midianites became a thorn in the flesh unto the Israelites? Vs 1 tells us, “Then the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the Lord. So the Lord delivered them into the hand of the Midian for seven years,” in simple words, the Midianites oppressed Israel. And if you know what oppression is, it’s to inflict distress or dominate harshly. This drove the Israelites hiding in caves, mountains and strongholds. The Midianites who would come in year in year out and destroy their produce and their animals leaving them with no sustenance. In this we are told of Gideon who knew well that the hand of the Lord was driving the Midianites against him and his people and like others, he was hiding, distressed, confused, discouraged with no one to turn to.

Vs. 11 “Now the Angel of the LORD came and sat under the terebinth tree which was in Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite, while his son Gideon threshed wheat in the winepress, in order to hide it from the Midianites”, looking at the way this verse and others here are presented and punctuated, you find that the Angel of the Lord is identified as the Lord Himself. Either He appeared as an Angel or Gideon would have seen Him as an Angel. Whichever way, the Lord was present with him and watching him struggle threshing wheat in the winepress to hide it. He was used to using oxen to do this kind of job, now he is doing it by hand, hiding hoping the Midianites would not recognize him or see his stuff.

Vs 12 And the Angel of the LORD appeared to him, and said to him, “The LORD is with you, you mighty man of valor!” How can it be that the Lord would say He is with him when the current situation painted another picture? Not only that, He mentioned to Him that he was a mighty man of valor? Doesn’t make sense and he challenges it, 13 Gideon said to Him, “O my lord, if the LORD is with us, why then has all this happened to us? Right now there are people who messed up in some areas and are facing trials and are feeling like the Lord is against them and is out to destroy them. They can’t turn to the Lord because of their shame, they know that Lord is dealing with them but feels like He is against them. Feeling like Gideon hiding under the wine press hoping your enemy will not find you, let this be an encouragement, the Lord is with you and will bring you through. If He was against you, He would have destroyed you, the bible says Proverbs 3:12, “For whom the LORD loves He corrects, Just as a father the son in whom he delights”. He has not forsaken the one He corrects.

How was the Lord with Gideon anyway, God prevented him from being captured, God gave him wisdom on how to keep something for himself, even in his discouragement he wasn’t suicidal, his tribe was the weakest yet the Lord prepared a leader to be. If you feel the Lord is against you, how come you still have life? Are you going without food? Are there enemies driving you out of your home? Etc Yes we have tough times but are we seeing the Lord present even in them for us to be encouraged that He has it all under control? Gideon was wondering whether the Lord was with him because there were no miracles or victories like before. I would say they were there but not as he expected them. Not only did the Lord tell him He was with him, also called him mighty in that when he was done with him he would be one. Job 23:10, “But He knows the way that I take; When He has tested me, I shall come forth as gold”.

My message this morning is, the Lord is with you right where you are. You may feel His correcting rod, you should rejoice because the enemy does not have the rod of correction in his hands; he is a destroyer of life. Psalm 23: 4 Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; For You are with me; Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me. The shepherd’s club and crook are viewed as comforting instruments of protection and direction, respectively.

Thanks
Ev

title.rendered: You Are Your Own Best Encourager, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 4:8-37, ” 26″Please run now to meet her and say to her, ‘Is it well with you? Is it well with your husband? Is it well with the child?'” And she answered, “It is well.”

I find there other things the enemy use in obstacles to tear families apart. Under pressure, people say or do things they later regret. While discouraged some people become very insensitive, feeling like they are the only victims and if no one joins their pity party they become hostile to those who might not be discouraged as they are. Such victims fight flesh and blood not knowing there is an enemy behind it trying to find ways to tear apart. It’s frustrating and discouraging when you feel that those who are around you are not challenged the same way you are directly. I can see this with couples where the wife dealing with something chocking out courage and leaving her discouraged and frustrated and she gets worse when she perceives her husband does not understand, shows little or no sign of care. Again if we don’t master how we stand in the presence of obstacles, we can bring down our lives and those around us.

The bible tells us of a story of a shunammite woman. Very ordinary notable woman married but without a child. Any time Elisha was in town, she would prepare a place for him and his servant to rest and besides that prepare food for them. She perceived this man to be a prophet and so she took good care of them with her husband’s permission. Her act of kindness led Elisha to promise her a son by prophesy the year to follow. It was hard for her to believe the promise while looking at herself barren and her husband old. What was about to happen would change the course of her life and family. God honored the prophesy.

Her act of kindness opened a door for her and husband to have a son. Back then to have a son was huge, a son to inherit what the father had and even the name. What a miracle baby, they cared for him, had hopes and dreams for the son, a child in their old age, vs. 18, and the child grew. Now it happened one day that he went out to his father, to the reapers. 19, “and he said to his father, “my head, my head” So he said to a servant, “carry him to his mother”, 20,”When he had taken him and brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees till noon, and then died”. There are a couple of things that puzzle me from these two verses, first the whole time the son was well, the father appeared to be present in his life but when sickness came, the father had no idea what to do. How many would frustrate with their spouses at an hour like this? Instead of doing something, he tells one of the servants to take his son to the mother. You may be wondering as I have wondered, what kind of father is this? And when the son is brought to his mother, she places him on her knees maybe pondering what this is all about, that it appears to be her problem. Confused, broken, discouraged, fear gripping her heart, whom can she turn to? A promise to her by the man of God has turned into tragedy in just short time. If she was not promised a son, she would not be dealing with grief. A husband who should be beside her to encourage and strength her is nowhere to be found. Very discouraging situation, what can she do, where can she draw strength? No one is there to encourage her, so she gathers strength in the midst of her pain and makes a move in search of the man of God. She is not blaming her husband for anything, not fighting him, not bad mouthing him, if anything she may have known that she had faith to carry her through and had more composure than her husband in this situation.

Vs 21, and she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God, shut the door upon him, and went out” vs. 22 Then she called to her husband and said, “Please send me one of the young men and one of the donkeys, that I may run to the man of God and come back”. A discouraged woman not ready to throw in the towel yet, she is not burying the dead yet. She knows the facts are real but her faith is not facts, “the just shall live by faith”. Faith to rise, faith to encourage oneself and faith for herself and her loved ones. Faith to believe that after it has been said and done, only God gets the credit. Facts could not give her a child before only faith and that is the same faith will carry her through.

Vs 23, “so he said (her husband), “why are you going to him today? It is neither the New Moon nor the Sabbath” And she said, “It is well”. Even when the husband tried to discourage her, her faith was strong keeping her encouraged. In the midst of the loss and the discouragement. She said, “It is well”. Vs 25, “…when the man of God saw her a far off, that he said to his servant Gehazi, “look, the shunammite woman! Vs 26, please run now to meet, and say to her, “Is it well with you? Is it well with your husband? Is it well with the child?” And she answered, “it is well”. Note something here, she was not showing any sign of distress, she was not seeking to appear like she had problems, she may have not wanted to discourage others or others to discourage her. All she could do was keep her focus to meet the man of God and there pour her heart out. What a woman who learnt to pour out her heart to the right person, the person who could help her. Meanwhile she encouraged herself speaking well of his family. She is well, though grief was heavy in her heart; Husband was well, although he did not encourage her; son is well though he is dead. She could only speak these words because of her faith in what the man of God could do through the power of God. As long as Elisha had not declared nothing could be done, her encouragement was that it’s not over until it’s over. In the end, her son was restored to life and the entire family rejoiced again.

She was her best encourager and had she not encouraged herself, nothing would have happened. Who knows whether this act of encouragement accompanied by faith lifted up her husband’s spirit and faith. To conclude that he has a virtuous woman who knows how to encourage herself and others. She could have been frustrated because of her husband; she took the opportunity to shine in the midst of it all because she learned to encourage herself. Psalm 61:2, “…, When my heart is overwhelmed; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I. Psalm 42:5, 11, 43:5, Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God, …”.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Sam 30:1-30, “…But David strengthened himself in the LORD his God”

Discouragement is one of the destroyers of lives and I believe one of the most dangerous things to allow in your life. Discouragement cuts off the flow of encouragement leaving you paralyzed gasping for breath. From what I have learnt in my life, discouragements tends to come where there are obstacles. Something is not working or flowing like it should or expected, or something in my life is threatened. We as believers have to learn how to encourage ourselves and be an encouragement to others. It’s easy to wait for someone to come to encourage you but this morning I would pray you will learn to be our own best encourager in the presence of every obstacle that might try to being you discouragements.

David and his men were faced by a situation that brought discouragement in their lives. David had just come back to Ziklag a place where their families including were camping. During this time, David had been anointed the next king meanwhile a fugitive pursued by Saul before his time to reign. David and his 600 men were out to team up with the Philistines to fight Israel. The Philistines did not trust David for they feared he was in a position of turning against them while in the battle field and so they refused to allow him to team up with them and David and his men came back to what they called home.

When they came back, they found in their absence their enemies, Amalekites came in and captured David’s wives, his children and possessions, not only that, they took all the wives of his men, their children and their possessions. They went as far as burning the entire place down. Does this not this remind you of the mission of the devil, John 10:10, “The thief cometh not but for to steal, kill and destroy” and when they found what happened, 4 “… David and the people who were with him lifted up their voices and wept, until they had no more power to weep”. What would you do if you were in David’s shoes, I would do the same, weep until no more strength is left. Do you have something you are facing that has caused you to weep or distressed leaving you with no more power? It was very discouraging time for David, the soldiers he could turn to for encouragement were in the same predicament, discouraged as he was. In David’s discouragement, more pressure was put on him by his soldiers, they wanted to stone their leader, you may be feeling pressure from others too. 6 Now David was greatly distressed, for the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and his daughters. But David strengthened himself in the LORD his God.

In his hard, dark, discouraging times, when no one was there to encourage him, he turned to his source of strength, God. I can imagine him revisiting the many testimonies of how God had brought him through hard times, the promises of God that he will be the next king, knowing that God would not bring him this far and leave him defeated. He strengthened himself in the Lord maybe through Psalm and songs. Who knows what he did, all we know is that he drew strength from the wells of salvation.

He learnt to lay his own foundation of encouragement in the Lord. He learnt that he was his best encourager. Knowing himself better than anyone else, he knew what would encourage him to ask for it. Maybe he moved a little away from the discouraged men so he could call on God to strengthen him before he could be effective to encourage others. You can not give out what you don’t have within. When you are torn inside, the house has to be brought back in order for it to stand. Are you discouraged this morning due to the economy, sickness, family situations and other things?. Stop speaking death in your life that bring about defeat and stop looking to people to lay a foundation of encouragement for you. Shut everything and everyone out, seek God to strengthen you, read His word and practice it, sing if you must but shut every door of discouragement out, if God’s sends someone to encourage you, let them find a foundation already laid that they help you build the wall. Choose to live a life full of encouragement. Boats and ship only sink when the water outside comes on the inside. As long as it’s sailing and there are heavy winds and heavy storms, it can make it as long as the outside is not allowed inside. You too can stand if you do not allow discouragements to come inside. Psalm 27:13, “I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living”, Don’t allow the enemy to steal your courage.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ephesians 6:10-20, “Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil”

I would like to take us to the book of Ephesians 6 and share some thoughts from it. To fight effectively in your spiritual battle, you must know Christ, obey His standards, and be prepared to fight. Anyone in Christ is targeted by the enemy. If Jesus was attacked in the wilderness by the devil, be ready to be attacked.

Paul in his conclusion to the epistle he wrote to the Ephesians, he begins in verse 10 by saying, “Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might”. I find it very important to pay attention to the last words for they sum up everything that has already been said. He’s encouragement to them is to be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might. Later he shares with them on how to be strong. In the power of His might is derived from Zechariah 4:6, “… Not by might, not by power but by My Spirit, says the Lord of hosts”. It’s clear that by His might we are talking by His Spirit because God empowers us through Him.

Vs. 11, “Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil”. It will be beneficial to define armor to understand why we need to put it on. Armor is a defensive, as of metal, wood, or leather, worn to protect the body against weapons. So we can say that we have weapons formed against us always flying to destroy us, we need protection. To know that we are at war, let vs. 12 bring it to light, “For we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this age, against spiritual hosts of wickedness in the heavenly places”. I don’t want to concentrate so much on what we fight against, I want to concentrate on how to get ready for it.

Vs 14, “Stand therefore, having girded your waist with truth”, What really holds us together is the truth, the truth becomes the belt that holds what we know dearly. The truth tightens and chocks every lie out. “Having put on the breast plate of righteousness”, this is like putting on the bullet proof vest why? because it is the most sensitive part of the body. It is a part that is vulnerable and can be destroyed easily. The bible says in Proverbs 4:23, “Keep thy heart will diligence, for out of it are the issues of life” That is where life begins for a Christian and that is a place that must be girded well as I know that it defines who we are in Christ. vs. 15. “Having shod your feet with the preparation of gospel of peace”, a soldier is someone who is ready to march into the battle field. His aim is to defeat the enemy, win and rescue those that are held captive in sin, vs. 16. “Above all, taking the shield of faith with which you will be able to quench the fiery darts of the wicked one”, if you are going to win, you got to have a shield, something to strengthen what you already have. The neat thing about the shield, it can be used to protect every part of the body not like the other gargets that are used to protect a particular area. Faith defends the truth, the heart, the feet, and the head to mention a few. Hebrews 11:6, “without faith, it is impossible to please Him…”. This means we can have everything but without the shield, we will not please Him the reason why the bible says “ABOVE ALL TAKE THE SHIELD OF FAITH”. vs. 17. “And take the helmet of salvation”, people who go riding horses, bike, motorcycles always where helmets. It has been proven that it can save lives and it has done so many times. When we have the helmet of salvation, we too are safe when we sometimes fall, yes we might have bruises and pains but we still know that we haven’t lost our salvation. “and the word of the Spirit, which is the word of God”. This is the only offensive weapons as the rest are defensive weapons. Hebrews 4:12, ” For the word of the Lord is living and powerful, sharper than any double edged sword, piercing even division of soul and spirit, and of joints and marrows, and is a discerner of thoughts and the intents of the heart”. The word does all the fighting with an aim to win. Different gargets talked about that we need them all the reason Paul tells us to put on the WHOLE OF THE ARMOR.

I would like to sum up the entire process of dressing for the battle by quoting this scripture, Romans 13:14, “But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh to fulfill it’s lust thereof”. Putting on the Lord Jesus means putting on the Whole Armor of God. He is everything from the truth, John 14:6, He is righteous Romans 10:3, His is the reason for the gospel Isaiah 52:7, He is the shield of faith, Psalm 3:3, He is salvation, Romans 10:13, He is the sword of the Spirit, John 1:1. You put on the Lord Jesus, you have all it takes to stand against the wile of the devil. Put Him on always!!!

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1John 5:4, “For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world—our faith”

The battle every believer faces is the world, the flesh and the devil. And the more you walk with the Lord the more the battle intensifies and the more you ought to crave to be an overcomer. If you are born of God, your walk with the Lord will continue to reveal things you are vulnerable to, things you may have never thought to be sin and conviction will bring you to your knees, why?, because the more you walk with the Lord, the more His righteousness is revealed and the more you see yourself in your true state leaving you helpless in need of God’s power to overcome. Who in their right mind wants to live a defeated life? I don’t, I want to live a victorious life under the power of God present.

Romans 1:17, tells us, “For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith to faith; as it is written, “The just shall live by faith.” Right after verse 16 which talks about the gospel of Christ as the power of God unto salvation, we are told more about what the power of God through the gospel does, in it is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith. The same power that saved us, is the same power that ought to keep us. 1John 5:4, tells us that those who are saved, born of God should have the power to overcome the world, the flesh and the devil. To overcome, you got to have a battle in before you and the power over it..

The saving faith is the first characteristic of an overcomer, born of God. The second is Love, 1 john 5: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and ﻿keep His commandments”, a person who is an overcome, a victor, a conqueror, a winner is one who keeps God’s commandments. Not out of obligation or fear of punishment but out of love, it demonstrates what a changed life looks like. An overcomer is one who is craving for righteousness Matthew 5:6, “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, For they shall be filled” what you feed the most is what overcomes, you feed the spirit, fuel the spirit you overcome. Such a person understands that it’s not by might, nor by power but by the Spirit of God. We couldn’t do it while were in the world ourselves, how can we do it in Christ without His help?

2 Timothy 1:7, “For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind” When we love God we overcome fear because of His power within us. Fear is not of God, it’s an enemy of faith that must be conquered. Romans 8:37, ” says “Yet in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us”. we overcome (conquer) when we love our brothers and loving our brothers would mean not stealing from them, lust after them, murder with words, jealousy, stinginess, coveting, dishonoring etc, these are the things we battle daily while serving the Lord we must overcome to live a victorious life. How many even battle honoring their spouses or loving their children? I believe one true test of an overcomer is one who is faithful to his spouse in word, in conduct and in thoughts. It’s amazing how we can be nice to people out there and be nasty at home to our loved ones. The ones at home are the ones the Lord uses to bring about things in us that need to be conquered. An overcomer lives a life pleasing to the Lord before his family and by your own strength it’s impossible.

We ought to continue to have victory day by day while battling and overcoming what is set before us. What you don’t battle and overcome will come back to haunt you, from a movie Shaka Zulu, Shaka made this quote “Never leave an enemy behind or it will rise again to fly at your throat”, the enemy must be defeated by all means and the power of God in us is what will help us overcome by faith.

I want to say no to lust, no to pride, no to jealousy, no to fear, no to doubt, by fueling the fire of righteousness that has power to overcome the power of sin, and it begins by faith that it can be done. My obedience is required, “And this is the victory that has overcome the world—our faith” Are you living in victory? Crave for righteousness, pray like crazy, stand firm and overcome the enemy of souls. It’s not by might, nor by power but by His Spirit says the Lord.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 1:16, “For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ, for it is the power of God to salvation for everyone who believes …”

I’ve been meditating on the word “power” since late last week as the Lord has been dealing with me concerning power that ought to be present in my life and around me and in other people’s lives. Many of us know about the power, the question is?, is it present in our lives and are we craving to see it at work? Could it be that the Lord has switched off power in some lives because people are not hungry to actually cry out to God for more? While meditating on Romans 1:16, I cannot think of a story in the bible that brings this clearly like the story of Lazarus being raised from the dead in John 11. I have seen people get saved to my thought appeared to be the hard ones to come to Christ and I believe the Lord does it constantly to remind us of His power to save through His gospel. I believe the Lord is calling on us to pray to Him to empower us to share and at the same time pray for His power to save the lost. I will share some thoughts and also borrow words shared by men of God I respect (Ray Comfort and John McArthur)

First of all, Paul declares, the gospel is the power of God. Dunamis (power) is the Greek term from which our word dynamite is derived. The gospel carries with it the omnipotence of God, whose power alone is sufficient to save men from sin and give them eternal life.

John reports to us that Lazarus is 4 days dead and buried. When Jesus comes, He comes to give life that no one can give and His message to Lazarus’ sisters in John 11:25 …, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me, though he may die, he shall live. 26 And whoever lives and believes in Me shall never die. Do you believe this?”. And only Christ in His power could give Lazarus life and it’s the power of God through the gospel that can give a sinner life.

If the gospel is the power of God unto salvation, how is it that there are people who can make profession of faith and not live it? Could it be that the power of God actually never saved them? To quote Ray, “What it is is a sad admission of the amount of confidence we have in the power of our message and in the keeping power of God. If God has saved them, God will keep them. If they’re born of God, they’ll never die. If He’s begun a good work in them, He’ll complete it to that day (Philip. 1:6); if He’s the author of their faith, He’ll be the finisher of their faith (Heb. 12:2). He’s able to save to the uttermost them that come to God by Him (Heb. 7:25). He’s able to keep them from falling and present them faultless before the presence and glory with exceeding joy (Jude 24). Jesus said, “No one will pluck you from my father’s hand” (John 10:29).

You see, saints, the problem is that Lazarus is four days dead (John 11). We can run in the tomb, we can pull him out, we can prop him up, we can open his eyes, but “he stinketh” (vs. 39). He needs to hear the voice of the Son of God. And the sinner is four days dead in his sins. We can run up and say, “Say this prayer.” Still, he needs to hear the voice of the Son of God, or there is no life in him; and the thing that primes the sinner’s ear to hear the voice of the Son of God is the law. It’s a schoolmaster to bring him to Christ that he might be justified through faith (Gal. 3:24)”

John 11:38, “Then Jesus, again groaning in Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone lay against it. 39 Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” if Christ had the power to bring life, He had the power to remove the stones too yet he tells them to take away the stones by the grave. While it’s the power of God that gives life to Lazarus, we as believers have the task of removing stones by the grave side by simply living Christ before the lost, Interceding and witnessing to the lost. That’s we can ever do to our unsaved loved ones, friends and those we reach out to. Remember Lazarus’s sister called on Christ, Christ encouraged them, Christ used them too and Christ gave life.

To quote John McArthur, “Only the power of God is able to overcome man’s sinful nature and impart spiritual life. Romans 5:6, “For when we were still without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly” Salvation through Christ is God’s powerful hand, as it were, that He has let down to lift men up. His salvation brings deliverance from the spiritual infection of “﻿this perverse generation﻿” (﻿Acts 2:40﻿), from lostness (﻿Matt. 18:11﻿), from sin (﻿Matt. 1:21﻿), and from the wrath of God (﻿Rom. 5:9﻿). It brings deliverance to men from their gross and willful spiritual ignorance (﻿Hos. 4:6﻿; ﻿2 Thess. 1:8﻿), from their evil self-indulgence (﻿Luke 14:26﻿), and from the darkness of false religion (﻿Col. 1:13﻿; ﻿1 Pet. 2:9﻿), but only for those who believe.

We LIVE, we PRAY and we WITNESS and the supernatural work of the Holy Spirit CONVINCES, CONVICTS, CONVERTS and CONTAINS.

Thanks
Ev
