content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Samuel 25:2-42, “Then David said to Abigail: “Blessed is the LORD God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me! And blessed is your advice and blessed are you, because you have kept me this day from coming to bloodshed and from avenging myself”

A question often asked, “Why does bad things happen to good people (of course there is no one good)?”, I have one of my own question, “Why do some nice people find themselves in what I would call bad marriages?”. Ever asked yourself that question? I have many times. A precious woman ending up with a very, I mean very wrong husband in my opinion and the other way round. This is my conviction about the whole situation, however bad someone is, there are certain people who have the grace to live and endure with them that no one else can. You couldn’t take it because you don’t have that kind of grace. Such people have been prepared for such people to take that responsibility. What could be your mess, by God’s grace could be someone else’ blessing. Look at these two women in the bible, Job’s wife and Jezebel, King Ahab’s wife. Job’s wife under pressure gave Job wrong advise but he never took it, Jezebel who is an evil woman gave her husband a wrong advise and he headed to it. Let me talk about a different woman today by the name of Abigail who also gave a good advise and that advise was taken by someone she wasn’t married to at the time.

Abigail is one of those women in the bible who blesses my heart. About the whole chapter is dedicated to her story. First of all, Abigail means Father rejoices. Her name does not seam to be working in her favor but God knows her dilemma. We are told of her character in 1Sam 25:3, “…And she is a woman of good understanding and beautiful appearance”. By reading her story, I gathered some of her qualities, she is a very intelligent woman, decisive, hard working, respectful, patient and cares for other people’s needs. She reminds me of what a virtuous woman is described in proverbs 31. She is married to a man by the name of Nabal who is harsh, evil, arrogant, stingy, lover of himself etc. I know that opposites attract but to me there is something wrong with this picture. How could a woman of all these qualities be married to a man like this? It seams to me that a lot of information is not conveyed to her yet concerning things she is suppose to know, she is not cherished as I gather from what I have read. Her qualities are left to go down the drain because she is not even appreciated for what she does. Her words, opinions, works are criticized by the person who should cherish them. How did she end up in a marriage like this? Who is she in this marriage? what is the purpose of her life? we will find out.

David and his men are in Carmel. A while back in Carmel, we are told he and his man protected Nabal’s life, his family, servants and all his properties. None of the things did they miss but now David is asking for a small favor from Nabal. He is not asking for reward, wealth, partnership in Nabal’s business, all he desired of Nabal was hospitality to which he never received. Nabal has so much to have forgotten David, he is asking who David is. vs. 11, “Shall I then take my bread and my water and my meat that I have killed for my shearers, to give it to men when I do not know where they are from?”. The verse has a lot of “I” and “MY” to which means, I take all the credit for what has happened. Do not be full and forget who you are, where you came from, who helped you, by what means things came about. Pride goes before a fall we know that. Nabal is really walking on thin ice, this will not only affect him but the people who are close to him. Nabal the rich man insulted David and his men and David was very angry and wroth that he rose up with his four hundred men heading towards Nabal’s territory to destroy it but here comes Abigail.

I wanted to lay a ground work on who Abigail and Nabal are and then tomorrow I will share more on Abigail’s qualities. Though her situation is tough and complicated, her beauty from within and outside is shinning brighter and brighter as you will see. IT’S NOT WHAT YOU GO THROUGH THAT DEFINES YOU, IT’S WHO YOU ARE, what a virtuous woman. What you go through may refine you or break you, the choice is yours. She doesn’t look blessed in her situation but she is blessed, check out what her name means and see her character.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 29:15-30, vs. 18 “Now Jacob loved Rachel; so he said, “I will serve (labor) you seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.”

For those who are in love or have been in love at some point will agree that there is a level of service you do for the one you love. It’s not out of obligation or guilt but out of the abundance of love flowing from within expressed. I call it the outworking of the internal. These are the times you find yourself doing things you would not normally do, going extra mile, constantly thinking of the one you love and wondering, how did you make it all these years without him or her? It’s a good feeling but I as have learnt, love is more than feelings, it’s a CHOICE. The other thing that makes it to blossom even more is when you learn the language of love your partner responds to. What you respond to might not be what your partner responds to.

I am also a firm believer of this quote of mine, “MARRIAGE IS WHAT YOU MAKE IT TO BE WITH GOD’S HELP”. Out of the abundance of this love one man asked, where does it go after one gets married? I have spoken to some people and it was clear, what they once had was no longer present or if it was, less attention was given to it. Let me take a principle from the story of Joseph and his two wives. Jacob was in love with Rachel, so he served her father seven years in order to marry her and what happened, he found himself with Leah in the morning, Rachel’s older sister exactly the opposite of what he desired. This is where my scripture comes in, someone in a relationship or marriage is feeling like they labored for Rachel but one morning they found themselves with Leah instead. What happened to the Rachel you labored for? How did she (he) turn out to be Leah after marriage (this is for both men and women).? Are you feeling like you were tricked into to marrying Leah thinking it was Rachel? What do you do now, get rid of Leah to find Rachel?. Jacob was disappointed to have married Leah but he did not get rid of her, since he still desired to marry Rachel, he still had a chance and therefore labored another 7 more years for her. This is what I call patience laboring in good times and in bad times to bring out what is missing. So Jacob had two wives, Leah and Rachel sisters but different. Both have different qualities and are all significant and vital.

Where does this leave us? Should we be in more than one relationship because what we desired did not come forth in the other? What we labored for was not birthed and so we throw in the towel? For me I see an opportunity to labor for a Rachel within the presence of a Leah. I have heard stories about people who labored for Rachel but felt like they ended up with Leah therefore labored in their marriage for some time without giving up on Leah to be married to Rachel. Same woman, double qualities. They confessed they almost threw away the best gift from God. They just realized there was a Rachel trapped inside their Leah’s they needed to labor for. They learnt that Leah had qualities Rachel did not have and vice versa. Their gifts and blessings complemented and completed each other. That is why we need to thank God for both strengths and weaknesses in our spouses.

Those who have succeeded learnt to speak the love language their mates could understand. Not their own love language they hoped their mates would understand. The more they did, the more the beauty both inside and outside was revealed to blossom. They came in as separate pieces together and began to assemble their love together, fitting each piece in it’s rightful place without trying to force around peg on a square hole. They learnt that it’s more than being together, it’s about assembly because you can be together but feel separate. Assembly requires work and skills building together. They didn’t want to try to separate a Rachel and a Leah, they discovered they could assemble both together after all they came from the same womb and fitted well by God’s design. Don’t dismiss Leah when she is a Rachel to be discovered and yet a Leah not lost. We can have extra ordinary relationships out of the ordinary because we have learnt to maximize opportunities within what we already have to bring out what we never had. It’s God’s way of growing us more in holiness, patience, persistence, stronger, appreciations as we labor through relationships other people would have given up on. Blessings Evans

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 14:14, "If you ask anything in My name, I will do it."

It's nearly impossible to tell someone "I know how you feel" in a tough situation when you have not gone through it yourself. Often mistake made is when you encourage someone who has either lost a dear one and say the same words when you've never been in that situation yourself before. If you've not gone through it, you don't know how it feels, period. The best way to respond is "I don't know how it feels but I want to let you know I care". The good encouragers are the ones who have had a taste of it and can stand and encourage because they are the point of reference to that person at that point.

For God to create, He only had to speak yet for Him to redeem, Christ had to suffer. There are many things that accompany Jesus' presence here on earth. We know His main mission was to come and die on the cross to save mankind at the same time when He was here, He taught, healed, raised the dead, raised leaders etc. We also need to understand He became a person (Man) to identify with us. YOU CANNOT REDEEM WHAT RELATED TO. Christ had to relate to us, bring Himself to our level then redeem us. He was here on earth 100% God and 100% Man. Living a normal human life, that was Jesus. He was tempted like any other man, was moved when He lost His friend Lazarus, rejected by men, lied on, hated by many, hungered, denied, had no place to live and call His own, experienced hardships, experienced exhaustion, emotionally drained, became a servant, whipped on the whipping post, stripped naked, crucified on the cross etc. When Jesus says to me, "I know how it feels son", I know He does, HE HAS BEEN THERE.

Here comes the good part, after His resurrection, He ascended into heaven but before then He says, John 14:14, "If you ask anything in My name, I will do it." Why do we pray in "Jesus name" and not in "God's name" directly? Jesus said, when you pray, pray in my name. God has never been flesh and blood, yes He is God but He has never reduced Himself to the level of men to feel what men feels. In the old testament they did not have GRACE like we do, they did not have the kind of mercy we have today, all these came more as a result of Jesus experience, the ultimate sacrifice. We offer prays to God through Jesus by the power of the Holy Spirit, Jesus takes our prayers and presents them to God in a better way. It's like a child who has picked flowers for his dad, he gives them to the mother and the mother preps them in a way they look presentable and gives them to the father saying, "from your son". Jesus having been here on earth prays on our behalf when we ask, "Father, I know how it feels to be in their position, do not destroy them, provide for them, let GRACE and MERCY plead for them. When I pray in Jesus name, Jesus presents my case to the Father as an experienced God/Man because He has been there. Proverbs 18:10, "The name of the LORD is a strong tower; The righteous run to it and are safe". Praying in His name causes you to stand strong supported by a strong tower. You are safe under that name when Jesus is busy presenting your case and my case to the Father. Romans 8:34, "Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, and furthermore is also risen, who is even at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us". Anything desired in line with God's word is released under Jesus name (signature, label). If we ask God through His Son's name, Jesus puts His seal of approval. Go through the one who knows your feelings. Be blessed  Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:13, “And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one” In reading the Lord’s prayer, I struggle understanding the first part “and lead us not into temptation” and the reason being, James 1:13 tells us ” Let no one say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God”; for God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does He Himself tempt anyone” a clear indication that God does not tempt anyone and He cannot be tempted by evil. Yes He may allow temptations to come but He is not the author of it. If that is the case, how do we explain Matthew 4:1,” Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil”. If God is not tempted and Jesus was God, how is it that He was led of the Holy Spirit not demonic spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil?. He was in the wilderness as God Man and the bible says He was tempted in all manner. While still at it, mark that the bible does not say that while he was in the wilderness, the devil tempted Him, He was led there to be tempted. And the temptation did not come to Him in His strong moments, it came in His weak moments as a Man. God Himself is never the agent of temptation (James 1:13), but here as in the book of Job God uses even satanic tempting to serve His sovereign purposes. And for Christ to be tempted is an indication that we will not be immuned to trials and temptations. Of course no one wants to be tempted and tried, but it has it’s place in our lives and can serve God’s purposes for His glory depending on how we handle it. Remember Christ was tempted in all points (Heb. 4:15; 1 John 2:16); Satan tempted Him with “the lust of the flesh” (Matt 4:2, 3); “the lust of the eyes” (Matt 4:8, 9); and “the pride of life” (Matt 4:5, 6). These are the same three temptations we all face in our lives, summed up the Flesh, the World, and the Devil

Jesus was tempted in all manner yet without sin. Here is a Martin Luther quote to make this point clear “YOU CAN’T STOP BIRDS FROM FLYING OVER YOUR HEAD BUT YOU CAN KEEP THEM FROM BUILDING A NEST IN YOUR HAIR.” In other words, you can’t stop temptations from coming your way but you can stop them from dwelling in you and taking control over you and God has to be our help in this area.

It is by temptation that we are tried and educated; yet we are justified in praying to our Father not to lead us into temptation so long as we live with childlike submission, to His loving will the means by which our faith is to be strengthened and our spiritual life purified and ennobled. We are not to go willingly into temptation, the reason it’s a battle. The temptation itself is not sin, but we fear that we may sin through it. 1Corinthians 10:13, No temptation has overtaken you except such as is common to man; but God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation will also make the way of escape, that you may be able to bear it. It’s through temptation that we see areas we are more vulnerable to and we cry out to God to deliver us from it. It’s in our weakness that He is strong, 2 Corinthians 12:9, “And He said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for My strength is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me”. Think of it this way, what has been manufactured is taken through tests to see how ready it is to be used. If they find that it’s not ready in certain areas, they take it back to the shop for more development Thank God that through temptations, He is growing us more in holiness.

And so when we pray, “Lead us not into temptation” it’s like saying, :”Lord, I know that temptations will come my way to serve your sovereign purposes and I know I am vulnerable to temptations for my flesh is craving to sin with it present, yet I pray that I will not be stubborn that I push aside everything and yield my flesh into the sin in the temptation and YOU LET ME HAVE MY WAY”, the last thing any one wants is to hear God say, “have it your way”. James 4:7 Therefore submit to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you. 8 Draw near to God and He will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double-minded. BUT DELIVER US FROM EVIL is the process of knowing God’s power, we ask Him to deliver us from the evil that is in the temptation, relying upon His promise that He will not suffer us to be tried above what we are able to handle, but with every temptation will provide us a way of escape. Everyone is vulnerable to some kind of temptations and no one is exempt from it. The first thing is knowing where we are and desiring God to bring us out of it while yielding to the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 2Corinthians 10:4-, Philippians 2:13-14, Job 23:10.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:12, “And forgive us our debts, As we forgive our debtors”

Forgiveness is a very powerful word yet it’s also a very hard thing to deal with. To forgive and to be forgiven have such great weights. I heard of a story of a man who was involved in killing the Jews during the time of Adolf Hitler. What he did resonated in his mind every single day and as he got closer to the death, he opted to find peace by looking for any Jew who would find in his heart to forgive him of his crime. He sought forgiveness diligently and was hard to find a person who could pronounce him forgiven.

I break out forgive into two words For & Give. “For” could be interpreted as Free. “Give” is the act of letting go what one is holding onto to (confession). If we want God to forgive us, we have to forgive others (let go what we are holding onto freely), drop the charges, throw the case out of the court. We have been forgiven much, we still fail the Lord every single day and we cry out to Him to forgive us what about us forgiving others. To continue looking at the parable Jesus gave, we see a servant forgiven of all his debt, Matthew 18:28 “But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii; and he laid hands on him and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’ Amplified bible version shows that a 100 denarii could be equivalent to 20 dollars. He owed 10 million while he was owed only 20 bucks. Remembering what he was forgiven should have filled his heart with gratitude and would have been willing to show compassion and kindness to one who owed him. Yet in the realm of our day to day living we find it hard to forgive our debtors, those who have wronged us. It’s like what they have done to us could not be done to anyone else. If we only understood what we’ve been forgiven, we would find it in our hearts to forgive. Therefore I believe Matthew 6:12, “And forgive us our debts, …” not only addresses our current sins we are seeking forgiveness for, it also reminds us of the great and many sins He has forgiveness us of already. Look at what this man did, he took matters into is own hands demanding to be paid and when this other servant could not pay, he threw him into prison completely forgetting the mercy he was shown when he needed one, how is this applicable to us. It’s easy to forget and react in away not expected of you, again we need to always remember what He has done for us. Here are some of the results of un forgiveness, un forgiveness takes a toll on you, it’s a thief of time, joy and peace. Un forgiveness is a poison the enemy uses to destroy a believer, it imprisons you, it prevents God from forgiving us; healing of the body, mind and spirit can be blocked because of un forgiveness; un forgiveness opens doors for you to be tormented, It blocks our prayers from being heard and answered, un forgiveness hinders your spiritual growth. Luke 6:14 “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. 15 But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses. , Matthew 18:34 “And his master was angry, and delivered him to the torturers until he should pay all that was due to him. 35 “So My heavenly Father also will do to you if each of you, from his heart, does not forgive his brother his trespasses., Mark 11:25, 25 “And whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him, that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses, Colossians 3:12, 12 Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, put on tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, longsuffering; 13 bearing with one another, and forgiving one another, if anyone has a complaint against another; even as Christ forgave you, so you also must do. James 5:16, “Confess your faults one to another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed”. Not only forgive, take it another mile and pray for those who despitefully use you, don’t pray about them, pray for them, pray a blessing over the lives . Peter asked how many times we should forgive people who wrong us, Jesus replied seventy times seven meaning always. Choosing to forgive is power in your hands you can use to release someone of your charges against them and open doors for greater blessings. The only way you can want to forgive is to remember of what you’ve been forgiven of and what un forgiveness does. Forgive us as we forgive.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:12, “And forgive us our debts, As we forgive our debtors”

Forgiveness is typically defined as the process of ceasing to feel resentment, indignation or anger for a perceived offense, difference or mistake, and ceasing to demand punishment or restitution. To clear from guilt justified by a fault.

Matthew 6:12, “And forgive us our debts, As we forgive our debtors”, once again I look at the order of things in this verse and I learn that I cannot process the second part “..As we forgive..” until I have addressed “..forgive us..” first. God is brilliant, He set it that way for a reason we will learn. God deals with us as we deal with us. Here is what I believe the reason is, Peter asked Jesus how many times one ought to forgive, Jesus in turn told them of a parable, Matthew 18:23, “Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who wanted to settles accounts with his servants”. In this parable, we find that there was a king who had servants and one servant owed him Ten thousand talents. Amplified bible version estimates 10,000 talents to be over 10 Million Dollars. Back then, 1 talent was a monetary unit worth about twenty years’ wages for a laborer. If this man lived 80 years, he could only repay back his master about 4 talents, what a debt. Matthew 18:25, says, “But as he was not able to pay, his master commanded that he be sold, with his wife and children and all that he had, and that payment be made”. There was no way ever that this man could pay his debt back in his state.

I think we still have failed to understand and also bring people to the knowledge of what we owe or owed the Lord. We want to tell people their debts are paid before they understand what their debt is and the cost of it. The Lord not only told us that this man owed, he told us exactly what he owed to shed light that it was no small debt and there is a reason why. The bible says in Romans 6:23, “for the wages of sin is death…”, that is the payment for sin which is transgression of the law, that is what it takes to satisfy the demand of the law broken. If a man was fined only 100 dollars, you can conclude his crime was petty but if you hear a man was sentenced to death, you can conclude his crime was huge the reason this parable hits home. What he owed condemned him to death.

You have to understand what you owe and in no position to pay it back however hard you try. The man who owed could not pay back and the payment which would still not be enough to cover his debt was to have him sold, his wife, his children and all that he had. In other words, him and all that was his.

Matthew 18:26, “The servant therefore fell down before him, saying, ‘Master, have patience with me, and I will pay you all.’ 27 Then the master of that servant was moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt”. This man had good intentions but no ability even if he was given a life time to repay. The same today, people are trying hard to pay their debt by trying to be good hoping they can be good enough to erase the debt. I think people try to pay it because they have not been told the cost of paying it back. In this man’s condition of hopelessness, the master did three things that took care of the matter, 1. he had compassion on him 2. he released him 3. he forgave him of his debts.

To understand the magnitude of the debt of sin we’ve been forgiven, we have to look at the cross where the Son of God suffered and died. DL Moody said, “To create God only had to speak, to REDEEM, Christ had to SUFFER”, that is what it took to make things right, Christ payment through His suffering and death. Isaiah 53:5, “But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was upon him, and by his wounds we are healed (NIV), Hebrews 9:22, “In fact, the law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.(NIV).

With this I now have a great understanding of what it means to pray, “Forgive us our debts…” (Vertical) and it prepares me for “…As we forgive our debtors (Horizontal). Will tackle this piece tomorrow

Thanks

Ev

title.rendered: Give Us This Day Our Daily Bread, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:11 “Give us this day our daily bread”

After looking at the first angle of the top verse meaning God’s word should be our priority desire, we can move to pray the second prayer within the same line “Give us this day our daily bread” in reference to our needs. I don’t see how we can effectively pray for “our daily” needs without being in the word when the request for your daily needs are filtered through the word. The bible says, “We don’t get because we don’t ask and if we also ask we ask a miss…” paraphrased.

There are two key words in this line that will definitely change how we approach God with needs. We have “US” and “OUR”. In as much as we desire our needs met by God, we need to understand that there is someone somewhere in need of the same things too and we are allowed to be in some situations that we might remember to lift up someone else’ needs too. This is what I would call corporate blessings while interceding for others. It’s easy not to pray for someone else in a situation when you are not in it too. Happens to me a lot.

On this verse alone, we understand that it’s God first, other’s second, me third. Loving God first and loving my neighbors as much as I love myself. That my blessings can never be complete until my brother and or my sister has received their portion and so I pray for them that they too may also receive. I have heard people say that they have nothing to offer, well prayer can be offered on someone’s behalf. I used to offer prayers about what affected me and mentioned my family in prayers and that was it but I later realized that someone’s marriage was on the rocks and needed prayers, someone was sick, someone’s family was going through tough times, some of my colleagues at work were going through tough times, my surrounding were filled by unsaved who needed prayers that God would save them. The more I prayed for other people’s needs, the more I was blessed myself. There are certain things I received not because I prayed for them but because I lifted up someone’s needs, this is in relation to the topic we did before, “the power of borrowing vessels”. Take care of God’s business and He will take care of yours,

Job 42:10, “And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before”. Imagine what Job went through and nothing happens until towards the end when he prayed for his friends. God would not hear his friends prayers because He was angry with them but when Job prayed for them, God heard his prayers. The bible says, “God is angry with the wicked daily” (paraphrased), how will He hear their prayers if He is angry with them? He will hear the prayers of the ones who He has saved on their behalf. Abraham interceded for Sodom because Lot was there, Moses interceded for his sister Miriam when she had leprosy.

God gives you what you “need” not “want”. Hebrews 10:35&36″ Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompense of reward. For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise”, Philippians 4:19, “But my God shall supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

When you find yourself in a situation where you are praying for God’s intervention, count it a privilege to be in a position to pray for someone else who may be in the same situation. And the same intensity you have to pray for your need, would be the same intensity to pray for someone else. Who knows whether the Lord allowed you to be in that situation for the sake of someone else. That He will not hear their prayer directly because they are not right with Him. That where you are may not be necessarily about you though you feel the pinch. Remember God first, other’s second, me third.

Thanks

title.rendered: Give Us This Day Our Daily Bread, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:11 “Give us this day our daily bread”

Recently I took a line in the Lord’s prayer and expounded on it and today I would like to take another piece in the Lord’s prayer and shed some light. When we pray “Give us this day our daily bread”, immediately all or some think of our daily necessities such as food. Let’s look at it from two different angles, I will share one angle today and then another tomorrow.

I believe the first thing the bible addresses in reference to “our daily bread” is God’s word, Matthew 4:4 “But He answered and said, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread (physical) alone, but by every word (spiritual bread) that proceeds from the mouth of God”. There is nothing wrong about praying for our daily needs, the question is, what comes first? Jesus also said according to John 6:57-58, “As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who feeds on Me will live because of Me. 58 This is the bread which came down from heaven-not as your fathers ate the manna, and are dead. He who eats this bread will live forever.” His word is Him John 1, and His word is about Him. Hebrews 10:7, “Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come-In the volume of the book it is written of Me-To do Your will, O God.’

To desire Him more than anything else is to desire His word. 1 Peter 2:2, “As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby”. Job tells us, “I have not departed from the commandment of His lips; I have treasured the words of His mouth More than my necessary food, Job 23:12, 2 Timothy 2:15, “Be diligent to present yourself approved to God, a worker who does not need to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth”. His word gives us a correct understanding of who He is and teaches us how to relate to Him. Without the word, how would I know Him and love Him.

What we pray for first determines what we desire the most and upon looking at “Give us this day our daily bread” one time, it reversed everything I ever understood about this verse and began to pray a different prayer to God to give me His word as my daily bread. To treasure His word, to study it, to desire it, to have an appetite for His word. And I have come to cherish even more His word and refuse to go a day without reading it even if it’s for a short time. I cherish His word that I listen to teachings and preaching of His word every day because His word is precious to me. Just as I need natural food for sustenance, I need spiritual food for spiritual sustenance.

The desire of the word comes from Him and we have to pray to Him to give us the desire (an appetite) for His word daily. To read it with understanding and the Holy Spirit to help us apply it to our lives. I not only want to thank God for the food, I want to thank Him for the appetite and the taste of it.

What is God’s word to you? What would you pray for first? Do you read it daily or wait until you are in church to read it? Are you daily feeding on His word through reading it, listening to SOUND teachings and preaching of His TRUE word or do you wait for Sunday morning service? My prayer for myself and I hope is yours is ” to treasure the words of His mouth More than my necessary food, Job 23:12 the reason I pray “Give me this day my (our) daily bread” first.

Thanks

Ev

title.rendered: Do You Have Spiritual Blackout? By Phil, the evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

It happened one time, about 5 pm for me, with no warning, and no solution when the blackout came. At first I thought it was just where I was, but then I looked outside and realized that the block where I worked in White Plains had black out too. I then learned that a huge part of NY was out of power. Then news came to me that the blackout had further reaching implications than I had thought. What would be doing at a time or thinking, and how would you be affected? Maybe the Word of God can shed some “light” on things in our lives and serve as an intense implication. John 8:12, “Then Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”

I am the light of the world: Jesus had an identity, He surely knew who He was and His purpose. He was the light for the entire world. He came into the world to shine upon the darkness of it. And what is darkness, but simply the absence of light. And Christ was not going to be light for a small community, or just for Israel, but for the WHOLE WORLD. Jesus came in more important than the sun, because the spiritual darkness of this world needed a great light. The “candles” of judges, prophets, and patriarchs throughout history were not complete in that the “wicks” of their times were light for a time, but would go out with the death of the prophets. BUT NOT WITH JESUS! He was a light that would shine for the whole world to experience, because it was the whole world that needed Him, even unbeknown to themselves. So why is not the light of Christ shinning throughout the hearts and lives of ALL in the world?

Whoever follows me will NOT walk in darkness: The key is in the following Christ. Are you a fan or a follower is a message I heard once by a preacher Pat Mesiti. A fan is someone who when the Yankees, or their team are winning stay with, and support the team as long as they are winning. But the followers are the ones that stay with their team, win or lose, good and bad times. A follower follows no matter what happens. They will paint their car, or their body with the symbols of their favorite team. There are some who are only fans of Christ: whenever; things don’t go their way, they jump off the ship. Then there are the followers, no matter what happens they will stick it out. Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego were followers. When the king said to bow to the idol, they refused, saying God can save them, but even if He does not they still would not bow. WOW, now that’s a follower. Daniel would not allow a lion’s den to keep him from his prayer time. That’s a follower. And Job refused to curse God in his tough times, but rather stay committed no matter what. That’s a follower.

The rich young ruler when invited to follow Christ, chose his riches, his idols, instead of following Christ. He stayed in darkness. Is it all contingent upon following Christ? Yes! Jesus said in Rev. 3:20, “Behold I stand at the door and knock, anyone who hears my voice and opens the door, I will come into him, and sup (eat) with him and he with me.” Whoever opens the door of the light, let’s the light in, and will not be in darkness, but in the light of the Lord.

What keeps us from being a follower? Sin! “The soul that sins it shall die!” A.N. Martin said, “The moment God’s Law ceases to be the most powerful factor in influencing the moral sensitivity of any individual or nation, there will be indifference to Divine wrath, and when indifference comes in it always brings in its train indifference to salvation.”

Are you in a spiritual blackout? By Phil, the evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Thessalonians 5:16, “Rejoice always, 17 pray without ceasing, 18 in everything give thanks; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you”

In looking at the few verses in 1Thess 5, I realize that many times we look at verse 18 in reference to the will of God. That it’s God’s will that we give Him thanks in everything. Note that the bible does not say to give Him thanks “FOR”. It’s while we are IN it that we give thanks. Now look at vs. 16 and 17 how they are punctuated and see that there is more to it. The bible says, “Rejoice always, 17 pray without ceasing, 18 in everything give thanks”. If you ever struggle to know what the will of God is for your life, think on these three because I believe they are the foundation of knowing God’s will and should not miss in a believer’s life, 1. Rejoice always 2. Pray without ceasing 3. In everything give thanks. You can never miss His will if you remember these three. Not only do these three help us understand the foundation of the will of God in our lives, it drives the devil nuts.

If the enemy’s work is to kill, steal and destroy (John 10:10), how can he break someone who is constantly rejoicing in all things, praying without giving up and in everything always giving thanks? The devil wants you to reject God when things are not going right, he wants you to be depressed and moody, he wants you to complain and be grumpy but those who know their God will not fall for his tricks. They will remember that God is in control always and will let them deal with more than they can handle. Paul says 2Timothy 12 “For this reason I also suffer these things; nevertheless I am not ashamed, for I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day”

I can rejoice because I know in who I believe in, I can pray without ceasing because I know He is more than able, In everything I can give thanks because I am in a position to learn, grow, be stronger knowing there is a reason why He has allowed me to be in a situation. This morning as I was getting ready to come to work, while checking car oil, my car electronically locked the doors with my ONLY set of car keys in it. Oh how I should have been upset and frustrated on a cold morning trying to figure out what I would do. Anyway, I calmed myself down, rejoiced in it however hard it was, prayed for wisdom and gave thanks. The enemy would have loved to see my flip but he did not see it happen. Anyway, with God’s wisdom, as I was trying different things to see if I could open it, believe it or not, by God’s grace I was able to open it in 15 mins (last time even the police could not open it up). What a miracle from the Lord when I needed it most. I came to work rejoicing even more. Praises be to God. In all things, remember the foundation of God’s will for every believer.

Thanks

title.rendered: Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness,

content.rendered:
Good morning,

May you enjoy reading Psalm 107 as you celebrate thanksgiving. The Lord has been good to us all and we have every reason to give Him thanks. Psalm 107 Thanksgiving to the LORD for His Great Works of Deliverance 1 Oh, give thanks to the LORD, for He is good! For His mercy endures forever. 2 Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, Whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy, 3 And gathered out of the lands, From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south.

4 They wandered in the wilderness in a desolate way; They found no city to dwell in. 5 Hungry and thirsty, Their soul fainted in them. 6 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He delivered them out of their distresses. 7 And He led them forth by the right way, That they might go to a city for a dwelling place. 8 Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men! 9 For He satisfies the longing soul, And fills the hungry soul with goodness.

10 Those who sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, Bound in affliction and irons- 11 Because they rebelled against the words of God, And despised the counsel of the Most High, 12 Therefore He brought down their heart with labor; They fell down, and there was none to help. 13 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses. 14 He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And broke their chains in pieces. 15 Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men! 16 For He has broken the gates of bronze, And cut the bars of iron in two.

17 Fools, because of their transgression, And because of their iniquities, were afflicted. 18 Their soul abhorred all manner of food, And they drew near to the gates of death. 19 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses. 20 He sent His word and healed them, And delivered them from their destructions. 21 Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men! 22 Let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And declare His works with rejoicing.

23 Those who go down to the sea in ships, Who do business on great waters, 24 They see the works of the LORD, And His wonders in the deep. 25 For He commands and raises the stormy wind, Which lifts up the waves of the sea. 26 They mount up to the heavens, They go down again to the depths; Their soul melts because of trouble. 27 They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, And are at their wits’ end. 28 Then they cry out to the LORD in their trouble, And He brings them out of their distresses. 29 He calms the storm, So that its waves are still. 30 Then they are glad because they are quiet; So He guides them to their desired haven. 31 Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men! 32 Let them exalt Him also in the assembly of the people, And praise Him in the company of the elders.

33 He turns rivers into a wilderness, And the watersprings into dry ground; 34 A fruitful land into barrenness, For the wickedness of those who dwell in it. 35 He turns a wilderness into pools of water, And dry land into watersprings. 36 There He makes the hungry dwell, That they may establish a city for a dwelling place, 37 And sow fields and plant vineyards, That they may yield a fruitful harvest. 38 He also blesses them, and they multiply greatly; And He does not let their cattle decrease.

39 When they are diminished and brought low Through oppression, affliction, and sorrow, 40 He pours contempt on princes, And causes them to wander in the wilderness where there is no way; 41 Yet He sets the poor on high, far from affliction, And makes their families like a flock. 42 The righteous see it and rejoice, And all iniquity stops its mouth.

43 Whoever is wise will observe these things, And they will understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Timothy 4:2, Preach the word! Be ready in season and out of season. Convince, rebuke, exhort, with all longsuffering and teaching.

I think that Paul invested more in his spiritual son Timothy than anyone else. Paul reached many churches through his preaching and his writings but when it came to Timothy, he had special place for him. He took time to invest truth, what to do, what to watch out for etc as he journeyed with the Lord. In 2Tim 4, it sounds like Paul’s journey on earth was almost coming to an end, and he takes time to impart in Timothy to what I would call the last words. People are intrigued by other people’s last words before they pass into the eternity. There is something about the last words. I’ve read last words of some famous people and they left me thinking.

If I was to sum up Paul’s last words to Timothy I would say he told him to “Preach the word in season and out of season”, in other words, preach Christ as He is at all times without addition or subtraction from the word. He knew Timothy would face trying times that had the ability to push him to dilute the word or manipulate it for the sake of people. Paul encouraged him to “preach the word” whether it would make him popular or not. His duty was to please the Lord and not people. Paul Washer says, “We should have seeker friendly churches” but that is “church seeking for God”. Our times people equate success with whether something works. If you are successful in it, can draw crowd, is eloquent etc it’s ok, if that is the case as Paris Reidhead would say, then men like Jeremiah and Jonah would be considered failures. Jeremiah preached many years and I don’t recall him having any converts, Jonah preached, had only his family as converts. In the eyes of many, they may have failed but not God, He was pleased because they preached His word.

I am very concerned as to what many preachers teach on today. Many years ago I went to a church where they practiced drinking anointing oil. I was still new in Christ and too naive to figure out it wasn’t scriptural. Thereafter in still learning I was listening to men’s teachings that sounded very scriptural until some men of God pointed me to the word to see the truth. Not long after, I began to test the spirits, listen carefully to some teachings and not too quick to receive any word just because it was preached or taught in Jesus name. That is why we need to discern, not every one who uses the name of the Lord is of the Lord. I am now very careful not to listen to every kind of preacher just because they may be preacher celebrity and can pull great crowds. All I want to know, are they preaching the word as it is. 1 Thessalonians 5:21, “Test all things; hold fast what is good”

2Timothy 4:3, “For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine, but according to their own desires, because they have itching ears, they will heap up for themselves teachers;” We live in those times, where people don’t want to hear sound doctrines (teachings). They go about looking for preachers who will preach what they want to hear. They run from one conference to another, move from one church to another, can receive all preaching about life enhancement and is closed to any preaching on sin, law, righteousness, holiness, judgment, self denial, faithful endurance and hell. I believe that there should be a balance including preaching on prosperity, healing, deliverance, callings, reaching the lost. With my constant meeting with the unsaved, I understand why people do not care for the sound doctrine. Infact the line I hear a lot is, “I am comfortable with my own sets of beliefs”. People throw out what is good (the truth) because it does not make them comfortable, they would rather live a lie than be exposed. If you are comfortable in your own sets of beliefs, you will either try to find someone who can support what you believe or get grounded in what you believe. It begins with salvation and the late Keith Green puts it beautifully, “It’s better for someone to be afraid that they are NOT saved and TRULY be saved, than someone to THINK they are saved and they AREN’T. it’s better to have a salvation you are doubting than to have NO salvation that you are SURE of. See Paul is saying that it will be according to their own desires and having people who can preach what they purpose to hear. I will not be surprised if in some churches the preacher will only preach on what the people who give more money hint to them what they should preach on.

The time is now that we need to be careful of what we hear, what we take in, what we apply. We don’t want to live in error, we don’t want to go by false prophesies, we don’t want to be deceived and we don’t want to live a lie. Paul said, “Preach the word”, not to others only but to yourself. I would rather have the total package that deals with everything from the word of God whether it be easy or hard TO RECEIVE. If there be something not right in my life, I want to preach to myself, be convicted of it and change. Paul gave Tim the total package 2Tim 4:2, “Convince, rebuke, exhort, with all longsuffering and teaching (doctrine)”. Blessings Ev, His servant

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 15:7, “If you abide in Me and My words abide in you, you shall ask what you will and it shall be given unto you”

At the opening of the session, the Court Usher shall say aloud: “Silence. All rise please. The Superior Court is now in session, the Honorable Judge, presiding”. As soon as the Judge is seated, the Court Usher invites those present to be seated. Right before the Judge steps in, everything is out of place, there is noise, people scattered but the moment the Judge comes and sits, the house is in order and peaceful as the court is in session. Anything that disturbs the decorum and good order of the Court is prohibited. On one side we have the prosecutors and their lawyers and one side we have the defendants with their lawyers. All heads are turned towards the judge for He is the boss. Everything in that court is under his jurisdiction. I would like to talk to us a little bit about our Judge the King of kings and how we fall in His court session.

Our powerful tool we use to defend ourselves with and use to plead for mercy when we fail is prayer. A couple of years ago when I was being raised to be a prayer warrior, God taught me about what prayer is all about and how I can defend, act and plead in His courts of law. When we go to pray, we are calling the Judge to have a session with us and the first thing we do is usher Him in just like the court usher does with our earthly judges. Ushering Him brings everything to order, Isaiah 40:22, “It is He who sits above the circle of the earth”. No one can sit until the judge sits. No hearing of any cases until He sits. When God sits, the court is in session, there is order for He is a God of order. That is why I don’t just run in the courts of God and present my case immediately, I take the time to usher Him with praise and worship and when He is sited, then my case comes in. But this is not my message today, it’s helping tailor what I will say.

If you are going to defend yourself, act or plead you have to know the law, you have to know what, when and how to speak the law. I must admit that I am one of those people who don’t just run and say, “whatever your will is let it be” I want to know what it is. Like when you have fallen short, the judge tends to ask you what you have to say after hearing your sentence. Many plead for mercy, grace, pardon. I saw Hezekiah, Moses, Abraham plead with God when His will was about to prevail cause you never know how what was about to happen could be turned and made something better. Grace and Mercy are always present to fight for us, not because we are innocent but because they see far beyond the failure. That if the judge hangs on that culprit for a little while, He can make Him what He wants Him to be regardless of the His current situation.

I realize the people who tend to leave it at, “whatever you say” do not know the word of God and how it is applicable to them. The bible says in John 1:1, “In the beginning was the Word and the Word was with God and the Word was God” therefore, I who is coming to Him according to His word, I am agreeing with Him about what He says about His Word. If I know the Word, I know who He is and what He stands for. If I am going to pray, I am going to have to pray His Word, why? John 1:4, “In Him was life, and the life was the light of men”. He who has light is sure of where they are going but he who does not have light, tries different things hoping to find the way. Psalm 119:105, “Thy Word is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my path”. A person who has the Word, walks confidently because the light shines on his path while a person who has no light tries to walk cautiously at times hitting their foot on things. This is the part of John 15:7, “If you abide in Me…”, abiding in the light.

With that in mind, let’s look at another scripture that completes the whole process, John 1:14, “And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth”. The word which was invisible became visible through the flesh. I believe that the Word is never complete until the intangible becomes tangible; the invisible becomes visible; the impossible becomes possible; the ineffective becomes effective; until the disappointments turn into appointments; until chaos are turned into order. This is what the Word does, it does the opposite of what is already present. How cool that is. This is why when I pray, I pray the word into the now ness of my situation that whatever had been there can be reversed because of the power of God’s word applied correctly. Hebrews 4:12, “The Word of the Lord is living and powerful…” You may only see it in black ink on paper but let it be known to you it’s living. The reason you may not see it living is because before your eyes it’s invisible but when you begin to bring it into action, you begin to see the life in it and how it has the power to affect everything that you apply the Word to. John 15:7, “…and My words abide in you”, His words give life to every part of our being and situations that are paralyzed or dead. The Judge hears all cases and often times you will hear them quote certain sections of the law that the judge himself knows, I quote a lot of scriptures when I pray by saying, “according to your word…”.

In my prayer, this is important to quote scriptures, they boost my faith. I gain courage in His presence and I am confident not in myself but in His Word. It’s one thing to abide to which many do but it another thing to allow God’s words to abide in you to which many miss. Look at the last part of John 15:7, “…you shall ask what you will and it shall be given unto you” Who can bring that apart from the residing judge. Usher Him in, Know the word, pray the Word. Blessings Evans

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 21: 14-19, “…Then she departed and wandered in the Wilderness of Beersheba”

I would like to take a few moments to minister to the single mothers. Parenting becomes manageable when two parents are present to raise their child or children. Each parent has a responsibility in the life of the child or the children they have. There are things the Father will teach better than the mother and there are things the mother will do a better job than the father. So together they team up to bring the child in the fear and the knowledge of God. It becomes a greater challenge when the mother has to play the role of the father and the mother in the life of the child or the children. Without the male figure in the home, how would they instill some of the Father like values?

Hagar, Sarah’s maidservant cast out by Sarah. She is forced to leave a home she has always known. She had a job that paid her dues. She had a man in her life, Abraham who she looked up to as her lord and master. She had all the protection she needed not forgetting the presence of people to comfort her. Trouble continues when after having giving birth to a son, 14 years later, Isaac the promised son is born. She is cast out with her son because they were considered a threat, given little bread and water and left to wander in the wilderness with her teenager. Life is cruel right? someone wrote a book entitled, “Life is not fair but God is good”. What life presents to you does not change the goodness of God. His goodness does not depend on what you and I are facing everyday. It may be tough and you may be thrown out like Hagar but He is still good. And some of you single mothers have come from having enough to barely making it. You are in some type of wilderness with no support, with less people to encourage you. You have a child or children to raise and cannot provide for them their needs, time, values like you would want to. You try your best and then there comes those times you throw your hands up and tears run down your cheek. I have a message for you, God knows where you are and where you are going.

Genesis 21:15, “And the water in the skin was used up, and she placed the boy under one of the shrubs”. 16 “Then she went and sat down across from him at a distance of about a bowshot; for she said to herself, “Let me not see the death of the boy.” So she sat opposite him, and lifted her voice and wept.” Paul did everything he could do for the churches he wrote to. He had taught them, prayed for them, preached to them, guided them and after he had done all, he commended them to God. To commend is to commit to the care of another. What do you do when all you have done is all you could do?, commend it to God. God gives you the ability to do your part then He intervenes to do His. Hagar had provided for her son, cared for him, protected him, was there for him. The new situation is so rough that she can’t stand to see her son in this condition. I know some of you mothers have done the same for your children. It has reached a time you have to release them but it’s hard. Instead of worrying what might happen to them when they are in school, play ground or any other place, commend them to God. Lay hands on them and pray for them. Praying for them is commending them to God. Commend your tough time to the Lord, Commend your less than enough to the Lord. Remember that God knows where you are and where you are going. Before you even got to the situation, He already provided away out. Commend everything to Him.

Thanks
Ev

title.rendered: Have Faith In God, This Is A New Day, by Boaz Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

It is the day that the Lord has made for you, that you may rejoice in it and be glad. You may not feel like rejoicing because of something which is bothering you. You may be very tired or discouraged about something. The environment you are in may not be very pleasing and the people around you may not seem to be concerned or care. At times, you may be feeling lonely and emotionally drained. The thought of going through the week feeling this way may be wearing you down so much you get scared. The devil may be whispering in your ears “You can’t make it”. Your mind may be very clogged with a lot of fearful thoughts and doubts. It may feel like a blocked sewage. You want things to flow, but nothing seems to be flowing the way you would wish. And so, you get frustrated and discouraged. Life doesn’t seem to be very exciting. So, what do you do?

Have faith in God! Faith in God is the answer for all your questions and needs today and will be, always and forever. If you have faith, you have everything you need.

First, you need faith to please God. That should be your greatest need and concern. Without faith, it is impossible to please God ( Hebrews 11:6). If your life pleases God, then you have the confidence and assurance that He is with you at all times and that He delights in giving you the desires of your heart ( Psalms 37:4).

Second, you need faith for living victorious life. The Bible says “the just shall live by faith ( Romans 1: 17). You don’t have life without faith. Faith is the essence of a Christian’s life. Where there is no faith there is fear. And where there is fear, there are failures and fatality. One sure way to overcome with fear and failure is to have faith in God and self. Only your faith will save you. Your faith alone, will move the mountains that stand before you. Faith can change your life positively if correctly applied in time.

Third, you need faith to share with others. You can’t give what you don’t have. In Acts chapter 3, Peter and John met a man who was in need of money. They didn’t have money to give away, but they had something. They had faith, they said to the man “silver and gold we don’t have, but such as we have we give you. In the name of Jesus Christ, rise up and walk”. Immediately, the man got up and walked. That is what faith in Jesus name can do for others and for yourself if you exercise it. You don’t have to be special or extraordinary in anyway. You just need to believe that you have faith and use it. Faith is spend able. If we deposit faith daily in our “Faith Deposit Account”, we will be able to draw faith every time for overcoming and having every need of ours met. Above all, we will please God by our life style of faith. Let everything you do, be done by faith. Faith that looks up to Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith. You have nothing to loose if you live by faith, but you stand to loose everything if you live by fear, the chief enemy of faith.

I urge you today to get hold of God’s word and read it and deposit in your spirit and mind. Meditate on the word day and night and your faith will grow. There is no other way of growing your faith but through the word. Faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God. The word of God will not leap into your spirit from the Bible if you don’t open it and spend time with it in the presence of God. One reason you may be feeling overwhelmed, confused, undecided, depressed, discouraged and defeated in some areas of your life, is lack of knowledge of God’s word or correct application of it. Read God’s word and you will have faith.

by Boaz Olang

title.rendered: Your Kingdom Come, Your Will Be Done

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:9-15, vs. 10, “…your kingdom come, your will be done on earth as it is in heaven” Jesus said we pray in this manner, “…your kingdom come…” and I used to wonder what does that mean? And again we are told about it in Matthew 6:33, “But seek ye first the Kingdom of God and His righteousness”, again, what does this mean? A passage that helped me understand this is found in Romans 14:17, “For the Kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost”. You can automatically see the things ruled out about seeking God’s kingdom. It’s not about happiness when it talks about meat and drink. It’s something far bigger and greater than what the world could ever offer.

You kingdom come is desiring a good thing and that is the presence of the Almighty to come, power, dominion, righteousness, peace of God and joy from the Kingdom. The world cannot make us righteous, God can. 2 Corinthians 5:21, “For He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might become the righteousness of God in Him”. The world cannot give joy, God can. He gives unspeakable joy, un describable joy. Nehemiah 8:10, says “…for the joy of the LORD is your strength.” He gives peace that passes all understanding in all things (good and bad) Philippians 4:7, His grace is sufficient, 2Corinthians 12:9. The increase of our faith flows from the kingdom Luke 17:5. To bear the fruit of the Spirit of love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness”, Galatians 5:22 all from praying your kingdom come. Why is this so important? Because these are the qualities that make us be like Christ. Yes the Lord knows our other needs but the kingdom needs are prime in our lives. These are the things that distinguishes us from the world. The world is ignorant of the righteousness of God, the world has peace and joy when all is working out fine. The world is craving for happiness, we are craving for righteousness. And the other reason I believe we pray “your kingdom come” is to prepare us to pray “your will be done on earth as it is in heaven” I find it nearly impossible to pray, “your will be done on earth as it is in heaven” when I have not prayed “your kingdom come”, when I have prayed to walk in the path of righteousness whatever the cost, and I have prayed for joy in the midst of it all, and prayed for Grace to make me comfortable in every situation and God’s peace that no one can give, and more faith to trust even when I can’t see, oh how it’s is beautiful to pray “YOUR will be done”. That the Lord prepares us for what He is to do. That we ask Him to execute it here on earth. His will in heaven could be interpreted as a plan, blue print and that plan is brought here on earth that it may be built. It’s giving God permission act on His will. Knowing that anything done by God is perfect, nothing can be added to it and nothing can be taken away from. He knows our destiny as He had planned it way before were born. For our lives to change daily, may we pray,, “…your kingdom come, your will be done on earth as it is in heaven” , the desires of our hearts are filtered through them
Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 15: 7 “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it shall be done for you. 8 By this My Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples”

I am a firm believer of being in the Father’s business. This is where I cease to live for myself, meaning living a Christian life and knowing I have passed from death to life and that’s it. I want to live a life that is pleasing to the Lord by dying daily (crucifying the flesh) and be challenged to do things my flesh does not crave at all but are good for my growth. I die to self so as to be alive in Christ. Galatians 2:20, “I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me. I want to know His will for my life and there are two things that are definitely God’s will for every believer and that is Prayer (intercession) and Evangelism. Yet these two are the ones easily put aside from my experience.

This is my personal conviction, you cannot grow MUCH in the Lord without Prayers and Evangelism. I believe these two are the wings that stabilizes our Christian walk. Wings provide a balance. They work together, hand in hand. Prayers shows your total dependency on God, Evangelism is your response to His last command. Prayer changes and conforms you into what God wants you to be and so is gospel. If you are praying and not evangelizing, you are a Christian with one wing and so is evangelizing and not praying. One cannot work effectively without the other. I pray that I may evangelize and I evangelize that I may pray. A good analogy to make this point clear, God requires us to push rocks (pray and witness to the unsaved) but He doesn’t expect us to move the rocks (save them). In the process of us being obedient to push the rocks (pray for them and share with them), He steps in to move the rocks (save them) and the glory goes back to Him for the gospel of Christ is the POWER of God to SALVATION, Romans 1:16. In the Great Commission (as it is frequently labeled; Matt. 28:19), Jesus commanded His disciples to “Go… and make disciples.” The objective was not that they attract their own disciples, but that they win new followers of Jesus. Acts tells the story of how the Spirit-filled apostles obeyed that command. If we were to pray the Father’s will and if we were to lay our heads on the Father’s breast so to speak, I believe we would feel His heart for the lost according to Matthew 18:14, which says, “Even so it is not the WILL of your Father who is in heaven that ONE of these little ones should PERISH”. We may not be too concerned but He is and the moment we get a glimpse, a taste of what He requires of us, we will make His last call our priority. How can we make a last call our priority unless we have prayed the will of the Father to be our burden. We put legs to our prayers and respond to the call as our own God answered prayer.

John 15: 7, “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it shall be done for you” this may appear as a blank check but look again at how the verse begins, “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you..” the more we abide, the more we learn and experience what the Lord requires of us. How will He get more glory if we do not go about His business of sharing with the lost?, The bible continues to say, 8 By this My Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples”. A disciple is a follower of Christ and what did Christ do with His disciples? He made them fishers of men. This is the “prime product”, the blessings of other things are the “by products” of being obedient. Read the book of Acts and see how they grew much while doing the Lord’s work, Acts 6:4, ” but we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the word.” Not that other ministries were less important, these two helped them grow much.

And there are no two things that have caused me to grow much like these two. When you share, you are preaching the gospel to others and yourself. The gospel never gets old and it’s not just for the unsaved, the gospel is for us everyday till the day the Lord comes. We have not prayed enough and never will but we have to if we want to grow.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 15:1-8, vs. 2, “…and every branch that bears fruit He PRUNES, that it may bear MORE fruit”

Yesterday I shared on what it takes to bear fruit, today I would like to share on what it takes to bear MORE fruit.

I cannot think of anything that causes more and faster growth like adversities. In the light of things going backwards or getting less or dying or eliminated has potential of causing greater growth in ways we could never imagine or fathom. You would think that in cutting back should create less opportunity for growth until you understand why a plant needs pruning (cutting back).

Jesus defines Himself as the true Vine in vs. 1 and God the Father as the vine dresser (Gardner) and the believers are the branches. Those who abide in Christ, the true vine are inspected by the Father (the vine dresser) and 2 Every branch in Me (Christ) that does not bear fruit He takes away;”. God the gardener is not looking for branches, He is looking for fruit. You may be trying to please the Lord with your braches and how green they are, how big and healthy they are. The Lord is not impressed with branches, He is looking for fruit, a sign of growth in your life. There are many who call themselves Christians who have more leaves than fruits and they are excited that they have leaves but again, it’s not the leaves that the Lord inspects, it’s the fruit. So the branch on the vine that does not bear fruit, He takes it way.

2, “…and every branch that bears fruit He PRUNES, that it may bear MORE fruit”. Here is where many Christians are, they are excited that they have fruit, little fruit and that’s it. Why desire more when you have something to cling to? Then here comes the Lord who takes the branch that bears fruit and prunes it. What is pruning? Pruning is the practice of removing diseased, non-productive, or otherwise unwanted portions from a plant. The purpose of pruning is to shape the plant by controlling or directing plant growth, to maintain the health of the plant and increase the yield or quality of fruits. Pruning requires cutting back, cleaning, removing dead leaves for a reason. You may be facing some setbacks right now in your own life and you may be wondering why go through all these when you are bearing fruit as a believer. You may never know if the Lord has set your life for pruning so as to move you from bearing fruit to bearing MORE fruit. Maybe the Lord wants to grow more faith in you, more patience, more love, more joy, more peace, more grace, more prayer in your life, more reading of His word, more reaching the lost and so cutting back propels you to grow more and more under what you will call adversities. That there have been things hindering you from growing some more therefore, he cuts them back. The key word is MORE.

Cutting back does not mean destruction, it means the branch through the vine has potentials to grow more if pruned. How can we abide on the true vine and remain the same? Now Proper pruning is as much a skill as it is an art, since badly pruned plants can become diseased or grow in undesirable ways but the Lord is the Master in pruning. He knows how best to prune each of us so as to bear more fruit. He knows what kind of pruning and how much of it He has to do to make a difference in our lives. Setbacks are temporary results brought about by pruning, the end result is more growth that brings about more fruit bearing that is desperately needed in your life. David says, Psalm 119:71, “It is good for me that I have been afflicted (pruned), That I may learn (grow) Your statutes”. Pruning can either make you or break you, we make the choice. Tough times don’t last, tough people do. Blessings Ev

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Peter 1:1-8, “For if these things are yours and abound, you will be neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ”

You are just about to make a delicious meal for your family or guests, you want everything to be perfect, smooth and good. You desire to make something delicious but don’t know how. First step, get the recipe book. As you go through the recipe book, you will arrive at something that catches your eyes and your reaction is, “this is it”. Reading through the recipe book, you see the ingredients required. Without ingredients, the method will not help you at all and gathering ingredients without doing anything with them will not help you either. You gather, you mix as the recipe book puts it and add every ingredient as indicated.

In the book of Peter we are given ingredients to help us in our spiritual growth 2Peter 2:3, “as His divine power has given to us all things pertaining to life and godliness,..”, already we can see that God has bestowed upon each of us the ingredients for our growth (recipe). This has come to us through promises that we may be partakers of divine nature. Why is it that different lives turn out worse than others when we have been given the same ingredients? simple, if you do not follow instructions as to how to utilize the ingredients, you will end up with something else. One can do away with one, two or three ingredients and say, “I don’t need them” or put less or more of one thing and with that you loose what the recipe book had in mind to produce.

Here are things we are advised to do in vs. 5, “But also for this very reason, giving all diligence” meaning be persistent, stead fast unmovable in the things of God. “Add to your faith virtue”, virtue is moral excellence, in other words, in your foundation in Christ, add virtue for people to see what you stand for. I believe people see the faith in you more when virtue is present (the outworking of the internal). “To virtue knowledge”, Proverbs 1:7, “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge” which is understanding through experience or training. Knowledge can lead to truth if channeled in the right direction. vs. 6, “To knowledge self-control”, Self-control is denying yourself things that bring destruction and distraction that you may maintain what you have received. When you have knowledge, it will show you which areas you need to employ self-control. “To self-control perseverance (patience)”, tough one but vital. You may love a cheerful giver, I love a faithful enduerer. “To perseverance (patience) godliness”, endurance produces godliness in you for it reminds you and I that if God can be patient with sinners like us, how much more should we be with people and situations. Patience is one of the greatest killers of all, but it is an ingredient in this recipe for growth. Just know where it comes in and you will minimize or kill frustrations. vs. 7 “To godliness brotherly kindness”, kindness is the quality of being warm hearted and considerate, sympathetic and forgiving. Ephesians 4:32, “Be kind to one another, tender hearted forgiving each other even as Christ as forgiven you” (paraphrased). “To kindness love”, without kindness, love will not blossom for kindness prepares the heart to love. Kindness is what opens the door to see far beyond someone’s faults and love them any way. It’s the crown and the heart beat of this recipe. Looking at this recipe, you can see how it’s set up systematically and flows. All the ingredients work hand in hand. They fit in well..

Without the a strong foundation where virtue, knowledge, self-control, perseverance, godliness, kindness are ingredients in your life, I believe your growth is in jeopardy and something must be done

Peter 1:8, “For if these things are yours and abound, you will be neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ”. We have what it takes to be fruitful (grow) without adding what is not on it or taking away one of the ingredients. We shouldn’t get rid of what we think is hard, there is a reason it’s there. Who wants to be barren? and who does not want to grow and bear fruit? Do something, ask the Lord help you in every area. Blessings Evans

* Have been out sick, keep me in your prayers!!

Thanks
Ev
