content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jeremiah 32:17,”Ah, Lord GOD! Behold, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and outstretched arm. There is nothing too hard for You”

In a world full of disappointments from people to situations, how often do you wonder if any thing is possible when all you can see is impossibilities?. There has to be a greater power, greater being above everyone and everything that nothing else is a march to Him. God is the Ultimate being we need. In Genesis 1 says “In the beginning God”, the life chapter begins with Him and finishes with Him in the book of revelation when it says, “…Even so come Lord Jesus”.

To trust God in everything, you have to know His Resume (cv). He does need to explain or try to convince you of what He has done and what He is cable of. Psalm 19:1, The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands (NIV). He does not need to speak to be known as God, He has enough to speak on His behalf. How you see God affects who you are and where you are going. I see in my life that there are times when situation rises up, I first look at the size of the situation and then God, instead of looking to God first then situation. As long as I look at the situation first, it’s magnitude is enough to discourage me from looking to Him because in my human mind, I don’t see how God can do it. If I do it the other way round, then God becomes bigger than the situation. That is what Jeremiah did with his situation. He first sized God then sized the situation. He begins by saying “Ah Lord God! Behold, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and outstretched arm”. God is a Mighty Warrior, Big, Powerful, Excellent, Magnificent, Omniscient, Omnipotent, Awesome, Honorable, Sovereign, Deliverer, Way maker, Auspicious, Alpha and Omega, etc and what I am dealing with cannot come even close to who the Almighty God is. Jeremiah’s introduction led him to say these words boldly, “There is NOTHING too hard for You”. Amen NOTHING ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. Have you looked at the world?, you can’t point the beginning or the end of it. God made it, does your situation even come close?

If nothing is impossible with God, why do we have impossible things then? Simple, they are impossible as long as God is not in them. Can “nothing” be impossible in our lives? I believe so and here is why NOTHING IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A PERSON WHO DOESN’T HAVE TO DO IT HIM OR HERSELF. Philippians 4:13, “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”. Paul knew nothing was impossible in his life as long as he wasn’t doing it himself. Things can only be possible in your life when you have the God of impossibilities equipping you to overcome what you called impossible. Ephesians 3:20, “Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us”. When you think it’s impossible, employ the hand of God and the impossible will become possible and watch this, God gives bonus for letting Him be God in your situation, He will do ” exceeding abundantly ABOVE all that we ask or think.

When I started the devotion ministry years back, it was impossible. I was imagining, how in the world will I come up with a word and strength to type everyday. What if I came to work and I did not have a word? Don’t people need to study books and bible to share? What if I did not have much time to study? I was never good at writing, preparing everyday message or studying God’s word for even 15 minutes was a struggle. All were impossible things until I understood; “nothing is impossible for a man who doesn’t have to do it himself”. You can see God has been faithful. God has given me messages to share sometimes even on a very short time and little time to study and put it together. I still struggle to study the word of God but God has taken my impossibilities and turned them into possibilities. It’s like God dictated and I typed, what a way to learn that nothing is impossible. I don’t know what you have sized that has discouraged you from trusting God, speak like Jeremiah, size God first then the situation, employ God and do all things through Him who strengthens you and remember, NOTHING IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A PERSON WHO DOESN’T HAVE TO DO IT HIM OR HERSELF.
Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 23:39, “One of the criminals who hung there hurled insults at him: “Aren’t you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”; 40; But the other criminal rebuked him. “Don’t you fear God; ” he said; “since you are under the same sentence? 41 We are punished justly; for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong.”; 42Then he said; “Jesus; remember me when you come into your kingdom.”; 43 Jesus answered him; “I tell you the truth; today you will be with me in paradise.” (NIV)

Often I give an evangelistic message and today I have a message for us, it’s a little bit long but necessary. It’s not safe to say that all in my team have made peace with God so let this message awake you up to your destiny if you don’t know where you are going. Luke is reporting of what he saw and experienced, there is one little episode that he reports to us when Jesus was crucified. He was close death. He being crucified in the centre, there were two guilty criminals also crucified with Him. on their death row waiting for their death. One is insulting Jesus while the other is thinking about his fate, where he will spend eternity. If you read the previous verses, you will find that both criminals were insulting Jesus but one came to his senses and began to think about his mortality. Only one life to live and not knowing where that life will lead him. All under the same sentence but One is innocent.

Luke 23:39, “One of the criminals who hung there hurled insults at him: “Aren’t you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”; We as human beings could be insulting Jesus without even knowing. When you reject the one who has given you life, has led you, has given up everything for you, you are insulting Him. You’ve heard his Name, you’ve been witnessed to but still refuse to surrender your life to Him. Just because you have not seen Him perform miracles in your life you think He is a wimp, a crutch for Christians. You even take His holy name and reduce it to a four letter filth word to express disgust simply because He is quiet. You refuse to admit your sins because you don’t think your sins are that bad compared to someone else. You don’t see it as exceeding sinful because you keep covering it up with self righteousness. You try to work your way into heaven by what you call “good works” making His dying on the cross in vain. What an insult. This is the same kind of attitude the first criminal had. I will not be surprised if he even thought that he was being punished unjustly. Too careless to think about what happens after this life. What is sin, transgression of the law (lying, stealing, lusting, fornication, adultery, coveting, dishonoring, murdering (also includes hating), taking God’s name in vain, failing to keep Sabbath holy, Him not first in your life, having other things given reverence instead of God. I was guilty of all.

40; But the other criminal rebuked him. “Don’t you fear God; ” he said; “since you are under the same sentence? 41 We are punished justly; for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong”. I love this other criminal because he has but a moment, he has thought about his life, all that he ever did, what landed him on the cross. He knows that if he dies, there is something beyond the grave he has to be ready for. He has no one to condemn or blame for being on the cross. All he does is see himself in his true state, a criminal who deserve justice and justice means crucified. He knows he is getting what he deserves, in the middle he sees a man who has no criminal records, doesn’t even make sense why He is there and not complaining for being there. He is humbled on the cross. If He is not doing it for His sake, He must have been accused wrongfully and someone is going free. Oh I remember, it was a custom to release ONE prisoner during a feast, in this case it was either Jesus the Christ or Barabbas the murderer. They let go the murderer and the innocent Man is condemned to die instead of a murderer. Philippians 2:7,”but made himself nothing, taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness. 8 And being found in appearance as a man, he humbled himself and became obedient to death– even death on a cross!”(NIV) All I can imagine is as this thief was on the cross, thinking had it between Jesus and him instead of Barabbas, they would have let him go and crucified Jesus. He now understands that Jesus is also on the cross to take his punishment.

42Then he said; “Jesus; remember me when you come into your kingdom.”; 43 Jesus answered him; “I tell you the truth; today you will be with me in paradise.” (NIV). With one life to live, no avenue for escape, condemned to die justly, hanging in the balance of eternity he cries out to Christ to remember him and Jesus promises to be together with him in paradise (eternity), James 4:6, “But He gives more grace. Therefore He says: “God resists the proud, But gives grace to the humble”. One was proud and arrogant, God resists such but this other criminal was humble and Christ gave him grace. Without the shedding of blood, there is no forgiveness of sin and without Grace, there can be no salvation. One made it to heaven while the other made it to hell based on the choices they made. You have one life to live here on earth, think about your eternal salvation, you too are on the cross for what you’ve done. You are not crucified wrongly, you are crucified for sinning, either you continue to throw insults by your life style or humble yourself and come clean, this is your day of salvation, tomorrow may never be. Saying sinner’s prayer or doing ritual stuff or going to church or paying tithe does not save you, only God does. And God only saves those who are see themselves lost in dark sin and cry out to Him to save them from their sins. A patient will never desire cure until He sees the sickness in his life killing him. You will never cry to be rescued until you see yourself drowning.

The bible says, “Examine yourself and see if you are in the faith”. Make your calling and election sure, don’t let pride and arrogance stand in your way. Repent of your sins and put on the Lord Jesus to save you from sure death, obey his words and you will pass from death to life. Blessings Ev

Thanks

Ev

title.rendered: King David Walking Through Death Valley by Phil the Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

David left Gath and escaped to the cave of Adullam. When his brothers and his father’s household heard about it, they went down to him there. All those who were in distress or in debt or discontented gathered around him, and he became their leader. About four hundred men were with him. 1 Sam 22:1-2

David was on the run from King Saul for his very life in the cave of Adullam. Here is the soon to be king, on the run, in a cave, not exactly the kind of kingdom promised to him. Caves don’t lift the spirits much, the environment is not conducive of hope. It was dark, wet, cold, stale and lonely. What did David do then, but began to become the greatest psalmist, hymnist, and comforter of broken hearts the world shall ever know. Why, because in the midst of this lowly time in “Death Valley” whereby death was calling out of Saul’s heart to David’s, David could learn about something no book could teach him. David was learning about something we all need so desperately and that is brokenness.

And then perhaps the strangest thing of all took place. Others had to flee as King Saul’s madness grew. First one came, then three, then ten, and eventually hundreds. From in a cave four hundred men gathered to David, and he became their leader. Misery loves company. Man you thought David had problems before, being a fugitive in Saul’s estimation of him, now he had his problem plus the problems of all the others in the cave with him. The four hundred men gathered to him were “All those who were in distress or in debt or discontented”. I thought that David was going to be a leader as king in the palace, and have an army and servants at his disposal, but what is this? The Message Bible says that all the “losers” gathered to David. In NYCC we are trying to reach “All those in distress, in debt, and discontented” are we not? We were all like that at one point. Why did God allow these kinds of people to gather to David? Where were the encouragers, those who would lift David’s spirits? Let me challenge your perspective. I believe this was God’s way of building David into the powerful leader, king, and the man of God he was too become.

David would be a king (leader). David obviously would have people to lead, or else he wouldn’t be called a leader without followers. Here God is allowing David to go through “boot camp” and teach him to lead the lowest of the low, in a palace called a cave. I hope you are getting this. One day David would have to lead a different group (Israel’s army) in a different place (a palace). Before we can be on the top in leadership God molds us at the bottom of the barrel. How could David have led armies if he couldn’t lead “the losers?”

It’s lonely at the top, is a saying with a lot of truth. When you are the top man, who can you send your complaints, your hurts, frustrations, fears, confusion, etc to? David could only send them to the One place he knew, to the Lord. That is why David wrote Psalm 142.

Application: Read Psalm 142, and write down what you would have thought or felt if you put yourself in David shoes (sandles).

Blessings

Phil the Evangelist

title.rendered: What Will I Do In Death Valley? By Phil the Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ezekiel 37:1 The hand of the LORD was upon me, and he brought me out by the Spirit of the LORD and set me in the middle of a valley; it was full of bones. 2 He led me back and forth among them, and I saw a great many bones on the floor of the valley, bones that were very dry. 3 He asked me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” I said, “O Sovereign LORD, you alone know.”

Ezekiel came up to The Valley of Dry Bones. Death was all around. Even the bones were dried up, which is to say that the marrow inside our bones was deceased. The marrow gives strength to our bones which make up the skeletal system of our body. Our body is held up by our bones, our support structure. What happens when the very life of your support structure is eroded, and dried up? This is when all looks hopeless, all signs of life have ceases, and it seems as if there is nothing left to do because all resources are exhausted. Here Ezekiel was staring at an impossible situation. God asks him a very probing question, when He says, “Son of man, can these bones live?” Ezekiel in his wisdom knew that his knowledge was limited, and therefore replies O Sovereign LORD, you alone know.”

In a practical way God was asking Ezekiel my people Israel are dead (they are the dead bones in your vision) do you think I can bring a dead situation to life? Do you think I can make a seemingly impossible situation possible? Can I bring forth life from death, can I bring all these people who decided to stay in “Death Valley” and died because of it, out of this valley? No wonder Ezekiel responded as such, “O Sovereign LORD, you alone know.” What was he saying? Lord You know Your power. I know I can’t do this, and I don’t see how it can happen, but there is no one on this earth that can answer this question. Imagine that, God asks you a question that you can’t answer. God asks many people many questions in His Word. It would be interesting to search the Scriptures and examine the topic “questions God has asked ordinary people”. But, here God asks Ezekiel the question that no one but God alone could answer. And perhaps he was seeing if Ezekiel would run to a human answer. When problems in this world arise, everyone has their human opinion on the subject, “the lawyer says”, “the politician promised”, “the psychologist stated”, “my mom thinks”, “the self help book showed”, etc. And we are so quick to find an answer that suits our finite thinking, our limited perspective, our many times clouded minds. But not Ezekiel, he wasn’t going to tackle this question in his human estimation. He knew that God had infinite knowledge, unlimited, holy, and eternal perspective, and a mind that could not be clouded but that was far above the clouds.

If you read the rest of the chapter which I suggest you must do to get the full impact and not just a taste, you will see what God does with this “Death Valley” Situation. What is something is that this is not talking about an individual, but a NATION.

Think for a moment. We say can, God get me out of “Death Valley”. Perhaps we say Lord, get my family out. Have we asked the Lord to get our city out, our nation out! We limit God so many times to a personal relationship and forget His desire for a corporate relationship. He sees His church as His Bride. In Cinderella the prince kissed her to wake her up from her “Death Valley” and as Pastor Dave shared, the Lord has kissed the face of His children with His divine favor. Oh we are not trial free, because if we were how could God mold us to become like Christ, the Ultimate Conquer of “Death Valley”

Application: Cry out for not only yourself, but your city and your nation to live again.

Blessings,
Pastor Phil <

title.rendered: God’s Presence In Death Valley, by Phil the Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 23:1 The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. 2 He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters. 3 He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake. 4 Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me. 5 Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over. 6 Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.

Precursor: David wrote this Psalm when he was an old man and reflecting back upon his life. After killing Goliath, getting chased by Saul, being King of Israel, committing adultery with Bathsheba, he reflected back upon all that he had been through in his life and penned the most famous Psalm, as a summation of the Lord in his life. This is written from a shepherd that shepherded sheep and then the nation of Israel.

The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want- David was well versed in the life of a shepherd for that was his first role as a boy. He personalizes it by saying my shepherd. It was God who was leading him. The shepherd always provided all the sheep needed and the Lord was certainly no different.

He maketh me to lie down in green pastures. A shepherd brings the sheep to green pastures because that is where the food is and they can lay down there comfortably. The Lord nourishes our spirit and hearts with his love and truth, which is more valuable then food.

He leadeth me besides still waters. Shepherds would always bring the sheep to still waters because if they drink from running, rushing water the sheep could get swept away by the current. If the sheep fell, their wool would act as a sponge and drown the sheep. Surely our Shepherd leads us to places that we can spiritually drink of His living water that are still, and healthy. Jesus said if we drink of the water he gives we shall never thirst again, because the source never runs dry – praise God!

He restores my soul; he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake. The shepherd cares for the sheep and helps them when they are sick or overwhelmed.

Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me. The shepherd is there with the sheep through the most horrific times. God is certainly there because there is a shadow, which can only be cast from the light. His rod is there to count and discipline the sheep. God needs to discipline, and he only disciplines those he loves. The staff was to pull the sheep up when they ended up wondering away and the shepherd would find it hanging off a ledge. He would reach down and pull the helpless sheep up to safety.

Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over. God can set a feast in the presence of our very enemies. The shepherd would anoint the nose of the sheep to keep a certain kind of parasite from burrowing up the nose of the sheep into the brain. WOW! We are anointed with God’s precious holy spirit to keep the enemy from getting into our head with things.

Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever. All in all because the Shepherd stayed with David his whole life, all that God had to offer: His goodness, and mercy never left David. He was a man in the palace of the Lord, and would dwell in the house of the Lord (heaven) all the days of his life (eternally).

Application: Don’t focus on Death Valley, but rather the presence of the Lord in Death Valley.

Blessings,

Phil the Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 15:15, “He found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, reached out his hand and took it, and killed a thousand men with it”

I saw this movie “Apollo 13” once or twice that taught me a biblical principle. As depicted in this movie, Two days after the launch, the Apollo spacecraft was crippled by an explosion, caused by an electrical fault in an oxygen tank. The explosion damaged the Service Module, resulting in a loss of oxygen and electrical power. A failed mission was aborted before it became successful. Not only did the mission fail, to bring the men back to earth safely was a challenge. At one, the man in charge on the ground was trying to find everything they could use to bring the astronauts to a safe landing. He goes to one man who explains what one of the systems what is was designed to do and how it can’t do anything else besides what it was designed to do. His reaction, “let’s forget everything the machines were designed to do or not do and lets see how we can take what we have, modify it to do what we want it to do (paraphrased) bring the astronauts back home safely”. And that is what they did and it worked. God has many ways of bringing victory in situations you thought there was nothing around to use.

If you know the story of Samson, you will understand that he is a very unique individual. Born at a very specific time in history to fight against the philistines. If you look at Joshua and David, they were men of war, trained and had men with them. Samson was different, not born to be a warrior, had no training of any kind yet he would be used to deliver Israel from the Philistines. After being born, he began to grow and God blessed him. He had seven locks of hair that was not supposed to be cut. It was a sign of strength from above. The uniqueness of Samson was, he did great and mighty things when the Spirit of God moved in his life. That is what the Spirit of God does; He empowers you to do what you have not ability to do. He makes you do the impossible by taking something in the natural and using it to accomplish something in the supernatural.

Anytime the Philistine faced him, the bible says, the Spirit of God would come upon him mightily and use him to destroy the enemy. On one particular day when he was delivered to the Philistine bound, the Spirit of God came upon him. There were so many men against him; he did not have any sophisticated weapons to fight back like Rambo. All that present was, Judges 15:15, “…a fresh jawbone of a donkey…” To think about it, what can a jawbone do? God did not design it to be a weapon. It might injure one or two people, but how can you face over a thousand men with something like that? This is where the Spirit of God makes a difference. He empowers to the extent that you can take less and do much with it. The strength is not on the weapon but in the ability given to one to accomplish something. Jesus said in Luke 4:18, “The Spirit of the Lord is upon, because He (God) has anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor…” Jesus being on earth inform of flesh, there are certain things He was limited to do and God had to empower Him through His Spirit, remember He laid aside His majesty and completely yielded to the power from above through the Holy Spirit. Acts 10:38, “How God anointed Jesus Christ of Nazareth who went about doing good unto the children of man”. Just like the captain taking what was designed for other things and improvising it to use to bring victory in one area, so was the jawbone Samson used. God used something that was available a jawbone. Judges 15:15, “…reached out his hand and took it, and killed a thousand men with it”. It’s not the jawbone that killed men, it’s the Spirit of God driven through the jawbone that killed men. Anyone else who might have tried to take the same jawbone to do the same job would have failed.

I want us to know that God can use anything around to bring victory in your life. It could be something around you that was never designed for what you want to accomplish but God could use it. It may just be a jawbone, not have significance or even look stupid to use. You may be waiting to see sophisticated things before you see yourself becoming victorious. Let this be a reminder to you, It’s the Spirit of God that empowers not what is around. When Samson was done with the jawbone, he did not keep it because of the work it did. I believe the reason was, he knew God had used it just as a means to destroy the enemy. It could be a temporary thing to use but it would have done a work to remember. Pray that the Spirit of God will empower you to take less and do much with it. Blessings Ev

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Daniel 10:12, “Then he said to me, “Do not fear, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand, and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard; and I have come because of your words.

We live in time where everything is needed in a hurry. Talk about fast food restaurants, you drop in and get what you want, how you want it and fast. If the process is delayed even a little, frustrations are noticed. We cannot work with God in the same manner, His times are not our times. God sees far beyond what you and I see in the natural and knows what is best. You have to keep on knocking, seeking, asking. It’s either God’s way or no way as simple as that.

God’s seasons are not at your beck. If the first stroke of the flint does not bring forth the fire, you must strike again. God will hear prayer, but He may not answer it at the time which we in our minds have appointed; He will reveal Himself to our seeking hearts, but not just when and where we have settled in our own expectations. Hence the need of perseverance and importunity in supplication. Prayer is not to change God, prayer is to change us.

Daniel set himself to pray and fast for three weeks when he saw a vision that needed interpretation. Here is a man who knew what he needed to do and set himself to do it. He knew it would cost him to get results but he still set himself anyway. Are you always waiting for someone to pray for you or have you learnt like Daniel to set yourself to pray?. Pray without ceasing add fasting to strengthen your prayers and see what God will do. Daniel’s prayer reached the first day and answered but there was the prince of air blocking and delaying the messenger from bringing the answer to him. There was a delay but Daniel kept on seeking, knocking, asking while the heaven was in motion breaking through the barriers. When the bible says in 1Thessalonians 5:17, “Pray without ceasing” does mean, “pray without stopping” it indicates, “pray without giving up”.

In the days of flint and steel and brimstone matches we had to strike and strike again, dozens of times, before we could get a spark to live in the tinder; and we were thankful enough if we succeeded at last. At times we stopped but did not give up. Shall we not be as persevering and hopeful as to heavenly things? We have more certainty of success in this business than we had with our flint and steel, for we have God’s promises at our back. Never let us despair. God’s time for mercy will come; yea, it has come, if our time for believing has arrived. Ask in faith nothing wavering; but never cease from petitioning because the King delays to reply. Strike the steel again. Make the sparks fly and have your tinder ready; you will get a light before long. –C. H. Spurgeon. Daniel the man of God did, we too need to. Blessings Evans

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 14:9, “For to this end Christ died and rose and lived again, that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living”

Reaching the lost is dear to my heart. Over the last few years my eyes have been opened to see the state of human beings and the methods the church have used to bring them to Christ. Years back I brought many to Christ based on how I was taught and to my horror 99% of them fell away. It’s alarming to note that 80-90% of those who “supposedly asked Jesus into their heart” have fallen away from their faith. Man has adopted a different way of responding to the gospel and with that response, some people have ended up not lasting long serving Christ. It’s suppose to be coming to Jesus Christ in His terms NOT to be reduced to coming to Jesus Christ in man’s terms. “I will serve You Jesus as long as I can still do what I used to do”, “I will serve You as long as I can still control of my life”. I will allow You to be the Savior but not My Lord. It may not come out of your mouth as indicated but your action reflect whether Jesus is both the Savior and the Lord of your life.

Amos 3:2, “Can two walk together, unless they are agree? There can be only one Lord and not two, one driver and not two. The moment the introduction of who the boss is in your life is wrong, you will go no where. You and I can only walk together in agreement when we have defined who is in control. When we received Christ for those who have, we said, “Lord it is no longer about me but about You”. Before then we were the drivers of our own lives, when we received Him, we transferred our trust from what we used and gave Him everything and said, “take over my life”. We took the back sit and the Lord took the driver’s sit. If He is the driver and He knows the way, why do you and I want to dictate Him on how He should do His job? HE PAID THE PRICE TO BE THE BOSS, His actions commands our obedience. It’s sad to see people who had Jesus on the driver seat boot Him out when they went through bumpy roads and rocks”

On a serious note, I would like to introduce the Man who paid the price to be the boss. In Titus 6:15, the bible calls Him the Lord of lords. He is above every lord living and has ever lived, never forget that. In Ephesians 4:5, He is the one Lord, who is Mighty. When John the Baptist talked about Him, He did not introduce Him as a friend, He said, “There comes another One who is Mightier than I, whose shoes I’m not worthy to carry. He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and Fire”. He is Sovereign, He is glorious, He is all we are not. Acts 2:36, “Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ”. He has dominion over the things in heaven, on earth and beneath the earth, that at the mention of the name Jesus, every knee shall bow and every tongue shall confess that Jesus Christ is Lord. One day every knee will bow to him either in heaven or in hell. If you thought that He is just the Lord over some things, let this be a reminder to you that He is the Lord over all. Mark 2:28, “Lord also of the Sabbath”.

Romans 14:9, “For to this end Christ died and rose and lived again, that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living”. If the Christ had died and not come back to life, it would have been a different story, but He died and then rose and now lives again forever and ever. He did this that He might be the Lord of both the dead and the living. You can see the word “might” underlined, this to us shows that He never forced Himself to be the Lord of the living (saved). If He was just our Savior then we would get saved and then die and go to heaven, His Lordship reminds us that getting saved is not the end but a beginning and in this life we need the Lord to go through it. Getting saved means. “I’m no longer in charge of my life but He is” Galatians 2:20, “I am crucified with Christ, nevertheless I live, yet not I, but Christ lives in me, and the life that I now live in the flesh, I live by faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave Himself for me”. It may look like I’m in control but I’m not for He is. He is my Lord, I’m no longer in charge of my life. As long as I was in charge, I was messing things up, now my life is under NEW MANAGEMENT. I don’t want Him just to be the Savior but also the Lord of my life. David writes in Psalm 31:15, “My times are in thy hand”, that sums up the Lordship of Jesus Christ in our lives for it’s showing that everything I do which involves time are in His hands.

Stop giving the Lord what is LEFT and start giving Him what is RIGHT, Let Him be the LORD of LOADS. If you could be the Lord of your life, you could have your life together by now, but it has been proven that you are your worst enemy and to be frank, you will never get it together as long as Christ is not in the picture for people who have no control are wild. They have no order, cannot be taught, cannot be trained and cannot be used and it’s simply because they are wild. Wild people don’t want instructions, guidance or counsel. If Christ is not the Lord of your life right now, check again and you will see how wild you are.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 118:8, “It is better to trust in the Lord than to put your confidence in man”

Life is a long and bumpy road. We each carry our troubles like heavy load. There are many hard turns and some dead ends. However whenever we are stuck, we must know whom look to. With the elections, many are putting their confidence in the next president hoping he will turn things around but for us as believers, are we doing the same?. The scripture verse above is right in the middle of the bible. I would call it the heart bit of every man who understands what life is. When I look at a scripture, I tend to pick out a word or two to understand why the author chose to use those particular word’s . In this case, the author used the word “Confidence” instead of “Faith” and my first reaction was, is there any difference? Let’s start with “faith”, faith is trust, belief and confidence. Can we say then that both faith and confidence are the same? The answer is yes but their use has different WEIGHTS. Confidence is derived from the word confide which is to tell confidential matters or imparting secrets. Confidence is also faith that one will act in a right proper and effective way. My favorite definition, confidence stresses faith in one’s self and one’s power without any suggestion of conceit or arrogance. God is confident in Himself, His ability can no one match.

This is my personal conviction, I can have faith in man but I CANNOT confidence in man or in a system. Why is this so important to us then? Confidence in man or systems are shaky as man is weak in the flesh and can stumble over what they have committed themselves to. Putting unrealistic expectations on people is not wise, be it in a ministry, work force, relationship, cause when they don’t come through, views of them may change. I have seen people attach themselves relationships for ages because at the beginning, they gave out everything about themselves and put their total confidence in that person, when things did not work out, they were left hurt, confused, raged and some went into depression. How many have planned their lives well that if they did A,B,C,D, they will not be in lack anymore, they would have gotten their lives exactly how they wanted to, all would turn out as they desired and then something happens? The world and it’s systems are shaky. It’s ok to plan but our confidence should not be in the planning.

We can vote, but our confidence is not in the outcome or who will lead us. We maybe voting maybe the means by which God raises up a new leader but our confidence is not in the leader. Our confidence is the Lord who could use the leader to turn things around. Psalm 118:8, “It is better to trust in the Lord than to put your confidence in man”. People can fail you and so will you fail them, the heart bit of the scripture teaches us that it’s okay to trust man and have confidence in him but it is better or better off trusting and having confidence in God. I would say the reason is simple, if you can learn to confide in God, if you are failed by people, you will have learnt to handle them.

Distancing yourself from them wouldn’t be right, but you will learn to forgive and forget. You will have someone to completely trust in who will teach you how to handle a person who either has failed you or can fail you. God never fails and shouldn’t be looked at the way the other person who failed. He holds the secrets without blowing your cover, knows your weakness yet still accepts you. He wasn’t attracted to you based on what you presented to Him. In this time, who do you have confidence in?. Blessing Evans

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 55:1-23, “… So I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest”

We are facing tough times especially with economic crisis. Everyone is affected in these tough times. The magnitude maybe small or great but the fact remains life is tough. I’m sorry to say that as believers at times we have promised the world that if they come to Jesus, all their troubles will disappear and so many have come to Jesus expecting comfort and good life and when everything did not go as they expected, they abandoned their faith. You and I have to address this early in our Christ walk this question, “Why you serve Christ”. It’s been said, “life is not fair but God is good”, situations and circumstances will not make Him less of Himself, He is the same forever. So understanding that we will always be faced with situations leads us to address them.

Would our prayers be something like this, “Father, please get me out of this”, and if the situation does not change in a day or two, we come back to God and pray, “Father, when I’m I getting out of this?” or should we be praying, “FATHER, WHAT SHOULD I GET OUT OF THIS?” David found himself in this kind of dilemma if you read psalms 55. He was going through overwhelming situations. This might have been the times when Saul was after his life and he was constantly running for his life. With the trials, temptations, exhaustion, confusion, frustration, brokenness, spent, troubled and the list continues, the word “enough is enough” must have come to his mind and so his faith was replaced by a “wish” “So I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest”. I have wished this many times when everything was out of control. Well it’s genuine.

I love doves, they are pretty birds. Doves are symbol of peace, the Spirit of God descended on Jesus as a dove, and who wouldn’t love doves? the bible says that, “be as wise as serpents and as harmless as doves”, Mat 10:16. Once again we see a good word about doves. David’s desire was to fly away from his problems by having the wings of dove for they fly fast. They flap their wings fast to get out of a situation at any given time. But with God, flying away from situations is not His style as in Romans 5, the bible says that tribulation works patience, patience experience and experience hope and hope does not a shame”. Situations are learning opportunities. I do not want to have the wings of a dove for that will make me escape and miss the opportunity to learn something in the current situation. Psalm 119:71, “It’s good for me to have been afflicted that I may learn thy statutes. Alright Lord do not give me the wings of a dove, but give me some wings.

Isaiah 40:31, “But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; They shall mount up with wings as the eagles”. These are the wings we need and that is the wing of eagles. Look at the way the wings are given to us, as we wait on God meaning serving God without complaining about what we are dealing with or facing, our strength will be renewed in tough situations and through the renewing of our strengths, we will be mounted with wings like eagles. Eagles don’t struggle to fly, they just stretch their wings and the wind carries them around. In rare cases will you see an eagle flap it’s wings. When it’s in the air flying, it could be up there for hours and hours while the dove would fly, get some rest and continue it’s journey. The eagles fly above and so we are expected as Christians to fly above our situations and not run away from them. While flying above, the Spirit will blow us (direct us) in the direction He wants to lead us, just like the wind will move the eagle to different directions. Where will your wind blow me oh Lord? To add to that, being above causes us to see how the Lord is working all things together for our good, if you fly away like a dove, you will miss an opportunity to see God in your situation.

David’s desire to have wings like dove and fly away would not even make his problems go away as they would have caught up with him. What you don’t deal with in the night will catch up with you in the morning. Flying to the desert? boy it’s not getting any better but I love how he later mentions something for us to do vs. 22 “Cast your cares on the LORD and he will sustain you; he will never let the righteous fall. (NIV) “. I pray that God will give us all the wings of eagles if we ever need wings.

Thanks

Ev

title.rendered: Let Go And Let Him Be, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Samuel 12:21, “Then his servants said to him, “What is this that you have done? You fasted and wept for the child while he was alive, but when the child died, you arose and ate food.”

I ask myself why did God have to take away David’s son, couldn’t He have done something else? after all, David was a man after God’s own heart. When the foundation is wrong, it may take many wrongs before God steps in and fixes it and yes there can be consequences but God… Why go down the wrong path even if you know that God is able to transform a life even in a mess? The bible says in 1 Corinthians 10:11, “Now all these things happened to them as examples, and they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages have come”. God told the Israelites what they would have to go through if they insisted on having a king, they insisted and things happened as He said. They went through a lot under the leadership of Saul before God gave them a good king David. What I’m I saying, when a foundation of a relationship is defined wrong, it has missed God’s direct will and you are setting yourself up for a big fall. You can pray all you want just like David but unless you have a garden of Gethsemane experience where you say, “not my will but yours be done” and be content in your singleness where God has placed you as His servant and serve Him faithfully as you wait on Him to bless you with a true companion, approved and blessed of Him, God will let you have your way and that is a tragedy.

David denied himself food so as to pray for restoration, he invested through prayer on who he loved but God took him away. I believe God takes certain relationships away as they are a hindrance to what He wants to do in a person’s life. He wants us to develop such as strong vertical relationship with Him that in turn it may be reflected on horizontal relationship with a person who too has vertical relationship with Him. How can darkness and light relate? That is what happens when the unsaved and the saved are equally yoked. What the saved believes is wrong may not be wrong to the unsaved. In this kind of relationship, standards are opened to be compromised.

Son’s tend to learn how to treat their wives and children through their earthly fathers. I have learnt a lot by watching my earthly father treat his wife and his children. With that I mirroring the same to my wife and hopefully my children when they come. God allows us to be in His school of learning investing in each of us qualities that will cushion what is to come. He is building a strong foundation that will stand the test of time. I remember how a relationship I was in had to be terminated cause it was standing in the way of what God wanted to do in my life. The moment I let go though painful, He built my relationship with Him, established my foundation in prayers, witnessing, teaching, preaching, encouraging etc. I have a stronger foundation today than a few years back. In waiting for His will for 8 years, He blessed me with my wife Judy. I am so grateful he terminated the other relationship, taking away the first that He may establish the second.

In all, David’s son dies, everyone is wondering how to break the news to him over the lost relationship. Already he has been fasting and praying, what would happen if he was given news that the one he’s been praying for is dead?, he might do some harm as the bible puts it. You might be depressed, angry, disconnected, blame God, blame the person who has been disconnected from you. Accuse them of treating you badly or blame them for the failure of that relationship. Read what David did in his situation that is breathtaking, vs. 20, “So David arose from the ground, washed and anointed himself, and changed his clothes; and he went into the house of the LORD and worshiped. Then he went to his own house; and when he requested, they set food before him, and he ate”. He did not go into the house of the Lord to launch a complaint, he went to worship then had food. Here is a man who understood that the chief end of all beings is the glory of God, not the happiness of man. Here is a man who learnt to let go and let Him (God) be. It’s like, “I had plans and hopes, I would have loved to see God do something but because He is sovereign, He has good reasons and better plan for my situation”. I cannot continue to cry and mourn over the relationship I lost, He is in control. Can you see the servants were more concerned about what he lost while David was kissing what He lost goodbye, encouraging Himself as He worships the Lord and trusting God to do something new. Yes he made mistakes before and God forgave him of them, now he is in marriage (covenant) with Bathsheba and God is ready to bless him. Your attitude matters a lot in a case like this.

Vs 24. “Then David comforted Bathsheba his wife, and went in to her and lay with her. So she bore a son, and he called his name Solomon. Now the LORD loved him. New foundation that pleases the Lord opened doors for David’s blessings of a son and the Lord loved Solomon. What a seal of approval on this relationship, God taking away the first to establish the second. What God approves, He will bless. Mess ups turned into something beautiful. Had he not let go, he would have missed a unique opportunity to be blessed. A better man, blessed with a son who becomes, the wisest man that ever lived, built a temple for the Lord, highly favored of God, the richest etc. David concludes Psalm 119:71, “It is good for me that I have been afflicted, That I may learn Your statutes”, Had he learnt the statutes from the beginning, he would have not been afflicted, why do you?. Evaluate, is your relationship of God? has He tried to terminate it but you hanged on to it cause you were not willing to let go. Don’t assassinate the best He wants to bring in your life by being stubborn. If you are already married to unbeliever, that does not qualify for termination, God’s seal is on that marriage, this is for those who have not crossed over yet. LET GO AND LET HIM BE!!! Ev

Thanks

Ev

title.rendered: Let Go And Let Him Be, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Samuel 12:21, “Then his servants said to him, “What is this that you have done? You fasted and wept for the child while he was alive, but when the child died, you arose and ate food.”

One of the deadliest things we can do as believers is try and cling onto dead things. When I talk about dead things, I’m not talking about something we picked dead but something that was once alive but as time went by, it began to loose it’s life and finally died. What you once hoped for, worked hard to keep alive all of a sudden is pronounced dead. It’s a hard reality to live by but the truth is, it’s no longer effective. I see many people waste months and years trying to keep alive what is dead especially “relationships”. Hanging on to that woman or that man who was once alive in many ways but not anymore. Too much has been invested in the relationship with very little in return. The more you worked to make it a live, the more it deteriorated. If it’s of God, that’s a different story because God could be preparing you for something, what I’m taking about is what someone looks at and knows for sure it’s not godly and can never be God’s will. This message is for the singles. I would like to take a story in the bible and glean some principles off it to make a point.

David in my text committed adultery with Bathsheba, Uriah’s wife that resulted into a son. David had a relationship with this son, his own flesh and blood. He cared for his son cause when a judgment was pronounced that his son would not live because of what he did, he goes into prayer and fasting 2Samuel 12:16, “David therefore pleaded with God for the child, and David fasted and went in and day all night on the ground”. This is trying to hold on onto what God wants to terminate. There is a good reason for this son not to be in the picture as he was not born in a marriage therefore he will not be an inheritant. The bible does not even waste time telling us his name. How many waste time praying to God to sustain a relationship He wants to terminate? You are yoked with unbeliever, one who is outside God’s covenant (married to Christ) in other words not saved and God says, “he or she has to go”. The hard things to let go is what you have invested so much in. Scared of loosing this cause you don’t see yourself getting anything beyond what you already had. It’s like a son who is hanging on the tree, the father tells him to let go of the branch cause he will catch him but the son is too scared of letting go cause he does not trust that the father has the capability of catching him when he let’s go. You are not ready to be caught till you are ready to let go. You are not ready to gain until you are ready to loose. My first point today is, God will not bless what we have made and insist on. He can only bless what He has planned and provided. I will share more. Be blessed Ev

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 2:25, “And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed”

We shared on “Laying Down Your Life” the otherday, I apologize for not being able to deliver the word yesterday, had a Dr’s appointment. Let me pen another devotion in regards to marriage.



Marriage is the primary relationship and institution where in it we can most fully know the love of God. It’s a place where respect for each other’s thoughts and feelings can be instituted. I believe with all my heart that there are certain ministers whose ministries can never be complete without having a companion alongside them in their ministry. Your wife or husband is your greatest and number one ministry. If you cannot be effective in ministering to the one God has joined you to, how will you be effective outside that boundary?



So why do we have many problems in marriages today? Communication is one of the greatest developing tools in marriage. Terrified of communicating, bad communications, miscommunications, misunderstandings tends to cause problems in relationships. Most of us are afraid of revealing ourselves, showing what is truly inside our hearts and minds. I am terrible at times in communicating certain things I need to. I hate to be misunderstood or say the right thing the wrong way. Many have problem communicating because they operate on the level of assumptions about each other based on previous experiences and conversations. It’s thinking and feeling that the other person knows everything you are trying to communicate without actually doing it. Deep love responds to deep sharing, being opened and not afraid of being yourself. How we communicate will result to how it will be received. You could be saying something good and true but how communicate it matters a lot. You could be yelling and screaming trying to make a point but that would not help. Nagging and constantly pinpointing and dwelling on someone’s faults and weakness is not “building communication”. We are to build each other with our words and actions. The bible says, “A married woman’s is concerned about the affairs of this world, how she can please her husband and the bible instructs husbands to be considerate to their wives, loving them and treating them with respect for this is pleasing to the Lord” (paraphrased)



Jesus was open in His communication to mankind. He did not withhold anything that His bride needed to know. And when they crucified Him naked, He wasn’t ashamed because He was demonstrating His love towards His bride. Genesis 2:25, “And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed”, I’m not talking about physical nakedness, I’m talking about being real, opened to the one you love without feeling ashamed. Knowing that the one you love will accept you for who you are, and love you unconditionally as you learn to communicate freely. Through genuine communication and companionship, the result from continued choices of behavior of both individuals in partnership will experience something more of what God means when He says He is with us. You can be the voice of God sometimes for your husband or wife in giving guidance and direction.



The relationship will grow, the love will flourish, and the marriage will reflect something more of the nature and the character of God to the world. It will affect you even at your place of work and how you relate to people why? because there is joy in honest communication and genuine companionship. We are choosing to live more fully through the acceptance of another person who knows us intimately simply because we are both naked and not ashamed. Blessings Ev, God’s servant

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 15:13, “Greater love has no one than this, than to lay down one’s life for his friends”.

Remember when you would imagine growing up, schooling to have the job of your dream, marrying the woman or the man of your dream? You kind of imagined how it would be like, you played husband or wife with the toys that were given to you? Now you are in marriage, it’s not like what you anticipated, you’ve discovered it is hard work. A lot of life adjusting styles and you have to make changes cause CHANGE IS ALWAYS A CHOICE ACCOMPANIED BY COMMITMENT. Someone said, “Marriages are made in heaven but they are perfected here on earth”. It’s a school of learning.

What if marriage was not created by God to make us happy but to make us holy, how would you approach it? I believe marriage is designed to help us be like Christ. Marriage is two best friends (a man and a woman) who have decided to be joined together in a holy matrimony by God through His chosen people. The bible says that, Mark 10:9, “Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate.” This is not just people outside but even people in that marriage covenant. It’s God’s seal and honors the commitment. I have been married for 2½ years now and I keep praying for strength to lay my life down for the sake of the one I love”. That is what marriage is, laying your life for the rest of it for the sake of someone else. Jesus taught us what marriage is like when He the Groom laid down His life for the sake of His friends. He laid aside His majesty, giving up everything for the sake of those He loved but never forced His bride to love and follow Him. A Christian teacher said something that was breath taking, he said “do you realize that in the bible wives are not commanded to love? Why is that, they are created to love on the other hand, husbands are commanded to love” Wives are commanded to respect their husbands. As a husband desires respect so does the wife desires to be loved.

Marriage is based on trust, if you don’t trust your best friend, you have a weak foundation. Excessive conflicts tend to put a marriage in a bad shape. Actually the enemy tends to use this for his advantage. He knows power is multiplied and not added when couples come together through prayers and reading of the word. He knows that if He can bring excessive conflicts, instead of couples joining forces to fight him, they will be fighting each other. Marriage should be a win win deal, if it’s one sided, that is domination. Unrealistic expectations cripple a marriage. It’s not about winning an argument cause you could win one but put a relationship in jeopardy. It’s about taking time to deposit in each other’s accounts. How can you withdraw what you’ve not deposited? Many break ups takes place because when two people came into a relationship that led into marriage, they came with their accounts full but as time go by, they withdraw from each other’s accounts without depositing. When the accounts became empty, what is there in the relationship to live for?

I believe God created marriage to help His people understand His love towards the church and to help one another live a life pleasing unto the Lord as we deposit in each other with a desire to help them be better in the site of the Lord. Laying down you life would be a heavy price to give up, the payoff is personal growth and the opportunity to develop a wonderful and supportive relationship where there is the art of helping each other put God first, working and building together, forgiveness, honesty, gentleness, humility, submission, responsive, loving, affectionate etc. To love is to lay down your life. Blessings Ev, God’s servant.

Thanks
Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Acts 7:54-60, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”

To share along the lines of what I shared yesterday, let’s look at another life. It’s easy to see what we want to see and our eyes can also play trick on us making us miss what we should see or distort it to appear as something different. What is truth? Something we need to see.

Stephen was a man of faith, full of the Holy Spirit. The bible says he did great wonders and signs among the people. Very few people embraced what he spoke and did. Most conspired to silence him in anyway even if it meant killing him. To kill him required a cause, a reason. They first thought of disputing him, he stood his ground, Acts 6:8, says, “And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke”. Like I said yesterday, here we have another picture of a man fulfilling 1Peter 3:15, which says “But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts; and be ready to give an answer to every man that asks you a reason for the hope that is in you with meekness and fear”. Stephen knew who his God was, what had been invested in him and he was not afraid to defend his faith. He had seen what many had not seen and therefore standing out there, he was able to give them a glimpse of what standing for the truth is all about. There are and will be people who will try and challenge your faith in Christ questioning you, what kind of stand will you take? Romans 1:16, “For I am not a shamed of the gospel of Christ: for it’s the power of God unto salvation to everyone who believes…”. They lied on him but he stood firm and defended his faith which later led to his death. Having encountered with Christ, they that saw him saw a transfigured man, Acts 6:15, “And all who sat in the council, looking steadfastly at him, saw his face as the face of an angel”. What an awesome opportunity for the people to see him as a man who had encountered with the Lord. He had faith, the Holy Spirit, wisdom, boldness and a shinning face all that come from above. Do people see all these when they encounter with you? Stephen’s continuous connection gave him a chance to tap from the heavenly sources that in turn may be revealed to the people.

He takes the time to take the people in history from the time of Abraham and covers everything even how the people killed all those who brought the good news. The more the people heard what he had to say, the truth, the more they wanted to tear him apart. Acts 7:55, “But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God, vs. 56, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”. I read this the other day and pondered because the verses I have come across talks about Jesus SITTING on the right hand of God. Here Stephen tells us about Jesus STANDING on the right hand of God, could it be that Stephen saw that it pleased the Lord by his stand that the Lord was willing to stand with him in the midst of hostility?

Glory be to God, when you know what you stand for, though you may share with people the truth, many may not see what you see. Stephen was not frustrated because these people were not seeing what he was seeing, he knew it took truth and the power of God to see what He saw. They already saw his face shinning, he gave them a chance to see where he’s was from strength. Do not be frustrated because people are not seeing what you are seeing, even Elisha had a servant who began to panic because those who were about attack them. Meanwhile Elisha remained calmed for he had seen what his servant had not seen. Instead of him being frustrated with his servant, he prayed to God to open the eyes of his servant to see what he was seeing. I’m praying to God to work on me on this part for there are times I would like people especially the unsaved to see what I am see and it’s tough and can be frustrating, my prayer is that God will open their eyes to see what I see, Jesus sitting on the throne ruling forever and ever.

Acts 7:58, “And they cast him out of the city and stoned him. vs. 59, “And they stoned Stephen as he was calling on God saying, “Lord Jesus receive my Spirit”. With His eyes gazing into heaven while being stoned, he remained calm and called on God. You can be stoned with words, be ridiculed, be put down and these things can be hurting but as Stephen, look to heaven. Acts 7:60, “Then he knelt down and cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not charge them with this sin”. And when he had said this, he fell as a sleep”. Because of what he had seen that people did not see, he couldn’t blame them for their actions all he prayed was for God to forgive them. Jesus did the same hanging on the cross, those who crucified him did not know what they were doing. If they understood who Jesus was and is, they would have thought twice. Forgive those who stone you with their words, those who talk ill about your faith, those who reject the truth for they haven’t seen the light. Remember that they may not see what you see but what they see in you they will not deny. Saul (Paul) was present at the stoning of Stephen, actually he was carrying the garments of those who stoned Stephen. It’s not recorded but I believe that Stephen’s last moments must have impacted him in away. A man of God not afraid to be stoned to death for the sake of Christ. Where he was going could not be compared to where he had come from and there was no reason to hold anything inside. Father forgive them for they know not what they are doing!. Keep seeing what many haven’t seen yet!

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Daniel 3:17&18, “If that is the case, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and He will deliver us from your hand, O king. But if not, let it be known to you, O king, that we do not serve your gods, nor will we worship the gold image which you have set up”.

There is an on going war between Relative and Absolute statements. We get caught up in the middle many times. Let’s tackle a few questions.

First question, “What do you believe?”. This question is a little bit broad until you add elements to it to identify what the questioner is targeting with his question. I believe in trucks on the road because I can see them on the road. Is that the response to the question the author is really looking for? I believe that trucks can take away life if it comes into contact with a living being at a certain speed. Can we say that facts can negate beliefs? of course we can. If I was to say that trucks don’t kill, I would have to be 100% sure as a fact, that would be considered an absolute statement, in this case this statement is not true. We all know that trucks can kill so my belief that it cannot will not affect or change facts.

Daniel, Shadrach, Meshach and Abed-Nego were in a place where they are faced by two kingdoms. They were to serve and obey one of the kingdoms. In the earlier chapters we are told of these four young, good looking brought to the land of Babylon to serve. They knew their God all this time but coming to this land, they were faced by knew challenges, they had to rely on God to bring them through and He did. We can tell that these men had a God whom they believed in, the God of truth. Job tells us that He knows his Redeemer lives (Job 19:25), Paul tells in 2Timothy 1:12, “…I know whom I have believed”. All these men believed because they knew who their God was (is).

If you know what you believe, question, “Why do you believe what you believe?. This is tough to some people, they have no idea why they believe what they believe. I would say that one of the reason is because it’s easy to create what you want to believe in and stick with it without proper reason. A Christian should know why he believes partially because the bible says in 1Peter 3:15, “But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you…”. I have to know why I believe when asked, I have an answer. Why did these men believe in God?. We can tell that through the miracles God had done in their lives. God had seen them through all their life and being in that nation, they knew that they had been sent there by God to serve. As the bible says, “Their footsteps were ordered by God”. These were men who did not just hear about it, they experienced it causing them to move from the realm of belief to the realm of experience, Psalm 34:8, “O taste and see that the Lord is good…”

Another vital question, “Where do you get your back up from?”. Anyone who is going to defend what they believe in has to have some type of backup. Talk to many people and discover they believe in some things they can’t back up, they don’t have a source of authority to fall back on. If I am going to believe in the word of God to which I am, I will always have His word as my backup. 2Timothy 3:16&17, “All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profited for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness: That the man may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works”. We Christians ought to defend what we believe through the Holy Scriptures for it ties to who we believe in. The scripture is God Himself revealed through the word, John 1:1, “In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God and the Word was God”. So it’s no longer what I have created to believe in but what I have tested and tasted to believe in the word. The word may reveal things I don’t like about myself but I know that it’s the truth for I have tested it. I believe in the law of gravity for I have tested it, there are things I haven’t tested but because I have seen it work in someone’s life, that is evidence, proof.

Last but not least, “Would you be willing to die for what you believe?”. This is tough but is called for. Jesus died for what He believed, He would redeem, mankind. Back in 99 at Columbine high school, a girl died because of her faith. With a gun pointing at her, she was asked if she believed in God, and her answer was YES, that cost her life. Shadrach, Meshach and Abed-Nego, were men ready to die for the sake of truth. THEY WERE MEN STANDING FOR SOMETHING SO AS NOT TO FALL FOR ANYTHING. They had counted the cost why? because they believed, they knew why, had back up and were willing to die for it. They knew that this was the truth and no one could take it away from them. They understood that “to be absent in the body is to be present with the Lord”. They were very aware of their outcome unless the Lord miraculously delivered them. They were determined for God to receive glory whether in His deliverance or in their death. Therefore when they were faced by a situation that required them to go against what they believed, they said Daniel 3:17&18, “If that is the case, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and He will deliver us from your hand, O king. But if not, let it be known to you, O king, that we do not serve your gods, nor will we worship the gold image which you have set up”. This is a very bold statement, “we know our God will but if not, we will not” Be ready always, Blessings Evans



Thanks

Ev

Good morning,



Luke 6:43-45, 45 “A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart] brings forth evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.”

In life everyone is identified or known by either what they present or what come out of their mouths. People become cautious when something not always seen in one person comes out. Most of the time it is the bad coming out of a someone who has the indwelling Spirit of God. If you were to tell somebody about something so and so did out of his nature, if they truly know so and so, the response you might get, “that doesn’t sound doesn’t sound like so and so”. We are known by our fruits and Christ in us is the hope for good fruit. Paul says this about himself, “For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh) nothing good dwells; for to will is present with me, but how to perform what is good I do not find”, Romans 7:18. In his flesh nothing good dwelt but in his spirit. Who you are outside there speak louder than what you say. People like real Christians who talk the talk and walk the walk but how can we on our own?.



A good man out of the good treasures of his heart brings forth that which is good and an evil man out of the evil treasures of his heart brings forth that which is evil is shown to us in the passage. If we understand that no one is good except Christ then to bring out the good fruit has to be through Christ. Paul tells us that the will to perform the good is there, the power to is lacking. Many times you can tell who someone is by what comes out of their mouths. Whatever comes out of their mouths is a result of what is stored inside. One cannot give birth to what they are not pregnant with and that is why we always need to be very carefully about what we store inside because sooner or later, it will be manifested outside.



As believers we have hidden treasures and as you know, a treasure is something that is very valuable and so to have good treasures that is something. The bible says that, “for out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks”, mark the word abundance. Christ in us is more than enough, He is a treasure to be treasured, for in us dwells Christ and because of Him, out of the abundance in our hearts He will cause our mouths to speak with wisdom, encourage, inspire, uplift, congratulate without feeling being robbed, not kill with words, not swear or even cuss, not even speak defeat or fear. If you store the good in your heart, for sure the good will come out of you. The moment you begin to speak, for a sec check what is coming out of you constantly and you will know what and who is in you. Remember that we will be known by our fruits and this is a result of the out working of the internal. Ephesians 4:29, “Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers”. Proverbs 18:21, “Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof”. An ambassador will not speak anything that degrades his country because he is motivated by his country’s principles and he lives by them and he brings them out.



Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 51:10-12, “…Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation…” Until we are aware of where we are and where we are going, we will never know what we have lost or gained in our journey. The bible calls on everyone to examine themselves, do a spiritual evaluation to see where they are. At times we may not know our exact state and like David we should pray, Psalms 139:23-24, “Search me oh God and know my heart; try me and know my thoughts and see if there be any wicked way in me and lead me in the way of everlasting”. By allowing the Lord to search us and try us that we may not loose our edge.

There are things that are beyond repair, they have to be created. In verse 10 of Psalm 51 starts with “create in me a clean heart”. “The heart is deceitful above all things and desperately wicked” Jeremiah 17:9 tells us and we cannot expect God to repair it, He has to create it make it out of nothing as a new heart. David had just sinned by committing adultery with Bathsheba and he understood his heart to be deceitful, instead of desiring that his heart be renewed, he cries out for the creation of a new heart. “create” is key. The bible says, “if any man be in Christ, he is a new creation” not “a repaired creation”. “Renew” is the second thing mentioned in the same verse. Once creation of the heart has taken place, it remains empty until filled with the Spirit of God. The spirit of God is not created , He is forever existing, perfect, complete and a live. The only thing I believe happens when we make mistakes, He’s effectiveness is blocked by sins. For us to function effectively as believers, His dwelling place our hearts has to be renewed.

“Restore” unto me the joy of thy salvation” is another line shown in this passage. This is a very powerful thing that I want to dwell on this morning. I can break the word “RESTORE” into two words “RE” & “STORE”. I would define “RE” as an action of repeating something that was done before and the word “STORE” is keeping something in a safe place away from many things. When we combine the two together we are talking about something that was once stored but because sins, it was lost and has to be restored (kept). When it is restored, it’s not just a portion of it but a complete thing, meaning the way it was before something happened to it. God is in the business of doing more than we could ever imagine or think but before He can do it, He is restoring His people. He has to bring them back to their first love. David cries out that his joy will be restored and when you look in the bible it says that the “Joy of the Lord is my strength” so he understood that if the joy of the Lord could be restored in his life then he would be an over comer gain simply because the ,joy of the Lord gives him strength. David had always been an over comer and when he sinned, guilt and shame took over replacing the joy that was already in him. The Lord wanted to take him to greater levels but that could not happen until what he had before had been brought back. If anything new is done without the restoration, you will never know the difference because the new will try to replace what should have already been there.

Maybe you have desired more in your life, or move from stage to stage, remember you will not get there until He has restored in you what you lost. Someone has lost faith, joy, peace, strength etc. How can you expect to more without being restored?. Just like someone driving east for miles only to discover he is suppose to be going west. When he realizes he is going the wrong way, he has to restore his way back to where he started going east then go west There are no shortcuts. Joel 2:25, And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpillar, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you”

Thanks
