Good morning,

John 4:23, “But the hour is coming and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in Spirit and truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him. God is a Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship Him in Spirit and Truth”

I have discovered something about lingering longer in the presence of the Almighty God, I may begin in the flesh but His presence transforms a life. You cannot encounter with God an remain the same. That is why working with Christ calls for dying to self and alive in Him. I decrease that Christ may increase, less of me and more of Him, none of me and whole of Him for it’s not about me but about Him. I remember a song that says, “let the Spirit rise and let the flesh be removed”.

The more the woman at well spent time with Christ, the more He revealed things about her people, her life then Himself to her. She is began to know the Lord whom she had never encountered with. I have been in the presence of the Lord at times without knowing that I was there but the more I lingered and got to search, seek, knock and ask, the more Jehovah Shammah which means Jehovah Present revealed Himself.

Lets finish this series today by looking at how this woman discovered that whoever she was speaking with was none other than the Messiah promised. After the Samaritan woman had said the truth about her being without a husband and Jesus revealing to her what she had always been, her eyes are opened and her response is, vs. 19, “sir I perceive that You are a prophet”, Can you imagine standing with someone who knows your history and yet He is still with you despite the fact that you’ve messed up? He is not intimidated by her scars and old self cause He has the power to change you. I thank God for His grace and mercy, when the law passed that I had failed, grace and mercy stood not to defend my actions but deliver me from them. He can take junk and make it whole for His use.

From talking in the flesh, she begins to talk about spiritual stuff addressed in vs. 20. Worship is the key word today, as for the next five vs. worship is talked about. I am learning the art of worship as a believer. When I received Christ, my first duty was not to preach, teach, be a leader or an encourager, my first responsibility was to be a worshiper, a follower of Christ. This is the first duty for every believer. John 12:32, “And if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men unto me” says the Lord, Psalm 150:6, “Let everything that has breath praise the Lord, Psalm 34:1, “I will bless the Lord at all times, His praise shall continually be in my mouth, Psalm 103:1, “Bless the Lord oh my soul and all that is within me worship Him. We have to worship Him as He is looking for a people who will worship Him in Spirit and truth.

Vrs25, “I know the Messiah is coming (who is called Christ), when He comes, He will tell us all things, Vs. 26 and Jesus said to her, “I who speaks to you am He””. This blows my mind as this what I would call the presence of God made manifested in other words revealed. Like I have said, His presence changes a life and what she did was leave her earthly water bucket and runs into the city to be a witness to the promise. By one woman, the whole of Samaria gets to know the Master. One powerful encounter changes her completely for it’s no longer her but God inside of her, Galatians 2:20, “I am crucified with Christ, nevertheless I live, but not I but Christ lives in me; the life that I now live in the flesh, I live by faith through Him who gave His life”

Can I talk to you ladies for a second? I have respect for ladies more than anything else; maybe it’s because my salvation came as a result of a woman seriously, constantly and earnestly praying for me (my mom). You ladies have some powerful things that make you more favorable with God than any other creatures in the world. Persistence has always been your style example (the woman with the issue of blood), Faith that negates the facts (Shunammite woman), Followers (Ruth), Leadership (Esther), Prayer (Hannah the mother of Samuel). Protector (Rahab the harlot) and more. Whatever you do, you do it diligently until it yields a result to you. Keep it up, as these are your defenses. Our desire to linger longer in the presence of the Lord, going through different stages (obedience, willingness, truthful, worship, used of God) causes us to be prepared to be used of God. Do you feel ordinary? Meet Him, for when He reveals Himself to you, you will be changed.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 4:1-42, … “If you knew the gift of God and who it is that asks you for a drink, you would have asked Him and He would have given you living water.”…

Obedience was the key word we looked at yesterday as we began to see the life of a Samaritan woman who meets Jesus by Jacob’s well. She was out to fetch something in the natural that was not satisfying. Jesus on the other hand had something Spiritual that can fulfill and satisfy. Jesus was not out to minister to her physical needs, natural water, He was out to minister to her spiritual needs. This is why we need to be careful about how we present the gospel as some may come to the kingdom of God based on Jesus meeting their physical needs. We come because He deserves man’s obedience because of what He has done and we desire the spiritual over the natural.

When God begins to work on an individual, He reaches to the heart, that is what responds to His spirit. Vs. 13, we see Jesus witnessing to this woman talking to her about spiritual water to which this woman does not understand but remember her obedience causes the Lord to serve her. In the process of her obedience, thirst for something fulfilling begins to well in her heart, yes it was for the natural, Jesus was ultimately bringing her to understand that what He was talking about was the supernatural. Psalms 42:1, says “As the hart (deer) pants after the water brook so does my soul pant after thee. We should hunger and thirst for righteousness and those we bring to Christ should desire the same. The bible again says that they that hunger and thirst after righteousness shall be filled. We need not to be lukewarm in our living for Christ, every day we should hunger and thirst for His righteousness. This is how we will cultivate more on the fear of the Lord in our lives

Jesus was ready to give this woman the living water but then dealt with something that would not agree with the living water, SIN which called for repentance. Sin hinders one from getting saved and sin also hinders a believer from living spirit filled life. Question to this woman, “vs. 16, “go call your husband, and come here”, This is what I would call exposing one to truth, the bible says again that you shall know the truth and the truth shall set you free. Jesus was confronting her sin by seeking TRUTH. The Lord requires Truth in our inward parts. From obedience, to thirst (willing) and then the truth. Unless we confess our weaknesses, failures, pride, whatever that sin is without covering it or justifying it, we set ourselves for growth. To my amazement, she confessed part of not having a husband and Jesus then reminded her of other 5 husbands she already had before. We can confess some sins, but the Spirit of God will also remind us of those other sins we have not dealt with.

What’s my point this morning, we can be willing but willingness requires facing the truth that exposes sin without rejecting it. God will not anoint lies. Search me oh Lord and know my heart, try me and know my thoughts and see if their be any wicked way in me and bring me into the everlasting life, Psalm 139:23&24.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 4:1-42, … “If you knew the gift of God and who it is that asks you for a drink, you would have asked Him and He would have given you living water.”…

We serve the God of impossibilities, He is an extraordinary God who changes the natural to supernatural. He takes the ordinary and makes it extraordinary. When He is wind, He is moving Wind; when He is waves, He is crushing Waves; when He is fire, He is consuming Fire and when He is water, He is Living Water. He can take any form and be effective in whichever way He plans to move. This is a reason not to limit God in what He can do.

Jesus had been with His disciples for a while, besides being with the disciples, the Pharisees were constantly on His case attacking and challenging Him. On one occasion He was accused of baptizing more disciples than John when in the actual sense He only baptized His disciples. When He hears about this, He embarks on a journey from Judea to go back to Galilee with His disciples but His journey requires Him to pass through Samaria. Stopping there and being exhausted off long walk, He takes a rest by the well Jacob had dug many years before while His disciples went to the city to buy food. It’s so amazing to know that God can appear to anyone at any time in an ordinary place. Here comes a woman to draw water, actually the time of drawing water was not yet but she comes by herself. I can imagine that during this time, women were not used to going to the wells alone, they went in groups. What could prompt this woman to go to the well alone? Maybe her life style caused other women to distance themselves from her.

I truly believe that when the Lord wants to deal with you, at times He needs to meet you alone as there are no distractions when He begins to minister to you. I love when the Lord finds me in a vulnerable state, where I can’t help myself and I know that I have made mistakes and no one is there when I need them then He comes.

When she got to the well, she saw a man sitting by it. I would think that she would run away being that she is the only a woman before a man alone she has never met but she does not. It’s dangerous to be out there by herself but she does not most likely because she had held more men in her life and this Man would be not different from other. She must have been very cunning to talk her way out if need be. That could have been the case but we know Lord knows us better than ourselves, He knows what we are into and what we are vulnerable to. The bible says “that a man cannot come to the Lord unless His Spirit draws him”. No one can manipulate the Lord however good they are at manipulating others. Well the woman appears at an ordinary place, a place she had always come to draw. It doesn’t appear that there had ever been something unusual about the place and of course nothing new was expected to happen on this particular day. I love the way the Lord does surprise us when we least expect Him and when we don’t know how things will happen.

Obedience is the key word to this passage. She is asked of water, it’s not like Jesus had no power to draw water, He wanted to see how she would respond to the natural. Her response causes us to understand that they were self centered people, trained not to serve anyone out of Samaria. She must have been born with this mentality and in her growing up, she always had this in mind. Jesus goes beyond boundaries to minister to people even in the midst of their foolishness. He knows how He can revolutionize a life until he or she becomes a witness to Him everywhere. He knows how to bring down walls and partitions, He will change the surrounding, He will change the atmosphere and the dead will come back to life, the deaf will hear. Hatred, bitterness and resentments will diminish when He deals with them. If the law stops us from knowing and reaching Him, He will come to us. The lost may not know Him but by the time He is done with them they will. Feel like in an ordinary place you come to every day? Do you believe that the Lord could make you whole and different in what you call ordinary? Yes it’s an ordinary place but His presence makes a difference.

Can’t finish today, I will continue in the morning.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 91:1, “He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High, Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty”

Every good and perfect gifts come from God. The bible says, “The earth is the Lord’s and the fullness of it”. He owns it all including the people He created. I’m amazed that we can take the Lord’s doing and call it our own inventions when in reality we are nothing at all. Did I choose to serve the Lord? Or choose to get rid of stuff in my life that were leading me to hell? No, our desire to serve the Lord comes from Him, why, John 15:16, “You did not choose Me, but I chose you”. That is why we don’t accept Christ, He accepts us. Nothing about dealing with the Lord is our inventions, He plans and orchestrate. I thank God for the desire He has put in me to love and serve Him.

When you think of 911, you think of emergency correct? I would call Psalm 91:1 as 911 verse. It originates from the Author of all creation, the maker of the universe and once again He puts a desire in our hearts to do something when we are in trouble. Who do you call when you are in trouble? I love the way it begins, “He who dwells in the secret of the Most High”, Dwelling is living or a permanent residing place. That is where your stuffs are and that is where you have your address. When we travel, we check ourselves in hotels and by morning or after a period of time, we check out to go back to our residing places. They say, “There is no place like home”, true. At home there is comfort, protection, familiarity and you know your way around. How cool it is to be able to have a home in the secret place of the Most High. I must admit many times I have checked in the secret place and by morning checked out. Now the secret place is not an open place but a concealed place beyond ordinary understanding. You may not even explain it yourself when things are happening in your life you have no control over while residing there. He gives us joy, unspeakable joy full of His glory, how do you explain that? you have to experience it. Remember it starts, “Unspeakable”, can you define it or explain it?. His peace passes all understanding, how do you explain this either?, it passes all human understanding. He builds confidence in you to the extent of trusting the One you can’t see, over the one you can see. Once again, how do you explain that? These are some of the things we experience in the secret place.

“…Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty”. Abide is to withstand and wait patiently. When you dial 911, they try to calm you down assuring you that all will be alright. God does the same with His children, He brings them to a place of safety, speaking encouragement. The situation might not change immediately but can we withstand the pressure and patiently wait? the waiting happens under the shadow of the Almighty. There is something about shadows, they tend to appear bigger than the actual object. Imagine God present then His shadow, what a presentation of Himself. I remember a song with this line, “I’m going to hide right under the blood, where the devil can do me no harm”. If the devil wants to attack me while under the shadow (blood), He has to go through my Heavenly Father and He will not prevail. Just at the mention of Christ’s name, the devil trembles. Whatever you are facing and dealing with this morning, He is putting a desire in your heart to dial Psalm 91:1 for there is safety within.

FYI -1. It’s been hard of late to share devo everyday especially the days when I am very busy at work, or out of the office or dry. Do keep me in prayers that I may faithfully share with you all as the Lord enables me. 2. Continue to pray for the persecuted Christians in India. May God hide His children under the shadow of His wings.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Chapter 2:1, “Then Jonah prayed to the Lord His God from the fish’s belly. And he said:, “I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice”. Amen, out of the belly of the fish cried I to the Lord. Out of the mess I got myself into cried I unto the Lord and He heard me and answered me. God had every right to reject Jonah’s prayers but His love is an everlasting love and if we call on Him, He will answer us. Being in the belly of the fish reminded him that God was always there with him and that is why he could call and be heard. That was a place of humility where he would say, “Lord is not about me but about you”, WHEN YOU CALL ME, I WILL ANSWER; WHERE YOU LEAD ME I WILL FOLLOW; WHERE YOU SEND ME I WILL GO; WHEN YOU NEED ME, I WILL BE AVAILABLE AND WHEN YOU FIND ME, I WILL BE DOING SOMETHING FOR YOU. Read it for yourself and you will see how he was vomited and he takes the assignment with dignity and humility.

So lets find out why Jonah decided to run from the presence of God. Being that Nineveh was a wicked city, God had passed a judgment that the city would be destroyed in 40 days. Jonah’s mission was to come and preach this message to a people who had mistreated his people. He was to preach judgment to his enemies and expect them to be destroyed but he knew better. He knew that if he preached, they would repent and God would grant them mercy, he didn’t want God to grant them mercy.

When he was in his own mess that required God’s judgment, God granted him mercy instead. Mercy rejoices over judgment. The Ninevites needed to hear the truth and be converted and a man who understood God’s mercy was the man to bring the message. I believe with all my heart that we will never desire and have a passion to preach to the Ninevites (lost souls) until we have understood what we’ve been saved from, how we deserved the wrath of God because of our sin and yet in the midst of our rebellion, He showed us mercy, saved us and granted us everlasting life..

Do we have to hit rock bottom to cry out to God? Do we call on Him when things are bearable? do we desire to see the lost come to a place of grace, mercy and pardon just as we did receive it, or would we careless as long as we are saved and going to heaven. HE HAS CALLED ME, I NEED TO ANSWER TO THE CALL.

What is our calling? We are not called to be preachers, missionaries, pastors, prayer warriors and the like, we are called to be FOLLOWERS OF CHRIST, picking up our cross and following Him daily, dying to self, being crucified with Christ. The calling in our lives is to be obedient to God, to give Him the worship He deserves, to honor Him, to live a holy and righteous life. Being a pastor, preacher, missionary is a response to the call of obedience, it’s a demonstration of our service to Him.

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jonah 1-4, “And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice”

Chapter 1:17, “Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights”. I have met people who blame God for what they brought upon themselves. People who did terrible things that landed them even in jail and yet they stood to blame God. “why did God do this to me or why did God allow this to happen to me?”. It’s the choice made by an individual that will cause them to either suffer or be safe. In this case, though Jonah brings all the calamities upon himself and deserves to die, in the midst of his foolishness God was still gracious to him.

Now you might say how was God gracious to him if He had prepared a great fish to swallow him? Someone else would also say, how was God gracious when he allowed you to go to prison or be down and broken, well let me tell you, something worse than where you were could have happened but His hand of mercy kept you from the worst of worse. It’s not that they could not happen, He kept them from happening. I am not better than those who have already gone to an early grave, the worst could have happened to me too but he preserved me even in the mess I was in. Jonah could have drowned without repenting and we don’t know what could have happened to him in eternity. Being that he was in the sea, he could had been torn into pieces by the sea creatures but God preserved his life by allowing a great fish to swallow him that eventually he will bring him to a place of repentance.

Jonah acted what Jesus would do many years after his incident. Even in his foolishness and not knowing what he was doing, he was acting what Jesus would do. Jonah being in the belly of the fish three days and three nights shows what Jesus did when He died on the cross and was buried. He was in the tomb three days and on that third day He rose again and became a victor over death. While we are still on the subject of being swallowed by fish, Jonah was covered by a lot of yucky stuff, he is in a place of no freedom, nothing to eat, dark place, can’t move and he is not aware of where he is apart from knowing he is swallowed. I think this is the time when people appreciate what they had before they landed in the worst places. I bet a lot of things were going through Jonah’s mind while in the belly of the fish. He had a chance to repent but he blew it, he almost drowned but God was still there to show him love and mercy. He began to evaluate his life and how he had made it this far by the grace of God. God still loves His people and will always fight for them even when they fail because HIS LOVE IS NOT BASED ON WHAT WE DID BUT WHAT HE’S SON DID ON THE CROSS. Romans 5:8, “But God demonstrates His love towards us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us”. In the midst of Jonah’s rebellion, God still preserved him. To finish

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jonah 1-4, “And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice”

When Jonah was woken out of his sleep, all the men decided to cast lots to see who was the reason for the obstacle. Many knew that any time something was not happening right, most likely someone had sinned and the only way they could deal with it was to zero out the victim and deal with that sin so as to have peace again. The situation would not change until the issue was dealt with. It’s even with us today, many of our prayers will not be answered even though they may be genuine until sin is dealt with in our lives. We cannot shout on top of sin, we got to deal with it. 1John 1:8, “If we say we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us”, meaning that if we say we have no sin, we are calling Him a liar. Sin for sure will hinder us from getting where the Lord wants us to be. Jonah began to explain how and why he ran from the presence of the Lord after refusing to take the assignment he had been given. The men in the ship were suffering for the sake of someone’s sin.

Chapter 1:12, “And he said unto them, take me up, and cast me forth into the sea; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you”. Surprisingly enough, he has shared with the men in the ship about what he has done, he is in a position to repent and allow God to forgive him but instead, he wants people to drown him. He is not even taking the responsibility of jumping himself, he want others to do it for him. The bible says the Lord is good and gracious, slow to anger, He rescues them that call upon His name. 1John 1:9, “But if we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us of all our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness”. Well we could say that Jonah is tough headed but while we are at it, how many times have I messed up and when I had a chance to repent and be cleansed again I ignored and kept on trying to run away from Him? We have been talking about trying to run away from His presence but let’s use something in the natural to strengthen it, when I was young, that is about 18 years ago, at sunrise, I could see my shadow just before me or behind me. Many times I tried to run away from my shadow but could never escape from it for it was always with me. When received Christ, His light was shone upon us and we saw Him as He is and we can never escape His presence. You might say that I haven’t seen the light yet, well His presence is always with you, the light gives the proof that He never leaves us.

Chapter 1:13, “Nevertheless the men rowed hard to bring it to the land: but they could not: for the sea wrought, and was tempestuous against them”. Instead of the men even encouraging Jonah to repent and be saved, they tried their human effort to bring the ship to the land safely by fighting the waves. Pause for a second, God is in control here and men want to be their own god, lead themselves to safety without His help, trying hard to do what only God can do? I’m not surprised, we always do the same trying to do it in another way when we know the right way to do it. Trying to escape from the responsibility we got to deal with. So they failed to beat God in His game and Jonah is thrown into the sea. I ask myself a question here, was he willing to die just because of his disobedience? Are we willing to suffer more because we have refused to repent? God could loose His patience with those whom He has shown it all and have refused to repent and put their trust in Christ alone for their eternal salvation.

We know that it’s not by might nor by power but by His Spirit says the Lord Zech 4:6, it’s a simple as that, in as much as we might try and fix it ourselves like the men in the ship, it will not work out for we are trying to fix the spiritual stuff through the flesh.

To continue

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jonah 1-4, “And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice”

Yesterday we looked at the first verse of the first chapter of the book of Jonah. We looked at three important keys Word, Arise and Go. Like I mentioned yesterday, there are times where God will give us a certain assignment to accomplish and if you know about assignments, they are at times short term or long term but the key word to accomplishing the assignment is being faithful till the end.

Let’s look at what Jonah did when he received an assignment. Vs. 3, “But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the Lord…” Jonah should have know very well that you can never run a way from the presence of the Lord, God is ever present everywhere. Psalm 139 talks about how God knows us from the beginning to the end, He knows when we sit and when we stand, He is familiar with our ways. David continues to say, “Lord if I put my bed in heaven, there you are, and if I put my bed in hell, there you are and if I took the wings of the morning and ascended to the uttermost parts of the earth, You will still be there”. Right now there are many who are trying to run away from God. They know they are being convicted sin and instead of obeying the Lord, they have decided to run away from the presence of the Lord like Jonah. May I remind us this morning that what God has designed for us to do, no one else will come and do it on our behalf. We can run all we want but eventually we will have to answer to that call. John 15:16, “You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that you should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain” We did not choose Him, He chose us for a reason and for a purpose. You might say, “well it’s me who decided to follow Christ, I walked to the altar, I said the sinners prayer and I got saved”. The truth of the matter is, when you gave your life to Christ, He chose you, put the right words in your heart, convicted you and caused you to see that the things which you always thought were foolish were actually good news. The bible says, “a man cannot come to the Lord unless the Spirit draws him” . We can’t make people saved and declare them saved because they said the sinner’s prayer. The sinner’s prayer does not save anyone, it’s the Holy Spirit that does the conviction, conversion and assurance.

Jonah boarded a ship to go the opposite direction for he has his own good reasons for not responding to the call. Well everything seams to be going on well as planned by him but God will not let you do the opposite when He has a plan to save and deliver yourself and many. God wasn’t going to allow Jonah to abandon the assignment and let a whole city go to hell simply because he did not want to do it (he wanted God to pass a judgment). So what did the Lord do, even in the midst of Jonah’s foolishness, He is still demonstrating His power, number one to get Jonah know who the Boss is and number two to turn the hearts of some men who were worshiping idols. vs. 4&5, “But the Lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea, so that the ship was like to be brake. Then the mariners were afraid, and cried every man unto his god, and cast forth the luggage that were in the ship into the sea, to lighten it for them. But Jonah was gone down into the sides of the ship; and he lay and was fast a sleep”. Our disobedience can make many suffer. We may be comfortable somewhere but someone somewhere will be hurting simply because of what we did or did not do. Remember in the OT, if one man sinned, the whole family suffered. Thank God, even the midst of our foolishness, God remains faithful. Watch something here, the men in the ship prayed to their gods, and their gods could not save them, they tried the human effort of getting rid of some stuff in their ship, but still that did not work out and let’s look at vs. 6, “so the shipmaster came to him (Jonah), and said unto him, what do you mean, O sleeper? Arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not”. Amazing right, we see men who never called on the true God, they meet a man of God for the anointing of God was upon him and I bet that is how they could tell that he worshiped the true God and they said to him, “call upon thy God”. Romans 10:13, “Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved, Psalm 18:3, “I will call upon the Lord who is worthy to be praised so shall I be saved from my enemies”.

I thank God that even in the midst of my foolishness He still shows Himself mighty around me and through me that many may know Him. Jonah may have not known that “All things are working together for good to them that love God and to them that are called”. It will cost him dearly for the disobedience but the work will still have to be done and God would be glorified. Remember when David sinned having committed adultery with Bathsheba, even in his failure, God had prepared something good out of it. Yes He suffered the consequences but out of that marriage, Solomon was born to become the wisest and a rich man. God does not want anyone to fall but if we do, He has already prepared something good in the midst of our failure. To continue

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jonah 1-4, “And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice”

When you begin to read the book of Jonah, you discover that there is a specific task God gave Jonah to be completed. We are not told of who Jonah was, his calling, how he grew up. We are also not told of how he aged and died, we are only told of his assignment, his reaction and his action. I believe that there are certain times in life where God will give us an assignment at times for a given period of time for He has desired to do something during a certain time of assignment. Sometimes in 98, I was given an assignment to pray for schools. During that time there was so much going on in schools and God laid a burden in some hearts including mine to seriously pray for schools. What I am saying is when God gives an assignment, He has already set up enough grace, strength and the ability for one to do it.

Chapter 1:1, “Now the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the son of Amittai saying, Arise, go to Nineveh, that city, great city and cry against it; for their wickedness is come up before me”. We are introduced to some neat things in just verse one to which we will break it down as time goes by. The word of the Lord is present meaning alive everyday. It’s always a now word for the Lord Himself is the Word. We hear Him introduce Himself as the “I AM” in the bible. Hebrews 4:12, “The word of the Lord is living and powerful…” we see it again as not a dead word or a word that will live but a word that is already living and this is the word that comes to Jonah. Number one point, the WORD coming, after the word comes, the first instruction in the word is ARISE. I would interpret as coming out of what someone has been in because of the word and making the first move by obeying the voice. Then GO which is to change of locations by allowing a motion to take place.

The three, WORD, ARISE and GO are very familiar to us in the bible for we see the Lord constantly using them when getting ready to do something. He is always in the business of speaking and in His speaking there are clear instructions as to what is to be done. We also have this kind of calling in our lives where the word comes, we arise and we go. The bible says , “go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature”. We don’t hear about “sit ye”, it says “go ye”. My flesh loves the “sit ye part” but that is not the instructions. The words of the Lord are always action (doing) words for He is constantly on the move, He is always doing something and we are part of these things He is doing. Ready to move?

To be continued…

Thanks

Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 7:1-20, “And there were four leprous men at the entering in of the gate: and they said one to another, why sit we here until we die?”

We want to see things happen in our lives, We want to see a progress, a growth. No one wants to be in the same place forever. At times we don’t see those things being manifested in our lives but hear them being mentioned by someone else. Has anyone ever come to you and told you of something good happening in your life you were not aware of? In the process of learning these things, you wonder how the Lord can show someone else something that He is doing in your life without you really knowing.

2Kings 7 introduces us to Four men, leprous, outcast, no signs of hope that they can be healed, living at the entrance of the gate. Weak, no relationships, no destiny, no dreams to mention a few. What can you do or say when all that was going well all of a sudden get crumbled because of a new development. I believe that before they had leprosy, they had good families, dreams, desires, visions and the like but with the new development, what else to live for? Ever heard some type of experience that shook everything you believed in, stood for and desired to accomplish?

Listen to their reasoning, vs. 3, “…and they said to one another, “Why are we sitting here until we die”. This is what I call initiating a move. I have been in some situations where I waited for the Lord to say a word and He did not, all He needed for me to do was initiate a move and He would take over. When David faced Goliath, that was his move and so was Peter when he saw Jesus at a distance and desired to walk on water. These lepers knew their condition and understood that everyone was affected by famine but that would not change what they were about to do. They made a move which did not mean everything was going to be fine but meant changing location, doing something different. If they stayed, they would die anyway, if they moved there was a possibility of either dying in the hands of the enemy after surrendering or being made slaves and get food.

Vs. 5, “And they rose at twilight to go to the camp of the Syrians (enemy); and when they came to the outskirts of the Syrian camp, to their surprise no one was there. vs. 6, for the Lord had caused the army of the Syrians to hear the noise of chariots and noise of horses, … the great army so they said to another, “Look, the king of Israel has hired against us the kings …. to attack us, vs. 7, “Therefore they rose (Syrians) and fled at twilight”, This is the core of the message today, THE LORD MAGNIFIED THE SOUND OF THE FEET OF FOUR WEAK, SICK MEN THAT THEY SOUNDED LIKE A MIGHTY ARMY. When something is magnified, it does not change it’s size or the look of it, it just allows the person looking at it to see it bigger or sound mightier than it’s usual size. Watch this, the four men’s condition did not change, but the initiative move allowed God to cause someone else to hear them coming as an army because He had magnified them. What I’m I saying, there are moves when you make, even when your condition does not change, I believe God will still magnify you in the presence of people. That may not mean you change, it may mean people see the greater one in you. The four men came to the camp and found no one but good stuff. What they did not know that God was involved, He magnified the sound of their feet.

I am not a risk taker for sure, but I tend to initiate many things in line with God’s word and many times He has blessed them. Don’t wait till you’ve got everything in place before you move, your blessing could be in the move you make. God has a way of magnifying the sound of the feet of those He has called. You may not see it or feel like, but He will cause someone else to hear it.

Thanks

Ev

title.rendered: I Am A Soldier In The Army of God, Submitted by Theresa Vinola

content.rendered:
Good morning,



(one the most classic inspirational quotes) I am a soldier in the army of God. The Lord Jesus Christ is my commanding officer. The Holy Bible is my Code of Conduct. Faith, prayer, and the Word are my weapons of warfare. I have been taught by the Holy Spirit, trained by experience, tried by adversity and tested by fire.

I am a volunteer in this army and I am enlisted for eternity. I will either retire in this army at the rapture or die in this army; but I will not get out, sell out, be talked out, or pushed out. I am faithful, reliable, capable and dependable. If my God needs me, I am there. Good morning,

Philippians 4:6&7, “… and the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your heart and minds through Christ Jesus”

One of the things that has taught me how the Lord grants us peace is while being driven by someone who I know how they drive and trust their driving. Of all my brothers, only Kefa I trust his driving. When he is driving, I can doze off and relax. I know his driving and that is why I could relax and doze off because number one, he knows what he is doing and he is good at it and number two, he know where we were going. With that knowledge, I have peace in side.

The world craves for peace. You can give love but I don’t think you can give peace, you can speak it but that is about it. This is one of the greatest tools people need in their life. Many suicides take place because the victims most of the time do not have peace within. Peace in the home, at work, in marriage. What is peace? Peace is to be calm, quiet, still, silence, harmony. In other words, peace is the absence of war. Without peace, chaos, frustrations and confusion erupt and the devil is the enemy against peace. If he can steal away your peace, he knows he would have stripped you of something very important and powerful.

True peace originates from God. Let’s look at three types of Peace. PEACE WITH GOD, PEACE IN GOD, and PEACE OF GOD. Romans 5:1, “Therefore, having been justified by faith, we have PEACE WITH GOD through our Lord Jesus Christ”. This is the kind of peace we have when we receive Christ, in other words the war between us and God is over. We are no longer children under his wrath. When I am not in Christ, I am an enemy of God and the only way to settle it is repentance and faith.

Romans 15:13, “Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and PEACE IN BELIEVING, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost”. This is peace in God knowing that I have hope and joy for I have escaped the wrath to come, I’ve passed from death to life. This is also peace knowing that I am no longer alone cause He lives in me. My peace comes from knowing that one day when this life is over, I will be with Him in heaven and not in hell.

My message is on peace of God, Philippians 4:7, “… and the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your heart and minds through Christ Jesus”. This is the kind of peace we need everyday to sustain us through everything. I don’t see how one can truly have the peace of God without first going through “peace with God” and “peace in God”. Peace of God is what we need when we have overwhelming situations, things getting out of control and out of place. Having the Lord take over as the driver and you sleep through His driving is “peace of God”. Your knowledge of who He is and what He is cable of gives you peace inside. Psalm 34:8, “O, taste and see that the Lord is good, blessed is the man who trusts in Him”. Peace comes through trusting. This is not even your peace but the peace of God. The funny thing is that you can feel it but can never explain it. You can see all hell breaking loose, instead of crying and throwing things, you smile because you have peace of God. This peace acts like a soothing pill or I could also call it a pain killer but I would say that it does far beyond killing pain, it also treats the pain. Like the bible puts it, it surpasses all understanding.

How do I get this peace, Philippians 4:6, “Be anxious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving, make your request be known to God”, stop worrying and trying to dictate God and believe that He’s got it covered. Surrender everything to Him through prayers and take the back seat, don’t forget to thank Him for what He is doing and what He will do, then go to sleep, rest, relax, be calm, Psalms 46:10, “Be still (be at peace) and know He is God”. How do I maintain this peace, Isaiah 26:3, “You will keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on You, because he trusts in You”. This is what I call meditation, Paul continues to write in Philippians 4:8, “whatsoever things are true…noble…just…pure…lovely…good report, if there is any virtue and if there is anything praiseworthy, meditate on this things”. You keep the peace by meditating on the things of God. If you have no “peace with God” and “peace in God” ask yourself, where are you heading to? If you lack “peace of God” in what you are going through, ask of Him and when it comes, by all means maintain it. The peace of God will sustain you through everything, the situation may not change immediately but having peace to go through it will bring you joy and not happiness. Peace of God will pull you together but chaos from the devil will tear you into pieces. Without the peace of God, you will be torn into pieces. Have a peaceful weekend Evans

Thanks

Ev
